loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Sebastiana; ella tiene 34 años de edad, conviviente  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia tiene su taller de pintura en su casa, ella pinta y después lo vende a sus amigos,familiares ,vecinos y a las personas que le solicitan, a la vez la socia lleva sus pinturas fuera de cusco a sus demás clientes. 

La  socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales para que siga realizando su arte que es la pintura.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
[Sebastiana] is a member of the “Vamos Juntos” (Let’s Go Together) communal bank, located in the Cusco district, within the Cusco department and province.

Sebastiana is 34 years old.  She is in a cohabitating relationship, has two children, and has an art studio (painting) in her home.  She creates paintings and then sells them to her family, friends, neighbors, and other people who request them.  She also takes her paintings to her customers outside of Cusco.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies so that she can continue painting.

Our associate appreciates those persons who help make this dream possible through this means and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma A. is from the village of Tumbao, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 53 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Vilma owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.  The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Vilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like beverages & instant noodles. This loan will be Vilma's  2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like beverages & instant noodles

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Madres Coraje  del distrito de Calleria departamento de Ucayali, tiene 30 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, su esposo trabaja en construcción civil.
Ya que los ingresos de su esposo no son suficientes ha decido poner un pequeño negocio de venta de  productos comestibles (bodega)que poco a poco está implementando.
Rosa es la que atiende en su negocio que está en su misma casa y que le permite al mismo tiempo poder estar cerca a sus hijos pequeños, de esa manera puede contribuir con los ingresos a su hogar y después distribuirlos para hacer los pagos de los servicios básicos del hogar.
Con éste préstamo de S/.1,000.00 comprará productos para surtir un poco mas su negocio, comprará 1 paquete de sal, 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 2 paquetes de fideo, 1 caja de aceite, ½ caja de vinagre, ½ caja de sillao, 3 tiras de sazonadores, 1 bolsa de detergente, 2 paquetes de papel higiénico, 10 kilos de papa, 3 kilos de cebolla, 2 kilos de tomate y otros productos más.
La señora Rosa desea seguir trabajando con Manuela Ramos y así poder seguir apoyando a su esposo para mejorar la situación económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa is a member of the communal bank Madres Coraje in the Calleria district, department of Ucayali.  She is 30 years old, married and has 2 children.  Her husband works in civil construction.   Since her husband's income is not sufficient, she decided to start her own small business selling grocery products and, little by little, business is picking up.  Rosa runs her store out of her house.  This allows her to be near her young children and to contribute to the household income and pay for basic services.  

She is requesting a loan of S/.1,000.00 to purchase merchandise in order to increase her stock a bit more.  She will buy 1 package of salt, 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 2 packages of noodles, 1 case of oil, 1/2 case of vinegar, 1/2 case of soy sauce, seasonings, 1 bag of detergent, 2 packages of toilet paper, 10 kilos of potatoes, 3 kilos of onions, 2 kilos of tomatoes and other products.  Señora Rosa wants to continue working with Manuela Ramos in order to be able to continue supporting her husband and improve their family's financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Nelius

texts.en: Nelius is 27 years old, married and blessed with one child.  She has been running a beauty salon for three years.  She has managed to grow her business since she joined Faulu Kenya.  She hopes to open a wholesale cosmetic shop in the future.  She has requested 40,000 KES to buy hair weaves, shampoos and hair oil.

loans.use: To buy hair weaves, shampoos and hair oil

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta, 42 years old, is a married woman from the town of Trinidad. She has no children and prays to have her own someday. Julieta owns a sari-sari store. She sells shampoo, soy sauce and other various products. Her husband operates a "habal-habal" (motorcycle) transport service.

Julieta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and for motorcycle repair. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve her business.

loans.use: Stock for sari-sari store and motorcycle repair.

loans.name: Jyparkul's Group

texts.en:
The flora of Kyrgyzstan is rich and varied due to the geographical location of the country. It has extraordinary masterpieces and accounts for more than 4,500 species of superior plants. Kyrgyzstan can be called a wonder of nature. Some very popular native flowers of this country are Tulip Grage, Tulips Kolpakovskiy, Tulip Bulbs Ilium, Gentiana Flowers and Perennials. 

Jyparkul K., 47, is the treasurer of this group. Flowers have been her passion for many years. She thinks she inherited this love from her mother, who was a professional florist. Every early spring Jyparkul paves the way for planting seeds of various types of tulips, roses and her favorite narcissus. April and May brings unbelievable beauty to her garden, which she expands every year. The whole neighborhood is amazed with Jyparkul’s flowers and asks her advice concerning all sowing processes. 

A year ago she talked her husband into starting to sell flowers in a local flower market. Soon the business prospered and attracted even foreign customers’ interest. Now it earns up to $170 a month and helps her provide her six children with daily necessities. In the future she plans to diversify her assortment and try to mix in some new types of flowers. She plans to spend the profits generated from this loan to purchase a small piece of land. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a wider assortment of flower seed

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
La Sra. Otilia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Aguerridas II”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Está Casada, tiene 52  años y es madre de 04 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes.  

Otilia, se dedica a la Venta de ropa de segunda mano. Por lo que cuenta con  clientes fijos que ya la conocen y saben de su negocio. También va de casa en casa a ofrecer su  mercadería a sus amistades más cercanas, así como a los pueblos aledaños semanalmente. La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza le ayudo a crecer como mujer independiente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado, ya que genera sus propios ingresos, que lo utiliza para cancelar sus cuotas mensuales de su banco comunal. Otilia es una mujer emprendedora y a su edad se siente capaz de seguir ejerciendo su negocio.

Con este crédito de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará ropas en fardos como: pantalones en diferentes colores, shorts, snikers, blusas en todas las tallas y modelos, polos y vestidos para damas, caballeros y  niños. 

Agradece la oportunidad que le ofrece el Movimiento Manuela Ramos de  contar con los préstamos que la ayudan a desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Ms. Otilia belongs to the "Las Aguerridas II" ("The Brave Women II") Communal Bank in the district of Tarapoto, Province and Department of San Martín.  She is married, 52 years old, and the mother of four children who are all independent now.

Otilia sells second-hand clothing. She counts on regular customers who she knows and who are familiar with her business. She also goes house-to-house offering her merchandise to her friends nearby, and travels weekly to adjacent villages. The fortitude and perseverance that characterize her also help her to grow as an independent woman, and she is very proud of what she has achieved. She is generating her own income, which she uses to make her monthly repayments to her communal bank. Otilia is a very enterprising woman and at her age she feels capable of continuing with her business.

She will use this loan of 1,200 nuevos soles to buy bales of clothing for women, men, and children, such as: different colors of pants, shorts, sneakers, blouses in every size and style, polo shirts, and dresses.

She is grateful for the opportunity offered by Movimiento Manuela Ramos, whose loans are helping her to develop as a woman and small business owner.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing

loans.name: Las Del Río (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las del Rió está conformado por 13 mujeres quienes viven en  comunidades alrededor de la parroquia de Jadan, esta lugar  tiene una  belleza natural, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, mucha de su gente también labora en la ciudad. Nuestras socias con sus diferentes trabajos ayudan a que sus hogares salgan adelante, son mujeres alegres y trabajadoras.

La Señora. Clara Dolores J. vive por la parroquia de Jadan, se encuentra en su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su vecina a formar parte de este grupo. 
Tiene 37 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos de 19, 18, 13, 11, 9 años y  sus dos últimos hijos que  son gemelos tienen  un año y cuatro meses de edad, su primer hijo   trabaja y ayuda en la economía del hogar, su segundo y tercer hijo estudian en el colegio, su cuarto hijo en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción ya que es maestro albañil, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
Doña Clara Dolores tiene una tienda hace 10 años, labora en ella de domingo a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, también se dedica a la cría de animales como: borregos, cuyes, gallinas y chanchos que los vende en su comunidad. 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más productos para su tienda y así crecer un poco más. Su meta es tener un galpón de pollos.

La Señora. María Eulalia J. vive en la comunidad del progreso de Jadan, se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal.
Tiene 36 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos de  20, 18, 16, 14, 9 y 6 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos trabajan y ayudan en la economía del hogar, su cuarta hija estudia en colegio y sus dos últimos hijos están en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo labora como albañil y también de agricultor, no tiene casa propia y viven cuidando  una casa.
Doña María Eulalia se dedica al cuidado de una casa, actividad que la realiza hace 8 años en donde labora en la agricultura, también se dedica a la cría de animales como: cuyes, chanchos, ganado y gallinas a los que vende en su propia comunidad.
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The communal bank Las del Rió is made up of 13 women who live in the surrounding communities of the Jadan parish. This place has a natural beauty and the people work raising animals and in agriculture. Many of the people also work in the city. Our members, each with their different jobs, are helping their households to get ahead. They are happy and hard-working women.

Mrs. Clara Dolores J. lives in the Jadan parish and this is her first loan in the communal bank after being invited by her neighbour to join the group. She is 37 years old, married, and has 7 children aged 19, 18, 13, 11, and 9, and her two youngest children are one year and four month old twins. Her oldest son works and helps the household economy. Her second and third sons are in high school, and her fourth son goes to a primary school in the city. Her husband works in construction and is a master builder. Through both of their work they have managed to build their own house. Clara Dolores has had a store for 10 years. She works there from Sunday to Sunday and from 7 in the morning to 9 at night. She also raises animals such as sheep, guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs that she sells in her community. She is going to invest the money from her loan in the purchase of more products for her store to grow a little more. Her goal is to have a barn for her chickens.  

Mrs. María Eulalia J. lives in the community of Jadan and this is the second loan she has requested from the communal bank. She is 36 years old, married and has 6 children 20, 18, 16, 14, 9, and 6 years old. Her three oldest children work and help the household economy. Her fourth daughter goes to high school and her two youngest children go to a local primary school. Her husband works as a builder as well as a farmer. They do not have their own house and live by taking care of a house. Maria Eulalia works as a housekeeper. An activity she has done for 8 years, and where she works in agriculture. She also raises animals such as guinea pigs, pigs, cattle, and chickens which she sells in her community. She is going to invest the money from her loan in the purchase of guinea pigs. Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, basic products and guinea pigs

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es: Rogelio es padre de casa de 42 años. Vive con su esposa y tres hijos en casa propia en la ciudad de Morropon en Piura, a unas cuatro horas de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Desde hace más de 10 años, gana su vida como obrero de campo. Es muy responsable en sus deberes laborales. Este trabajo le ayuda solventar sus gastos familiares. Actualmente, su casa se encuentra en un estado deteriorado. Desea hacer unos arreglos a ella lo que ayudará mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Rogelio  es muy conocido en la zona y posee buenas referencias laborales y personales de su comunidad. Es un cliente recurrente de Edpyme Alternativa y siempre cumple con sus obligaciones de deuda en una manera puntual.
texts.en:
Rogelio is 42 years old.  He lives with his wife and three children in his own home in the city of Morropón, in Piura, four hours from Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region. 

For more than 10 years, Rogelio has earned his living by working as a farm laborer.  He is very responsible in his work and his work helps him to cover his family's expenses.

Rogelio's home is currently in a bad state of repair.  He would like to carry out some repairs which will help improve his family's quality of life.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  Rogelio is very well known in his area and has good work references and personal references from his community.  He is a long-standing client of Edpyme Alternativa and always makes his loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to make some home repairs

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 44 year-old  married woman with 2 children, aged 10 and 15. Lilian and her husband are both farmers. They till their land for planting rice crops. Lilian's husband mainly manages the farm and she also helps in keeping it productive. She also sells RTW clothes to the people in her community.

Lilian's loan will be used to purchase farm inputs, like fertilizers and seeds. Lilian hopes to earn more and be able to provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two young children. The children are still attending school. She has been working as a beautician for the last eight years and opened her own beauty salon in 2009. She offers different beauty services such as make up, laser, hair removal etc.  She has a part-time employee who helps her accomplish the work. Women continue to play an important role in Lebanese society, especially in the development of the family. Women are able to serve as strong role models for their children while also helping to supplement their household incomes. In almost all parts of Lebanon, demand for beauty and fashion products continues to be high. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more beauty products. In that way, she will be able to serve more customers and therefore increase her income. She has high hopes for the future of her business.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products

loans.name: Batkhuyag

texts.en:
Mr.Batkhuyag is 53 years old. He lives with his wife and three of his children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has 5 children, but the two eldest ones are married and live separately. Bathuyag has a job contract with a tourist company. He owns a minivan, which he uses to transport tourists to the countryside.

Batkhuyag owns a plot of land and recently he completed the building of a family house. Now he is working on his garden. He likes growing different plants and fruits in his garden. He is applying for a loan to buy sea buck thorn trees to plant in his garden. These trees give yellow berries that are rich in vitamin C and they can stand the very cold winter. A lots of people grow and harvest sea buck thorn berries and sell them to pharmaceutical companies for money. For 1 kilo of raw berries, on the vegetable market, the cost is around 6000 Mongolian tugriks (around 5USD).

loans.use: To buy sea buckthorn trees and to plant them on his land to harvest the berries.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia is 60 years old, married and has one child. She works hard to help provide for her family by running a sari-sari (or variety) store, and is applying for a new loan, for PHP 12,000, to buy more items to sell to her customers. She has repaid three previous loans from NWTF and plans to use the money she makes from this one to continue expanding her business, which is now one year old.

loans.use: To buy additional goods to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Zahira Yazmín

texts.es:
La señora Zahira Yazmín y su esposo el señor Abel son padres de familia y tiene dos hijos de mediana edad, les quieren dar seguridad y tranquilidad de su casa. 
Están solicitando un préstamo para poder continuar con la construcción de la barda de su casa, el gasto que esto implica es alto, para poder cubrirlo con el salario diario, requieren de su apoyo para comprar los materiales y pagarle a la persona que se encargará de elaborar la barda. 

Pagará el préstamo con el sueldo que recibe el señor Abel de su trabajo como empleado de una tienda. Con su ayuda poco a poco dejarán un mejor patrimonio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Zahira and Abel are parents; they have two young children that they want to provide security and protection for.  They are asking for a loan to be able to make the wall around their house higher.  But, they don’t have the necessary money to buy the materials, cement and concrete blocks, and to pay labor costs to the person who will erect the wall.

She plans to pay the loan with the salary Abel earns as a store employee.  They hope to improve their children’s patrimony and that it have better conditions and be secure for them.

loans.use: to continue construction on a wall outside of her home.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob, age 42, runs a timber workshop in Bombolulu, Mombasa. His business thas been in operation for the last six years. He and his wife have three children. 

Jacob is an existing KADET client and this will be the second loan he has accessed to help finance his business. With this loan, he plans to purchase more timber to use for making furniture to offer for sale. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to support his family. 

His dream is to own a chain of timber workshops in future.

loans.use: to purchase more timber to use for making furniture to offer for sale

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian, a 26-year-old mother of three children ranging in age from one to six, is married to a driver. Lillian has been selling mobile phones for the past eight years, during which time she has been able to expand her business and meet the needs of her family.

Now requesting a loan to buy more phones to sell in order to make more profits, Lillian plans to use those profits to begin building a house on the piece of land she recently bought.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones for sale.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa works hard to support her family. Elisa is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Elisa requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more ingredients for her business. Elisa has been in this business for 25 years now.

In the future, Elisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Anta, perteneciente a la provincia D. Anta,  y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gregoria; ella tiene 71 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. queso, ella venD. en la provincia D. Limatambo y también se dedica a la agricultura donD. siembra maíz y papa y luego lo venD. en las distintas ferias que existe, la socia prepara los quesos y lo venD. en forma ambulatoria, por medio D. estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio D. venta D. queso y mejorar el negocio  D. agricultura. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar los quesos como leche y también para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para las tierras D. agricultura.
 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Gregoria, 71, belongs to the “Mujeres en Accion” (Women in Action) communal bank located in Anta District that belongs to Anta Province and Cusco Department.

She is married and has four children.  She alternates her daily chores with a cheese selling business.  She sells in Limatambo Province and she’s also a farmer that grows corn and potatoes that are later sold in the various markets that take place.  She is a street vendor of delicious cheeses she makes.  Through these small businesses she’s able to move her children forward.  She’d like to expand the cheese selling business and improve her farming so is asking for a loan to buy cheese making supplies, like milk, and also to buy seed and fertilizer for her farmland.

She is happy with the loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy cheese making supplies and to buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sreytouch

texts.en: Sreytouch, 28 years old, is a groceries seller. Her husband is a teacher and their income is $7 per day. She has one child who is two years old. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on transportation, and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy grocery goods to sell. She has been doing this career for about 10 years already, so she has a lot of customers. That's why she needs to buy more goods to sell. In the future, she wants to expand her career now so that she can sell more kinds of goods to serve her customers.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Bonny

texts.en:
Bonny is a 48 year-old married man with three children, living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to build a permanent house for his family. He is a farmer and also sells produce for a living.  His major challenge is always lack of man power to farm on a large scale.  His dream is to practice mechanized farming.  

Bonny needs the loan to buy produce, and also onion plants.

loans.use: To buy produce and onion plants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en: Moussa is a 31-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and two school-aged children. He has been running a clothing store since 2004. He always presents the newest clothes collections in order to attract more customers to his shop. He is the main income source of the family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to expand his store’s inventory for the coming winter season. He says the loan will help him diversify his merchandise selection. In the future, he is hoping to sell shoes by adding a corner in his store for this purpose.

loans.use: to expand his store’s inventory

loans.name: Norma  Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Norma es una persona trabajadora  y  responsable , con  esfuerzo  día  con  día    pudo adquirir   su casa , ella  se  preocupa por  brindarles a   sus pequeños   hijos   la mejor estabilidad, es  por  ello  que   se acerco  con  nosotros  para    realizar  su proyecto  ,  el cual consiste   en    ampliar   la  plata  baja  de su  casa, ve  en el crédito  la posibilidad  de  ofrecer  a  sus  hijos  un  excelente   patrimonio  , además  de  que  sus   familiares  y  amigos  estén  mas  cómodos   cuando  la  visitan,  es  por  ello  que esta   agradecida  por  habernos  encontrando.
texts.en:
Sra. Norma is a hardworking and responsible person who has strived each day to acquire her house. She worries about providing her young children greater stability. For this reason, she has approached Credituyo about completing her project. She wants to expand the first floor of her house, so she sees this loan as a possibility of providing her children a great inheritance.

In addition, her relatives and friends will be more comfortable whenever they visit her. For this reason, she is thankful for having contacted Credituyo.

loans.use: to expand the ground floor of her house.

loans.name: Wensira

texts.fr: Mariée et sans enfants, Wensira vit avec son mari en location. Les dépenses familiales reviennent au mari mais elle y participe dans une certaine proportion. Wensira mène son activité génératrice de revenu dans une boutique située dans la ville de Cotonou. Elle commercialise des conserves, des liqueurs, des boissons en cannette, des pagnes, des produits cosmétiques et autres. Sa clientèle, diverse et variée est constituée des habitants de sa zone et de ses environs. Elle effectue ses approvisionnement chez les grossistes du Bénin. Pour éviter les ruptures de stocks, Wensira a sollicité et obtenu un concours financier à FINADEV, ce qui lui permet de mieux achalander sa boutique, d'avoir du stock disponible en permanence afin de combler les attentes de sa clientèle. Elle espère tirer un revenu supplémentaire qui l'aidera à assurer son bien-être et celui de ses proches.
texts.en:
Wensira is married without children; she lives in rented accommodation with her husband. Her husband covers the family expenses but she contributes to some extent. 

She conducts her income generating activity in a shop located in the town of Cotonou. She sells canned goods, liquor, canned drinks, “pagnes”, cosmetic products and more. Her diverse and varied customer base is made up of the residents of her area and its surroundings. She gets her supplies from wholesalers in Benin.

To avoid a shortage of supplies, Wensira requested and obtained the financial help of FINADEV. This will allow her to better stock up her shop, to have a constant available supply in order to better meet her customers' demand. She hopes to make an additional income that will help her ensure her well-being and the one of those close to her.

loans.use: to purchase 20 boxes of milk

loans.name: Putheavy

texts.en: Putheavy, 45 years old, is a housewife. She is a single mother with three children, all of whom are working. Each of the children earns $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $55 on food and $5 on electricity. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy dirt to fill her house, which is flooding. The loan helps her not to live with flooding. All of the payments are made by her children who support her.

loans.use: To buy dirt to fill her house which is flooding

loans.name: Teonila

texts.es:
Doña Teonila, tiene 52 años de edad, casada desde hace 28 años, vive en Peña Blanca, Cortes  y tiene 3 hijos de 20, 22 y 25 años de edad. 
Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de novedades, ropa, calzado y utensilios para cocina y otros.  Su esposo también es comerciante y le ayuda a vender en forma ambulante.
Con fin de ayudar a sus hijos a que terminaran de estudiar y crecer personalmente fue el motivo de establecer este negocio y le ha funcionado muy bien.
El financiamiento es utilizado para compra de productos de novedades, ropa, calzado, utensilios de cocina para surtir su inventario.
Desde que inició su negocio ha recibido  financiamientos con ODEF teniendo un buen record crediticio. Han sido escalonados, comenzó desde L.3,000.00, ahora a obtenido de L.15,000.00, su inventario a crecido.
Su meta es establecer el negocio en un lugar adecuado  en su casa y contar siempre con la ayuda de ODEF.
texts.en:
Teonila, age 52, has been married for 28 years.  She lives in Peña Blanca, Cortes.  She has three children; ages 20, 22, and 25.

For ten years she has been selling novelties, clothes, shoes, and cooking utensils, and other items.  Her husband is also a merchant, and he helps her sell in an itinerant manner.

In order to help her children finish their education and to grow personally she established this business.  It has worked very well for her.

The loan is used to buy novelty products, clothes, shoes, and cooking utensils to stock her inventory.  Since she started her business she has received loans with ODEF, and she has a good credit record.

They have been escalating.  She started at 3,000 lempiras, and now she has received 15,000 lempiras.  Her inventory has increased.

Her goal is to establish her business in a suitable place in her house and to always have help from ODEF.

loans.use: to buy novelty products, clothes, shoes, and cooking utensils, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth, a 34-year-old married mother of one child, lives in the Philippines where she has had a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages for five years. A member of HSPFI since 2011, she is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more goods for her shop. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with five children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house and her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a water-selling business from her home, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to repair a water tap for her water-distribution business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to repair a water tap for her water-distribution business.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is married and works hard to support her family. She has a basket weaving business in the Philippines.
Guillerma has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy materials for her basket weaving. She has been in this business for ten years now, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.
In the future, Guillerma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her basket weaving.

loans.name: Edith Maribel

texts.es:
Edith, se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un nuevo préstamo, para la compra de productos de primera necesidad, también de bebidas y otros productos que ofrece a los clientes, los préstamos que le han permitido salir de la crisis y mantener un buen nivel de productos, mejorando sus ganancias y ayudando a su familia para mejorar las condiciones de vida.
La compra actual sera en detergentes, huevos, pastas, queso, boquitas, gaseosas, jugos, galletas, dulces.
texts.en:
Edith is in need of asking for another loan to buy basic necessities, as well as drinks and other products that she sells to her customers. Thanks to the loans she has succeeded in surviving the economic crisis and in keeping a good amount of products, thus increasing her earnings and helping her family improving their standard of living.
This loan will be invested in the purchase of detergents, eggs, pasta, cheese, snacks, fizzy drinks, juices, biscuits and sweets.

loans.use: To buy detergents, eggs, pasta, cheese, snacks, fizzy drinks, juices, biscuits and sweets.

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Group

texts.fr: GBENONKPO est un groupe de deux personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Véronique (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 33 ans et est mariée à un certain Gérard. Véronique a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Véronique vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Véronique vend depuis huit ans, du charbon de bois dans son quartier. Véronique s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue élargir son activité, Véronique sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
GBENONKPO Group is made up of two women who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group's representative, named Véronique, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 33 years old and married to one Gérard.

The couple has two school-attending children to support. Véronique lives together with her husband and children. The couple takes care of the various household expenses together.

Véronique dropped out of elementary school. To provide for herself and her family, she's been selling charcoal in her neighborhood for eight years.

She gets her supplies in one of Benin's markets. Eager to meet customer demand and in order to bolster her business, she's seeking a third loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, together with the other members of the group.

This loan will enable them to better meet customer demand and increase their profits. The first two loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Yayra Group

texts.fr: YAYRA qui signifie BÉNÉDICTION est un groupement constitué de femmes et d’hommes qui sont dans diverses activités (commerce, photographie…). Leurs responsable est une femme vaillante qui est mariée avec 02 enfants en charge qui sont toujours en études. Elle revend des céréales et sollicite ce second crédit pour stocker plus de marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins des clients en période de pénurie. Les autres membres également espèrent voir leur activité s’améliorer et assurer un avenir radieux à leur famille.
texts.en: YAYRA, which means "benediction" is a group made up of women and men involved in various activities (retail business, photography...).  The group's representative is an energetic married woman.  She has two children in her care who are still in school.  She resells grains and she is requesting this second loan in order to be able to store more merchandise and to better meet her customers' needs in times of shortage.  The other members of the group also hope to improve their activities and to be able to provide a bright future for their families.

loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: Pardahol

texts.ru: 51 летняя жительница района Шахритус, Пардахол. Она прекрасная и заботливая мать. У нее трое детей. Старший сын работает учителем в школе. После смерти мужа Пардахол ее младшие сыновья начали заработать самостоятельно в  Российской Федерации. Сейчас они зарабатывают, и помогает маме обеспечить семью. Сама Пардахол работает учительницей в средней школе. Она хорошая учительница, в школе ее все уважает и ценят. Пардахол с большой надеждой обратилась за кредитом. Она за счет кредита хочет приобрести свадебные принадлежности. Его старший сын еще не женат. И Пардахол решила проводить свадьбу сына. Она будет рада за Вашу поддержку.

loans.use: На свадебные расходы сына.

loans.name: Aggrey

texts.en: Aggrey is married with eight children and his wife is a housewife. Since starting his cereal grains business four years ago, he is able to support his family, and has also managed to support his church orphanage. With the loan of $300 from PEMCI, he plans to open up a new shop at Malakisi trading centre, which will improve his services and broaden his capital base in the cereal grains business.

loans.use: cereal grains seller

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
A. Marie is a 38-year-old woman who lives with her 3 children in Treichville, a township in the south of Abidjan. Marie sells various vegetables in the Treichville main open market. Marie has been doing this business for more than 15 years and has accumulated good experience. She wants to move to gross sale and sustain her financial situation.

Marie is an enthusiastic woman. She received her first loan from AE&I in March, 2004 and we have never had any reimbursement issue with her. She significantly contributes to her family's revenue generation.

loans.use: Amon Marie will use the loan to purchase goods for gross sales

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
JUANA buys natural flowers, fruits and vegetables at a nearby city and she then sells them at home to people who live in her neighborhood. She is 54 years old, has 7 children and her husband works as a carpenter at a furniture shop. She belongs to the Tres Estrellas (Three Stars) 6 group, along with Ms. TRINIDAD P. S. (who is dedicated to raising and selling pigs). With the loan, Ms. Juana hopes to install a small shop at home to sell her flowers and fruits, and Ms. Trinidad will buy more pigs, as well as food and vitamins to maintain her animals disease-free.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

JUANA compra en una ciudad cercana al lugar donde vive flores naturales, frutas y verduras, y posteriormente las vende en su casa y a las personas que viven cerca de su domicilio. Tiene 54 años, 7 hijos y su esposo trabaja como carpintero en una mueblería. Ella pertenece al grupo Tres Estrellas 6, junto con doña TRINIDAD P. S. (quien se dedica a la crianza y venta de puercos). Con el préstamo doña Juana espera poder instalar un pequeño local en su casa, donde pueda vender sus flores y frutas, y doña Trinidad comprará más lechoncitos, así como alimento y vitaminas para evitar las plagas entre los animales.

loans.use: Selling flowers, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en: -She is 45 years old and has three children who are 26, 20, and 18 years old. -She and her husband are separated, but she does not have the resources to move out of his house with her two children -All her children went to school -This is the second loan that she is taking out from Esperanza. She successfully paid back the first loan, which was for 4000 pesos (120 USD) -Her business involves buying household items (i.e. shampoo, clothes, and small electronic items) from Santo Domingo and delivering them to people in her community and the nearby communities. When someone makes an order for something from Santo Domingo she can get it for them and sell it at a small profit for delivery service. -With her loans, she eventually wants to be able to have her own house from which she can sell her wares.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Victoriya

texts.en:
Victoriya and her husband Alexander have a small family business selling kitchen supplies and accessories. They have two market vending kiosks in the city of Zaporoshye, located in south central Ukraine, where they sell a variety of dishes, glassware, table linens and other kitchen supplies. Victoriya and Alexander have two daughters ages 15 and 10. Their business is an important source of income for their family.

Victoriya has requested a loan of $1000 to add to their business capital and help purchase new inventory to sell. Financial assistance from Nadiya Ukraine has benefited Victoriya’s and Alexander’s business in the past. We are happy for this new opportunity to help them continue operating a successful enterprise.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Dafroza

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Dafroza M.. She is married to husband Frank and has two little girls, Glory, 5, and Grace, 2, who are just as pretty as their names suggest! In 2006 Dafroza established a business selling African batik cloth. She requires a loan of $375 to purchase additional stock.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation for women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of African batik cloth for her business

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 28 year-old young man with one child. He lives with his family in south Lebanon, in the region of Nabatieh.

Together with his father, he sells home appliances to the community. He needs a loan to buy additional appliances to sustain and further develop his business and help support his family.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Fedha

texts.en:
Fedha is a mother of four and resident of Makangarawe area in Dar Es Salaam city. She has been engaged in various business for the past 15 years. She sells traditional locally made clothing (vitenge and Kanga) and fried fish. She goes to the ferry every day for the fish and fries them in the evening for sale. She has employed one person to her help her with operations.

She is in need of Tshs 600,000 ($USD525.00) to help her expand her businesses.

loans.use: Fund business expansion.

loans.name: Shani's Starehe Group

texts.en:
Shani M. is 36 years old and married with two children, ages 7 and 1 1/2. She and her husband also take care of 2 other people, ages 46 and 19. Shani sells clothing, a business she started in 2006. She works every day from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. and earns a monthly profit of about $110.

Shani is applying for a loan of $350 to buy more cloth for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Regina, who is a food vendor.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for her business

loans.name: Cham

texts.en: 56-year-old Cham S. earns her living as a tailor in Kampong Chnang Province, averaging $3 U.S per day. As a widow, it is her responsibility to care for her one child still living dependently in the family home and going to school. She has three older children as well, two of whom are garment factory workers, while another shares her mother’s tailoring business. Unfortunately, on their current income they are not able to build a larger home in which to house their family business. They are therefore requesting a loan of $750 to build this home as well as purchase additional sewing thread.

loans.use: To build a house and buy thread.

loans.name: Carolita

texts.es:
Carolita is a member of Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, and is located at the Micaela Bastidas Market in the Callería district of Ucayali. She is 25 years old and has two children. Her husband is a businessman but their income is too low to keep the family. Under these circumstances Carolita took out an initial loan of $100 and invested it in a shop selling plastic bags.

Today, she continues running this shop, selling plastic bags both wholesale and also at the market. She gets up at 7am to prepare breakfast for her children and husband, after which she works until 6pm.

With this loan of $850, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy plastic bags in bulk, disposable plates, polystyrene, packs of toilet paper, etc.

Carolita is very happy, now that she can manage her own income and appreciate the value in herself. Her business is growing and so she can help her husband with the household expenses. For this she is very grateful for the support that Manuela Ramos can give to her business.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Carolita pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, ubicado en el Mercado Micaela Bastidas del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 25 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuanta no le alcanza para mantener a su familia, es así que Carolita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de bolsas plásticas. . En la actualidad ella cuenta con una tienda de venta de bolsas plásticas al por mayor y al por menor en el mercado, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, de allí se dedica a la atención de su negocio hasta las 6 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 2, 300 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: bolsas plásticas por millares, platos descartables, tecnopor, paquetes de papel higiénico, etc. Carolita esta muy feliz, ahora puede manejar sus propios ingresos y valerse por si misma, su negocio esta creciendo y de esta manera apoya a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar por eso esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos para su negocio

loans.use: To buy goods for her shop.

loans.name: Augusta G.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 42 year-old Augusta M.. She is married and has three children, aged 21, 19, and 15. She has one dependent, who lives with her because she is orphan. In 2002, Augusta established her poultry farming business. Working six days a week, and five to eight hours a day, she earns about $40.00 every month from this business. Augusta has already received and successfully repaid four loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to buy chicken, drugs, and food. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $217.00. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through microleasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy chickens, drugs, and food.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim Y., 54, purchases bananas from a local farm and transports them to the market to resell for a profit. She typically makes $3.90 each day in the local market and believes that she can expand her business to reach more customers.

She lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia, with her husband, Sou Sam Ol, and their ten children. Her husband sells traditional Khmer medicines and makes less than $1 each day. The family is also aided by the support of some of the children. Three of their children are employed in Kampong Cham and are able to provide US$100 each month to their parents to help them meet their daily needs.

Through some expansion, Kim Y. believes that her banana business could generate more income for her and her husband and help to lighten the financial burden on this large family. She has asked for a loan of $600 to purchase more bananas and invest in her business. This purchase could increase her inventory and allow her to generate more income in the local food market.

loans.use: Increase banana inventory

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly is 24 years old, is the mother of 2 precious children, one of whom is still a baby and the other a primary school student. She lives with her husband José Alberto who is a driver. She earns a living selling groceries and other staples in her house (store). She has been working at this business for 3 years and enjoys it very much because it keeps her active. She is also the owner of a car, the one that her husband drives, and that she administers. Nelly works to cover the daily household expenses and for the education of her child. She wants to expand her business and fix up some parts of her home, and it is for this that she is asking for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Nelly tiene 24 años, es madre de dos precioso niños, siendo uno de ellos aún un bebe y el otro estudiante del nivel inicial. Ella vive junto a su esposo José Alberto que es chofer. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad dentro de su vivienda (bodega). Lleva en este negocio 3 años y le gusta mucho, ya que la mantiene activa. También es propietaria de un motocarro, el mismo que maneja su esposo, y el cual ella administra. Nelly trabaja para los gastos diarios de su hogar y para la educación de su niño. Quiere mandar a ampliar su negocio y mejorar algunas partes de su vivienda, por ello solicita el presente préstamo.

loans.use: Improvement and expansion of the store that she has in her house

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Bertha, socia del Banco Comunal Indo América, ubicado en el Jr. Fiscarral # 246, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 42 años y es madre de 9 hijos, su esposo es motokarrista. Bertha con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300, decidió invertir en la venta de frutas.

Bertha, en la actualidad tiene un motokar que es trabajado por su esposo y ella trabaja de ama de casa.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,300, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, invertirá en el mantenimiento de su motokar.  
 
Bertha, está muy agradecida por la confianza y el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos, ya que de esa manera puede apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de su familia y en la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the Indo American Communal Bank, which is located at #246 on Jr. Fiscarral in the Calleria district of Ucayali. Bertha is 42 years old and lives with her husband and nine children. Her husband owns and runs a moto-taxi and Bertha is a housewife. This is the first loan that Bertha has requested from the bank. She is requesting 1,300 soles (apx. $450) which she will invest in the maintenance of the her family's motorcycle. The loan period will be for four months. Bertha is very grateful for the confidence and assistance the Manuela Ramos provides. It is through these means that Bertha will be able to assist her husband in payment of the familial expenses and provide for the education of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of the family's moto-taxi.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia A., a 58-year-old trader, is a wife and mother of four children, two of whom who are currently in school. 

She treks to buy foods, such as groundnuts, yams, onions, beans, and maize, and sells them in the local market. She also supplies larger portions to her customers who need to buy wholesale quantities. Cecilia says that, through this business, she has managed to support her first child, who has just completed senior high school. 

She is requesting a loan to buy increased stock of yams, groundnuts, onions, maize and beans to expand her business. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children in school and to give them hope for the future. 

She belongs to the Good Mind Trust Group. In this community group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan. Her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more groundnuts, onions, maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Ae

texts.en:
Mrs. Ae T., 42, and her husband, Mr. Yun Leang, 45, live on an island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1987 and have six children: two sons and four daughters. Three of their daughters weave silk, two sons study in a local school, and the youngest daughter is still young and stays at home.

Ae has been farming and raising pigs for over ten years. She grows vegetables in her farmland. Her husband has been a mason since 1990. Besides construction work, he also does farming as well.

Ae is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase silk materials for her three daughters' weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her daughters' weaving.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Vivant dans la sous préfecture de Selingué (Village de sélékégni) située au situé au bord du fleuve sankarani abritant le barrage hydro électrique de selingué (lieu touristique et propice à la riziculture et à la pêche), les membres du groupe benkadi sont des femmes mariées vivant dans des foyers polygames avec en moyenne cinq (5) enfants. Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinnage.
Spécialisées dans la vente de poissons (fraiches ou fumées), elles s’approvisionnent sur place tous les jours auprès des pêcheurs et vendent sur place. Souvent une partie est fumée et vendue à Bamako. Avec cette recette elles achetent des articles divers (Pâgnes; chaussures et bijoux) à Bamako qui sont vendus à la population de Selingué.
Avec ce prêt elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 55.000 FCFA par membre pour subvénir aux bésoins de leur famille. Elles désirent à la longue acquérir un congelateur pour mieux concerver le poisson
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi group live in the sous-prefecture of Selingué (village of Sélékégni) which is situated on the bank of the Sankarani river that is home to the hydro-electric dam of Selingué (a tourist site which lends itself to growing rice and to fishing). They are married women living in polygamous households with an average of 5 children each. They know each other because they come from the same neighborhood.

Specialized in selling fish (fresh or smoked), they do their buying daily right where they live from the fishermen, and they also sell the fish there. Often, a part of the catch is smoked and sent to Bamako (the capital of Mali). With that revenue, they buy various articles ("pagnes"--lengths of brightly colored African print cloth, shoes and costume jewelry) in Bamako for re-sale to the population of Selingué.

With this loan, they expect to make an average monthly profit of 55,000 F CFA per member to pay family expenses. In the long run, they hope to acquire a freezer so that they can keep their fish fresh more easily.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fish and rice

loans.name: Hadicha

texts.ru: Ахбутаева Хадича девушка в возросте 20 лет , замужем.Окончив школу она ходила на швейные курсы и стала мастером по пошиву женской одежды.Сейчас она на дому принимает заказы. Её муж занимается откормом скота и продажей.Поэтому Хадича хочет взяв займ закупить к скоту мужа ещё несколько баранов.Она объясняет что её мужу некогда приходить в Микроинвест, и поэтому она сама решила помочь ему в этом.Из-за того что сейчас очень дешёвый скот на рынке она хочет увеличить скот мужа.Она сама в свободное время помогает мужу по откорму скота.Хадича проживает в отдалёном кишлаке Кашка в Гафуровском районе.Её муж постух в кишлаке.
texts.en:
Hadicha A. is a 20-year-old woman and married. After finishing school, she took a sewing course and became a dressmaker. Now she does custom, bespoke work out of her home. Her husband is in the business of fattening and selling cattle. Hadicha would like to take out a loan towards the purchase of several rams for her husband. She explains that her husband would never have come to MicroInvest, so she took it upon herself to assist him with this. Since the price of cattle in the marketplace is currently low, she would like to increase her husband's herd. In her free time, Hadicha helps her husband to feed the cattle. She lives in the remote village of Kashka in the Garfurov region. Her husband is a herdsman in the village.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding of cattle

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Madame A. Afi est une femme qui achète des tissues et des pagnes et les revend à Tokoin, un quartier de Lomé, la capitale de Togo.  Elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter les tissues et les pagnes afin de mieux servir ses clients.  Elle est mariée avec 3 personne à charge qui elle soutient avec cette activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Afi A. is a woman who buys fabrics and "pagnes" (colorful West African cloth) and resells them in Tokoin, a district of Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is requesting this loan to buy fabrics and pagnes in order to serve her customers better. She is married and has three people to support with her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics and pagnes

loans.name: Ha's Group

texts.vi:
Trương Thị Hà sinh năm 1983,( Mã số: 010103080001) Chị là thợ may, chồng làm cơ khí có T. nhập ổn định. Bên cạnh đó, vợ chồng chị vẫn tăng gia sản xuất, chăn nuôi gà, vịt. T. nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 4.000.000 vnđ/tháng. Chị tham gia vay vốn với mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi. Chị được mọi người tin tưởng, tín nhiệm và bầu làm nhóm trưởng nhóm vay vốn. Cùng vay với chị còn có:
 Lê Thị Lý sinh năm 1966,( Mã số: 010103080002) tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư vật liệu làm cơ khí. T. nhập bình quân của gia đình khoảng 3.500.000 vnđ/tháng.
 Nguyễn Thị M. sinh năm 1976 ,( Mã số: 010103080003)chị có nghề làm đậu có T. nhập theo ngày, T. nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.500.000 vnđ/ tháng, Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư nghề phụ.
 Bùi B. N. sinh năm 1976,( Mã số: 010103080004) hàng ngày chị đi chợ bán T.t lợn có T. nhập theo ngày khoảng 150.000 vnđ/ ngày. Chị tham gia vay mức vốn: 3.270.000 vnđ để đi chợ.
 Phan Thị T. Phương sinh năm 1984 ,( Mã số: 010103080005 )chị bán hang quàn áo may sẵn có T. nhập theo ngày khoảng 200.000 vnđ/ ngày. Chị vay mức vốn: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư mở rộng cửa hàng.

loans.use: raising animals

loans.name: Asia Shahsawar Group

texts.en:
Asia baji is a 49-year-old married lady and a citizen of a city named Vehari, Pakistan, for the past 20 years. Her husband's name is S., and he runs a grocery shop in the community. He has been in this business for the past four years. Asia baji is the mother of seven children: four sons and three daughters. All of her kids are getting an education from a school which is located near the house. Asia baji is involved in a business sewing clothes. She sews clothes by taking orders from her relatives and neighbors. She sews clothes to pay off the school fees of her kids and to share the financial burden of her husband. Asia baji is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her husband’s grocery shop.

She is the group leader of some more women in her area. Kaniz baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Shamim Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy dried fruits (peanuts and almonds) to sell. Azra baji wants a loan to buy tools for repairing vehicles for her motor-works shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery shop

loans.name: Makatala

texts.en:
Makatala T., 20, is single with no children. She has three years of experience in the transportation of the public to and from islands. She provides service to the public seven days per week.

She has one previous loan with SPBD. Makatala expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).

SPBD loans are Makatala’s only access to capital because she was not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. Her loan will be used to upgrade the status of her business.

loans.use: Upgrade status of her business.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina es socia del Bancomunal Teresa de Calcuta.
Valentina es conviviente tiene 56 años, tres hijos de 35, 28 y 17 años, los mayores están casados y el menor estudia en un instituto superior.  
Valentina tiene un negocio de taxi con su esposo, tenían tres carros y le robaron dos, actualmente solo tiene uno y su esposo lo trabaja.
Valentina necesita un préstamo de 600 soles, para hacer el mantenimiento a su carro.
Desde que esta en Finca los prestamos le han ayudado para los gastos que genera su carro.
El sueño de valentina es no tener nada de deudas.
texts.en:
Valentina is a member of the Mother Teresa Community Bank. She lives with her common-law husband, is 56 years old and has three children ages 35, 28 and 17. The eldest ones are married and the youngest is studying at an institution of higher learning. Velentina has a taxi business with her husband. They had three cars, but two were stolen, and currently she only has one, which he husband drives. Valentina needs a loan of 600 soles to perform maintenance on the car. She she joined Kiva partner Finca, the loans have helped her with expenses for her car. Her dream is to not have any debt.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car maintenance

loans.name: Antonia Paulina

texts.es: La señora tiene 24 años de edad, es Soltera de oficios tejedora, “elaboración de cortes típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 telares, habita junto con sus hermanos, ella y su familia se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 4 años de elaborar cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Chotacaj, de la Aldea Vásquez del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ms. Antonia is 24 years old and is single. She is by trade a weaver, "making typical skirts for women". She has a workshop with two looms and lives together with her siblings. She and her family are dedicated to the same trade and also have two employees in the same activity. For four years she has made skirts in her home, which is located in the hamlet of Chotacaj in the Vásquez neighborhood of the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Currently, the demand from her customers has increased, but because of the current economic conditions they aren't able at present to increase their capital. It's for this reason that she approached the ASDIR association in order to ask for a loan, with the intention of buying primary materials and so be able to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crafts (Increasing Capital)

loans.name: Zubaida Muhammad Khalil Group

texts.en:
Zubaida baji is a daily wage laborer. She works with her husband who is a mason by profession. He constructs buildings and she provides the required material to him. They are a very hardworking couple. Zubaida baji is applying for a loan to buy mason tools for her husband’s business.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) for her animal selling business. Ayesha baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. Kaniz Fatima baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy mason tools

loans.name: Apayi

texts.en: Apayi M. is currently in the business of selling goods at the shop and is requesting a loan to purchase plastic plates and cups to sell.  Apayi is 30 years old and is married to a peasant . She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a hotel.  BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase plastic plates and cups to sell

loans.name: Keji

texts.en: Keji Y. is currently in the business of selling charcoal wholesale and is requesting a loan to build a charcoal store.  Keji is 39 years old, married and her husband is an SPLA soldier. She has 3 children, all going to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land to build housing for rent. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build charcoal a store.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan A. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 42 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Susan owns and operates a business running a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Susan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Susan is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new equipment, such as a video-k unit, to expand the business. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business

loans.name: Dolores De Jesús

texts.es: Dolores de Jesús A. H. tiene 30 años de edad, y vive con su esposo y tres hijos, todos menores de edad. La mayoría de su tiempo lo pasa, manejando su negocio de comedor y restaurante que abrió hace 3 años. El comedor se ha coinvertido en su única fuente de ingresos estable. Dolores difícilmente ve a sus hijos, pues el comedor le demanda su total atención y esfuerzo diario. Dolores solicita un préstamo para comprar nueva materia prima para su comedor, y vender así nuevos productos que ayuden a  convertir  a su humilde restaurante, en un negocio más rentable y sostenible, y poder así  apartar más tiempo del día, para pasarlo con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dolores de Jess Aguilon Hernandez is 30 years old. She lives with her husband and has 3 children, all of whom are still minors. She spends most of her time managing her food store/restaurant, which was opened 3 years ago. The store has become her only form of stable income. With difficulty, Dolores looks after her children but the store requires her full attention and daily effort. Dolores is seeking a loan to purchase raw materials for her store and to buy new products that will allow her humble store to become more profitable and sustainable. This way she might be able to spend more time during the day with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Mark Translator, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Raw Materials and Store Supplies

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda G. is from the village of Mambajao Camiguin. She is 55 years old. Leonarda is separated from her spouse and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Leonarda owns & operates a business running a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of viands in the local community. Leonarda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Leonarda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonarda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Leonarda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Khadeyge

texts.fr: khadeyge S. est une sociétaire de la caisse de baye laye depuis 2005.c'est une mère de famille qui a l'intention de relancer son commerce de tissus.elle sollicite un crédit de cent cinquante mille(150 000)frs pour renforcer son capital de roulement.c'est une mère de famille qui participe a l'entretien de sa famille.

loans.use: commerce

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel V. Ramírez tiene la edad de 44 años. Es una madre responsable ya que tiene 1 hija a su cargo que necesita estudios. La actividad económica es una pulpería. Está ubicada en su vivienda, ella ha luchado mucho por salir adelante para que sus hijos puedan superar sus obstáculos, y con arduo trabajo ha logrado todo lo que tiene hoy en día. Actualmente ella solicita este financiamiento que es para capital de trabajo y así comprar golosinas, refrescos naturales, jugos, pan, galletas y productos para el hogar. Como toda persona con deseo de superación le gustaría tener un restaurante.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is a 33 year old woman and is a married mother of three children. All of her children are in school and she lives with husband and children. She is a food vendor and serves food like rice with stew. Her demand for food is on high, but she does not have adequate funds for expansion. She has been in food production for four years now and is taking care of the family. She wants to use the loan to buy meat and bags of rice to increase her efficiency and production. She believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to support the educational needs of her children. With hard work she believes she can repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetables, meat, firewood etc.

loans.name: Obidanbi Group

texts.en:
Atta is a forty-year-old gentleman. He is married and the father of four children, three boys and a girl, who are currently pursuing education in junior high and primary schools. In his capacity as the main breadwinner of his family, Atta works hard as a trader. He trades in used clothing.

Atta is the leader of "Obidanbi Trust Group" which has seven members, four females and three males. These are all breadwinners for their families. They all have children who are currently in school. They are engaged in the trading of foodstuffs, clothing, cosmetics, groceries, and so on, as the source of livelihood for their homes. However, due to inadequate working capital, they make barely enough income to meet the needs of their households.

Their common dream is to see their businesses grow, which would enable them to improve the living conditions of their families. They believe this loan will help them to inject more capital into their businesses to materialize this dream. Members of this group agree to guarantee for one another as social collateral and to assist one another in repaying the loan on schedule.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Phann

texts.en: Phann K., age 38, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo Province. To earn a living, she and her husband have been renting musical instruments to the local villagers. On average, they are able to make about US $5.00 of profit every day. This couple has five children, only two of whom are old enough to attend school. Phann K. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase a motorbike and a trailer to transport the musical instruments.

loans.use: Musical instruments

loans.name: Eduvina

texts.es:
Eduvina tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo (Modesto) D. 50 años, y con su hijo Johan D. 26 años.
DesD. hace 3 años se dedica a la venta D. gas, esta actividad la realiza desD. su casa, compra y distribuye los pedidos D. sus vecinos y demás clientes. Pero eso no es todo, ya que paralelamente venD. aceitunas, otro negocio que es muy fructífero, ya que las ventas son muy buenas, para ello Eduvina debe viajar a otras ciudades para traer este producto.
Eduvina está muy contenta con todo su trabajo, ya que se siente una mujer completa con todo lo que realiza, pues sabe que lleva ingresos extras a su hogar y pueD. brindarles una mejor vida a sus hijos.
Para el futuro, quiere tener un negocio más granD. y así poder obtener más ingresos para tener mayor estabilidad en su hogar.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, ella se caracteriza por ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita lo usará para viajar y comprar más aceitunas para abastecer a sus clientes D. tan rico producto.
texts.en:
Eduvina, 48, lives with her husband (Modesto, 50) and their son, Johan, 26. For the last three years she had a home-based gas selling enterprise; she fills orders for her neighbors and others.
