But this isn't all: she also sells olives, a very profitable business, because sales are good. For this, Eduvina must travel to other cities to get her supplies. She is very happy with her work because she feels fulfilled with everything she accomplishes because she brings extra income to her home and can proviD. her children a better quality of life. For the future, she would like her business to be larger so that she can obtain higher income and have more stability in her home. This is her second loan with MFP. She is very punctual with her repayments. With the funds requested now she will travel to buy more olives to supply her customers with this delicious product.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Inmaculada Concepcion De Pachar Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios, pertenecen al banco comunal “INMACULADA CONCEPCION D. PACHAR”. Los socios radican en el distrito D. “Pachar”, provincia D. Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. El banco comunal esta conformado por 10 socios y la mayoría D. ellos tienen un negocio independiente pero con actividades D. trabajo similares. La reunión D. las socias se hace en la casa D. la socia Elida.   

Nuestros socios alternan sus diversas actividades del hogar con la agricultura, ganadería, la venta D. granos, la venta D. víveres, crianza D. animales, etc. Una gran parte tiene su propio terreno D. cultivo donD. producen choclo, arbejas, repollo, maíz, etc. La socia Nayda trabaja en Machupicchu en un hotel D. turismo como recepcionista por las mañanas y por las tardes regresa a su casa (ciudad D. Pachar). La socia Victoria tiene una tienda D. abarrotes donD. venD. arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc. Una D. las socias tiene un pequeño puesto D. venta D. comida.      

Los socios solicitan el préstamo para que lo utilicen como capital D. trabajo y D. esta manera incrementar sus productos y aumentar sus ventas, para dar mejor calidad D. vida a sus familias.

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the "Inmaculada Conception D. Pachar" community bank. They come from the district of Pachar in the Urubamba province, department of Cosco. The community bank is maD. up of 10 members, and the majority of them have an independent business but within related lines of work. Member meeting take place in the home of Elida, one of the members. The members alternate their diverse household activities with their work in agriculture, livestock, grain sales, food sales, animal husbandry, etc. Many of them have their own farmland for growing sweet corn, peas, cabbage, corn, etc. One member, Nayda, works in Machupicchu as a receptionist at a hotel for tourists in the morning and then returns to her home (in the city of Pachar) in the evenings. Another member, Victoria, has a grocery store where she sells rice, sugar, oil, etc. Another of the members has a small shop for food sales. The members are seeking a loan to be used as working capital which will then increase their productivity and their sales and in turn gives their families a better quality of life. The group values and appreciates the loan granted in this method, and likewise they promise to complete their repayments within the determined time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and foods, and for the household expenses of meals and education

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a thirty year old widowed mother of two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana.

Sophia works hard to be able to meet the needs of the family. She is a baker. She bakes bread and supplies it to retailers. Sophia buys bags of flour from nearby towns. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Emma Achieng

texts.en: Emma Achieng O. is married and blessed with 3 children. She lives in Kajulu, Kisumu, Kenya. She is the proud owner of a clothing business, importing from Uganda (Kampala). Before she started this business, she was employed at an agricultural institute. Her main dream is to build a commercial building in Kisumu city in the future. She would like a loan of Kshs. 20,000 which will go toward increasing her clothing stock.

loans.use: more clothing inventory

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a rice farmer from Norala, South Cotabato. She is 40 years with four children. Her eldest child is 20 years old. She started farming a rice field back in 2007. Her harvest is the main source of income her family depends on.

Now she would like to request a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. worth Php 15,000 to expand her farm and supply the necessary materials needed for her rice field.

loans.use: fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Cooking oil in Nigeria is used for various things, like cooking and the preparation of local soap called soda. The demand for cooking oil is high. Blessing is happy to be in the business of selling cooking oil because she says that it is highly profitable. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 160,000 to purchase more cooking oil to sell. She hopes to expand and grow her business. She is 38 years old and married with four children. Her children are excelling in school and this makes her happy. Her husband works with the government and he also supports the home. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Elorgia

texts.es:
Elorgia tiene 52 años, vive con su pareja, Franklin, en su casa propia. Sus hijos ya son independientes y viven aparte.

Desde hace un año se dedica a su bazar – librería, el cual implementó en su propia vivienda, teniendo la comodidad de atender a sus clientes mientras desarrolla las labores del hogar. Elorgia se siente contenta y satisfecha con su trabajo porque le brinda los ingresos necesarios para vivir con tranquilidad y ser independiente, aunque muchas veces le resulta muy cansado el tener que proveer a su librería de materiales, puesto que debe traer los paquetes ella sola resultándole muy pesado. Su esposo es jubilado, pero realiza algunos trabajos esporádicos por lo cual no permanece en casa, es así que Elorgia debe dedicarse sola a su trabajo. 
En un futuro quiere ampliar su librería y seguir mejorando la sección del bazar comprando artículos más atractivos para su clientela.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y siempre ha respondido muy bien a los pagos por la gran responsabilidad que posee. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará útiles escolares, pues se acerca la época escolar y estos serán muy demandados.
texts.en:
Elorgia is 52 years old. She lives with her husband, Franklin, in their own home. Their children are already independent and live elsewhere. She has worked in her shop – bookstore for a year. She established it in her own house which makes it easy to wait on her customers while doing her housework. Elorgia is happy and satisfied with her work because it gives her the income she needs to live peacefully and be independent. Although, often it is very tiring to have to stock her bookstore with materials since she has to bring the packages herself and they are very heavy for her. Her husband is retired but he does some work sporadically which is why he doesn’t stay home. That’s why Elorgia has to work by herself. She wants to enlarge her bookstore in the future and continue improving the shop section by purchasing more attractive items for her clientele. This is her second loan with MFP and she has always responded very well to the payments for the great responsibility it is. She will buy school supplies with the money she is applying for now. The school year is getting close and these will be in big demand.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 49 years old, is married with six children, and lives in Lagos, Nigeria. She is hardworking and believes that women are helpmates and need to support their men in keeping the home.

Victoria operates a restaurant and bar; she sells drinks, pepper soup and other food in order to make a profit. With the profit from the business she is able to save a little money and assist her husband in running the home. Her husband is a businessman and is also trying to meet his financial responsibilities.

Victoria hopes to expand her business by buying more drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She is requesting a loan of NGN 60,000 to purchase these items. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Despite misusing the previous loan she received for the needs of her family instead of her business, Michelle F. has been able to repay the whole amount on its expected due date. Her husband had been supporting her financially through his small income. Now, Michelle is again requesting a loan to be used to start another business, pig fattening. Michelle still plans to continue her food selling business and income from it will be used to support her family's needs and for her weekly payment to ASHI. After four months of fattening her pigs, profit from the business will be used to support her children's education until college and improve their standard of living in the future.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for fattening and selling

loans.name: Rodina

texts.en:
Rodina S., from the village of Upper Nazareth Cagayan de Oro, is the 32-year-old widowed mother of an infant. To make a living, Rodina owns and operates a business venture selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Engaged in her business for over six years, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rodina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to invest in expanding the business and plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena pertenece al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO” de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene 48 años.  Actualmente, vive en la ciudad de Calca. 

Su principal actividad económica es vender cerveza en el mercado central. Ya son 20 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar cerveza y gaseosas. 

Maria Elena se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is a member of the Communal Bank “Valle Sagrado” (Sacred Valley), which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She currently lives in the city of Calca.

Her main business activity is selling beer at the central market. She has 20 years of experience in this business and has done very well. Her loan will be used to buy beer and sodas.

Maria Elena is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer & sodas

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en: Mrs. Soeun P., 38, and her husband Mr. Troeng Chea, 40, (pictured together) have been married since 1992. They have five children, four sons and one daughter, all of whom are in school. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number One about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Soeun and her husband have been selling chicken and fish for twelve years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy neighboring land to expand their property.

loans.use: To buy neighboring land to expand their property.

loans.name: Sonagnon Jacqueline

texts.fr: D. Sonagnon Jacqueline est née le 03 Mai 1981 et est mariée à VADOCHEDOHOUN Antonin, un agent de police. Le couple a trois enfants à charge, dont deux sont leur propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Il y a seulement huit mois que la famille s'est installée à Pahou, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Jacqueline vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges du foyer. Jacqueline a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire, et a appris ensuite la coiffure. Jacqueline exerce cette activité depuis trois ans. Parallèlement, Jacqueline vend des mêches, des tissus et des produits cosmétiques dans son atelier. Jacqueline s'approvisionne à Lomé au Togo. Jacqueline a bénéficié déjà de deux prêts de ALIDé, et les a tous bien remboursés. Jacqueline désire augmenter le stock de ses produits et accroître sa clientèle ; raison pour laquelle Jacqueline sollicite un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
D. Sonagnon Jacqueline was born on May 3, 1981 and is married to VADOCHEDOHOUN Antonin, a policeman. The couple are raising three children, two of them biological children. All the children are enrolled in school. The family has only been living in Pahou, in the township of Abomey Calavi, for eight months. Jacqueline helps her husband support their family. She left school at the secondary level and learned hairdressing. She has worked in this trade for three years now. At the same time, she sells hair extensions, cloth and cosmetics in her beauty parlor. She buys her inventory in Lomé, Togo. Jacqueline has already received two loans from ALIDé, and she reimbursed both in a timely manner. She would like to add to her stock of products, and that is why she is asking for a third loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 10 boxes of cosmetics and 8 dozen hair extensions

loans.name: Dickson Palentuan

texts.en:
Dickson is 29 years old. He is married to Jackline K. and they have three children. He has been in livestock farming for 10 years.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the cash to buy calves which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

His future plan is to have a large farm where he raises cattle, both to sell and for milk production.

loans.use: To buy four calves

loans.name: Boyet

texts.en: Boyet D. is from the village of Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. He is 32 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Boyet owns and operates a business providing motorela (a motorcycle encased in a carriage with two rows of seats facing each other) or habal-habal (a motorcycle with an extended seat that carries 2-6 passengers) services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Boyet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Benbinedo

texts.en:
Benbinedo A. is from the village of Minongan, Quezon, Bukidnon. He is 54 years old. Benbinedo is married and has 9 adult children. To make a living, Benbinedo owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Benbinedo has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Benbinedo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Benbinedo is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Benbinedo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Las Orquideas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama Las Orquídeas. Esta ubicado en la comunidad de Jaloxtoc, municipio de Ayala, en el Estado de Morelos, México, el grupo esta conformado por 5 integrantes que se conocen por ser vecinos. Este es su 2º préstamo con Fundación Realidad. 
La integrante del grupo la señora Dolores B. V., tiene 31 años de edad, estudio hasta el 3er. Año de secundaria obteniendo su certificado de secundaria, tiene 3 hijos 2 hombres y 1 mujer, Lizbeth tiene 11 años y esta estudiando la primaria, Adrián tiene 6 años y va a iniciar a estudiar la primaria, José tiene 1 año. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo y necesita su préstamo para comprar perfumes de dama, caballero, rimel para las pestañas, lápiz labial, maquillajes, esmaltes para uñas. Inicio su negocio hace 5 años, que fue cuando una señora la invito a vender los productos de Jafra, la señora le da crédito mete su pedido y cuando llega su pedido le dan 28 días para pagar su producto. Ella sale a ofrecer sus productos de casa en casa, su hija le ayuda en el negocio va a ofrecer los productos con las vecinas. Su negocio es importante por que se va ayudando económicamente para los gastos de su casa, también le gusta porque sale y se distrae un rato,  puede utilizar algún producto para que lo use ella y sus hijos, su negocio enfrenta la competencia de los productos de otras marcas ya que hay más personas vendiendo los mismos productos. La señora Dolores quiere comprar una vitrina para exhibir sus productos, remodelar su vivienda ponerle techo de colado. Sus esperanza son que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que lleguen a ser personas de bien, trabajadoras y honradas y esta muy contenta con el préstamo que recibirá porque se va a surtir de mercancía para ofrecerles a su clientela. 
Jaloxtoc es un lugar muy bonito se ve el campo verde.
Los integrantes del grupo son Dolores B. V. y va a comprar con su préstamo perfumes para dama, caballero, niño y niñas, labiales y desodorantes para surtir su negocio, la señora Maria Guadalupe F. C. va a comprar pollo muerto para venderlo por kilo y surtir su negocio, la señora Rosalinda T. T. va a comprar pantalones, blusas, faldas, vestidos, playeras para niño y niña para surtir su negocio, la señora Maricela L. Hernández  va a comprar verdura, jitomates, papa, cebolla, frutas, sandia, manzana, plátano, mango etc. Para surtir su puesto de frutas y legumbres, la señota Eva Barragán A. va a comprar colchas y sabanas para iniciar su negocio.  
Los integrantes del grupo quieren decir a Kiva y a Función Realidad “Gracias por el apoyo que nos proporcionan"
texts.en:
This supportive group is called Las Orquídeas (The Orchids). It is located in the Jaloxtoc community in the municipality of Ayala in Morelos state, Mexico. The group has 5 members who know each other because they are neighbors. This is their second loan from Fundacíon Realidad. The group member Dolores is 31 years old and studied through the third year of secondary school and graduated with her certificate of secondary education. She has 3 children, 2 boys and 1 girl. Lisbeth is 11 years old and is at primary school, Adrián is 6 years old and is going to start primary school, and José is one year old. She works selling products from a catalog and needs this loan to buy women's and men's scents, mascara, lipstick, makeup, and nail polish. She began her business 5 years ago when a woman invited her to sell products from the company Jafra. You can buy your order on credit, and when your order arrives, you have 28 days to pay for your products. Dolores goes door to door selling her products, her daughter helps her sell products to their neighbors. Her business is important because it helps pay the household expenses, and she also likes to go out and get distracted by her work for a while. She and her children can use the products. Her business faces competition from other brands and there are other people selling the same products. Dolores wants to buy a glass case to display her products and remodel her house by putting on a new roof. Her hope is that her children will continue studying so that the will be good people, hardworking and honest. She is very happy about the loan because she will receive supplies that she can offer to her clients. Jaloxtoc is a very beautiful place where you can see the green countryside. The group members are Dolores, who is going to buy perfumes for women, men, boys, and girls; lipsticks; and deodorants to stock her business; Maria, who is going to buy chicken meat to sell buy the kilo and stock her store; Rosalinda, who is going to buy trousers, blouses, skirts, dresses, and children's t-shirts to stock her store; Maricela, who is going to buy vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, onion, fruits, watermelon, apples, bananas, mango, etc, to supply her fruit and vegetables stall; and Eva, who is going to buy quilts and sheets to start her business. The group members want to tell Kiva and Fundacíon "thank you for the support that you provide to us."

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products like perfumes for men and women, mascara, lipstick, makeup, and nail polish.

loans.name: Bushenyi Women Tuhumurizane Group

texts.en:
They say hard work pays, and a very determined T. Regina has gained from the fruits of her hard work, having started up her cooked food enterprise over 11 years ago, offering catering services in Bushenyi town. She has no regrets.

Due to good management and esteemed customer care, the business has maintained customers for a long time, thus creating a good market as she maintains high levels of hygiene. Most of her customers are town dwellers. With this loan, Regina wants to put in place good furniture and also go shopping for restaurant equipment as she looks at improving the quality of her catering services. This will enable her to get more customers, earn more profit and be able to cover her family and children’s requirements such as education. She is very optimistic about achieving a self-sustaining livelihood with more income coming her way.

loans.use: new furniture and improving the quality of her catering service

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is a 26 year old single man who operates his business in Nairobi. He stocks electronics, mobile phones, accessories and chargers. He employs five people who help him run this business and a retail shop in another location within Nairobi. He has requested a loan of Kes. 40,000 to add to his stock of mobile phones, accessories and chargers. He describes himself as intelligent and hopes to control a large market share in his region and diversify his operations.

loans.use: Buying more mobile phones, accessories and chargers

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline A.  is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, 'simsim', lemons and greens and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of 'simsim' to sell.  Jackline is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a policeman. She has 6 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy goats and chickens to rear at home.

loans.use: Stock more bags of 'simsim' (sesame seeds) to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For over six years, Esther has operated her tailoring business, which includes fabric, shoes and handbags for sale. She faces the major challenge of seasonality. During the holiday seasons (August and December) the demand for fabric items is high compared to the months of January through May when the demand is very low.

Esther decided to join Yehu so as to get financial assistance. With the 20,000 KES loan she wants to purchase a bundle of cloth, shoes and handbags for resale. She hopes to open a shop in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fabric, shoes and handbags for resale

loans.name: Ekua Wagara Comfort

texts.en:
Ekua Wagara Comfort A. sells fish at Abura.  Ekua Wagara Comfort has received junior high school.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer.  She has been selling fish some time now. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business for future use.

The picture shows Ekua with the smoked fish she sells.

loans.use: buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Elma's Group

texts.en:
Elma E. is from the village of Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Elma is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are each collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Lerio.

Elma is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a clothing business, selling new clothes to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $70 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Yovanna

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Yovanna; tiene 38 años de edad, y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, ella tiene una joyería como collares, pulseras y aretes, la socia atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía al por mayor.

 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Los Diamantes" (the diamonds). The bank is located in the Cusco district, belonging to the Cusco Province in Cusco Department.

This member is called Yovanna, she is 38 years old, single and has 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling handicrafts. She sells jewellery such as necklaces, bracelets and earrings, attending to her shop from 8am until 8pm. Yovanna wants to expand her business and is seeking a loan to purchase larger quantities of jewellery. 

La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

Yovanna is thankful for the loan she has sought and promises to meet the repayment installments within the established timeframe.

loans.use: Purchase handicrafts

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda G. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old and married. To make a living, Melinda owns a sari-sari (variety) shop selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and beverages. Melinda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Melinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI and is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase additional products like junk foods and bread. This will be the third loan taken out by Melinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sara Miguelina

texts.es:
La señora Sara es socia del banco comunal las Almendras, Distrito de calleria, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 65 años de edad y está casada.  Tiene un hijo en su poder, lleva 11 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos.
Ella se dedica a dar servicio de alquiler de cuartos, titene todo el segundo piso de su casa destinado para alquilar, y aun está acondicionando más espacios vacios para seguir alquilando, porque le genera buenos ingresos ya que se encuentra en un buen lugar.
 Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00 soles comprara; 20 planchas de calamina, 10 listones, 1 kg de clavo de calamina, 1 kg de clavo de 3 pulgadas, y 6 planchas de triplay, que los necesita para acondicionar una habitación más.
La señora Sara, todos estos años, ha estado invirtiendo en los arreglos de su casa, que le sirve como fuente de ingreso y con el que está educando a su hijo, por eso agradece bastante  a Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Sara is a member of the Las Almendras community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 65 years old and married, with a child in her care.  Sara has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for 11 years.

Sara rents out rooms.  The entire second floor of her house is rented out and she is adapting even more empty spaces so that she can continue renting.  It makes her good money as she is in a good location.

Sara will use this loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy 20 corrugated metal sheets, 10 beams, 1kg of nails for use with corrugated metal, 1kg of 3 inch nails and 6 sheets of plywood which she needs to adapt another room.

Over all these years, Sara has been investing in making repairs to her house which serves as a source of income.  This has enabled her to educate her child.  For this reason, she is quite grateful to Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Teriya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Teriya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 38  ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Barouéli, préfecture de Barouéli ; Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de parfums, de condiments, de l’encens et des habits.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Teriya sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des parfums, des condiments, des tissus et des ingrédients pour la fabrication de l’encens.                                                                          
BINTOU C. compte acheter avec ce prêt, 1 sac de graine d’encens (magnonkissèni) et quelques bouteilles de parfums auprès des revendeurs de Barouéli. Après  préparation le produit final est vendu au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en: The women of the group Teriya are all married and average 38 years of age and three children living in traditional extended families in Barouéli City, Barouéli prefecture, Region of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members know one another through ties of kinship, and they do commerce in perfumes, condiments, incense, and clothing. The group members are now on their sixth solidarity loan, which will be used to buy perfumes, condiments, cloth, and the ingredients for making incense.   Ms. BINTOU C. intends to use her loan for buying a sack of incense seeds (magnonkissèni) and a few bottles of perfume from Barouéli retailers. After the final product is made, it is sold in cash or credit transactions to a customer base composed of women and men.   She envisions making an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover the loan payments and to meet expenses related to healthcare, food, and schooling. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Buying ingredients for making incense

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en: Bayarmaa lives with her husband and four children in the Tuv province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in their own house with a fence. Her husband and oldest son currently work as private businessmen in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter is a university student and her youngest two twin sons both attend a local high school. Bayarmaa operates two kinds of seasonal businesses, a shoe making and a construction business, to support her family. She started her construction business in 2001 and has managed it successfully over the years. Her three sons started to help with her construction business in 2005. She usually operates her construction business during summer months while in winter months she runs her shoe making business, which is very profitable as well. After many years of operation she has gained a lot of experience in both businesses and has built a stable operation in her community with many loyal customers. With her business earnings, she was able to build a 2 floor apartment which hasn't been fully completed yet. In addition, Bayarmaa works as a guard for the local company with a monthly salary of 120,000 MNT to supplement her earnings. She is a clever and hardworking person and is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to increase her working capital for both businesses.

loans.use: To increase her working capital for cobbling and construction

loans.name: Achiro

texts.en:
Achiro is currently in the business of selling foodstuff like beans, oil and charcoal. She is 33 years old, married to a prisoner, and has four children, three of whom go to school. 

Achiro took out a loan to stock more foodstuff to sell. In the future, Achiro hopes to pay for her children's schooling with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: Stock more foodstuff like beans, oil and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Emprendedoras” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.
Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
La señora Odina es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica  a la costura. Es una señora muy creativa y sus clientes quedan muy admirados con sus trabajos. 
Ella tiene una familia muy unida con 2 hijos y es madre soltera. 
Se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo y solicita el crédito para la compra de más telas y otros artículos para la costura.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Emprendedoras Group (Enterprising Women) started with some neighbors in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso getting together.

The members started a very united and capable group to form their businesses together and be strengthened by their camaraderie.

Odina is one of the group members. She is a seamstress. She is a very creative woman and her customers love her work.

She has a tight-knit family with two children, and she is a single mother.

She is very satisfied with the activities and trainings that the group does, and she is requesting this loan to purchase more fabric and other items for her sewing.

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Loeung's Group

texts.en: This group loan consists of four members who will use their portion of the loan for various activities. Loeung H. is the group leader who has been selected by the other members. She is 42 years old and married.  She sells scarves door-to-door where she can earn a profit to help support her family. Her husband is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land where he grows rice. Now Mrs. Loeung wants to start a new business and is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Kea

texts.en:
Kea U., 43, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. U. sells silk products, earning an income of USD 4 per day. Her husband is a farmer and construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family spends USD 42 on food and USD 35 on the other necessary expenses.

U. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase more cows to raise for sale. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner. U. appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: to buy cows to raise for sale

loans.name: Maria Siria

texts.es: María tiene 34 años de edad, es separada y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad escolar. Vive en casa propia en la zona rural del distrito de Morrope en el norte de Perú. Su comunidad es pequeña con un aproximado de 200 familias. Recientemente cuenta con servicios de luz y agua. Desde hace 2 años, Maria se dedica a la venta de ropa y cerveza. Su negocio está situado en su domicilio. Ella inició esta actividad para generar ingresos después de la separación de su esposo. María conoce a la perfección el rubro y cuentan con una clientela ya establecida en la zona. Desea usar su crédito para invertir en la compra de ropa escolar tanto uniformes como ropa deportiva para colegiales. Ahora que la temporada escolar ha comenzado en Perú, ella quiere poder responder a la demanda de sus clientes para estos productos. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles. María goza de muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. Es muy trabajadora y responsable. Su mayor anhelo de siempre es darles un mejor nivel de vida a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
María is 34 years old, separated from her spouse, and has two young children who are in school. She lives in her own home in the rural section of the District of Morrope in northern Peru. This small community has approximately 200 families. María recently received services such as electricity and water.

For the past two years, María has been selling clothing and beer. Her business is located in her home. She started this business to generate income after the separation from her husband. María is a perfectionist in her work and has an established customer base in the area.

She wants to use her loan to invest in the purchase of school clothing, ranging from uniforms to high school sportswear. Now that the school year has started in Peru, she wants to respond to the demands of her customers for these products. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN.

María has earned good personal and work-related references. She is hardworking and responsible. Her greatest wish is to always provide her two children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase school clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gabriel Kariuki

texts.en:
Gabriel has been practising farming in Njabini town for the last 11 years.  He is 41 years old and is married to Esther Muthoni.  

Gabriel was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan.  He had repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use this loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Gabriel hopes to become a leading farmer in the Njabini area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jean Du Dieu

texts.en:
Jean du Dieu is 30 years old and single. He owns a shop in which he sells several items. He sells cows, shoes and the traditional cloth called Kitenge at different locations. He has been selling these items for four years and this business has brought a big difference to his life. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more cows because they give him more profits. This will allow him to make as much savings as possible in order to build a house in which he wants to do business.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhum is a 70-year-old woman.  She is a local villager and lives in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Cham province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. 

Mrs. Chhum is a widow and lives with her children -- four are married and living in their own houses and two are single and enrolled in a local school. Some of her children work with her on the farm. She also has a daughter who sells different kinds of items from her wooden kiosk in Phnom Penh City. Mrs. Chhum is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and bean seeds for planting, and to hire a plowing machine to plow her farmland.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, insecticides, bean seeds, and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana is a seamstress; she sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful and prepares beautifully designed clothes. Besides this work, she carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well. 

Her husband is a loader and operates a donkey cart. He provides haulage services to his customers. He is well-known among his customers for delivering goods on time. 

Rehana is the mother of three children, but only one of them is able to attend school due to limited resources. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to improve his business by purchasing a new donkey cart. His current cart has become rough and needs a replacement. 

Rehana is hopeful that by purchasing a new cart her husband will be able to provide better quality services to his clients and earn more profits.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for a haulage business

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, age 31, runs a beauty salon in Mombasa’s Kiembeni estate. Her business has been in operation for the last three years. She is the mother of two children.

Alice has a good credit history with KADET Ltd., and this will be the third time she has accessed a loan to help finance her business. With this loan, she plans to purchase a hair dryer and assorted hair products for use in her salon. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to help support her family.

Her dream is to own a big salon in future.

loans.use: to purchase a hair dryer and assorted hair products for use in her salon

loans.name: Edoh Adjoa

texts.fr: Revendeuse de charbon de bois à son domicile, Edoh est veuve et a 05 enfants. Elle veut assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter de la marchandise à Lomé. Elle a démarré en 2007 et est à son premier cycle de prêt.
texts.en: A retailer of charcoal at her home, Edoh is a widow caring for five children. She wants to provide a better future for her children and requests this loan to buy goods in Lomé. She started this activity in 2007 and is on her first loan cycle.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics, mayonnaise and three bags of sugar

loans.name: Segundo Exequiel

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 24 años de edad  y vive en casa de sus padres en el distrito de Saqa en Lambayeque. Goza de buenas referencias personales por parte de sus vecinos.

Segundo es un joven emprendedor y trabajador que se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 5 años. Actualmente, está sembrando maíz y solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes y hacer las labores de deshierbo respectivas.

Segundo tiene muchos deseos de superación. Desea mejorar la calidad de vida de sus padres y hacer arreglos dentro de su hogar. Este préstamo le sería de gran utilidad.
texts.en:
Segundo, 24, lives in his parents’ house in Saga District in Lambayeque.  He has good personal references from his neighbors. 

Segundo is an enterprising, hard working young man who has been farming for the last five years.  At present, he’s growing corn and asks Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy fertilizer and to carry out the respective weeding chores.

Segundo very much wants to get ahead in life.  He wants to improve his parents’ quality of life and to do some home improvements.  This loan will be of great use to him.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Sarum

texts.en: Sarum, 30, is a farmer. Her husband is a carpenter and their income is $3 per day. She has two children and one is studying. Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $15 on transportation and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes for villagers in order to make income. She wants to change her career to be a tailor because she has this skill and it can make good income. It will also allow her to stay home to take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to sew villagers clothes.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is a forty-six-year-old single mother of four children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Ever since she separated from her husband, she has been looking after the family by herself. She has been selling clothes for twenty years starting with 500,000 shillings and now has 2,000,000 shillings as her working capital. Her hardship is high rent and her vision is to own a boutique plus educating her children.

Marjorie needs the loan facility to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
La señora  Lorena   tiene 34 años de edad, se dedica  a la venta de antojitos mexicanos desde  hace cuatro años y a la venta de quesos desde 7 meses con su esposo Venancio que  tiene  la edad de  42 años.
Es una señora muy trabajadora, le gusta ayudar a su esposo en lo necesario cuando su esposo va a ordeñar al campo y regresa, ella se dedica a cuajar la leche y hacer los quesos.
Ella pidió el préstamo para  comprar  insumos para la  elaboración de  comida  como es : jitomate , cebolla , maíz para la elaboración de tortillas, carnes frías  etc.
Tiene la cantidad de  tres hijos una mujer  Maritza  de nueve  años de edad  y dos varones Manuel de doce años de edad y Enrique de  dieciocho  años  de edad .
Esta muy contenta con  su negocio   por que cada día va ganando mas clientes  y su negocio va creciendo , le  gusta mucho tener su propio  negocio por que  le ayuda a su  esposo en los gastos  de la casa  y a sus hijos para que puedan seguir estudiando.
Uno de sus sueños es poner una fonda  mas grande  que tenga juegos para  niños .
Le da las gracias  a fundación realidad  por el apoyo que les da a las personas que desean tener su propio negocio  y salir adelante  para ayudar a sus familias.
texts.en:
Lorena, 34, has sold Mexican fast food snacks for the last four years and has sold cheese with her husband, Venancio, 42, for the last 7 months.

She is a very hardworking woman who likes to help out her husband as much as possible.  When her husband goes out to the fields to milk the cows she takes care of curdling the milk and makes the cheese.

She asked for the loan to buy ingredients to make the food like: tomatoes, onions, corn to make tortillas, cold cuts, etc.

She has three children: a girl, Maritza, 9, and two boys, Manuel, 12, and Enrique, 18.  

She is very happy with her business because she’s acquiring new customers daily and the business is growing.  She likes having her own business because she helps her husband with household expenses and with her children’s education.  

One of her dreams is to set up a larger eatery that also has a play area for the children.  She thanks Fundación Realidad for the support it gives to people who want to have their own business to get ahead and help their families.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food preparation.

loans.name: Kory Inti Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KORY INTI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por seis integrantes las que están dirigidas por una mesa directiva  a la cabeza de la señora  Yola.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Macrame, venta de celulares, venta de mantas, venta de fruta, taller de carpintería.
 
La señora Yola indica que es el primer año que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un asesor. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta fruta, que viene trabajando hace doce años atrás, este oficio lo aprendió de su madre.

El crédito que sacará ahora es para el aumento de capital (compra de fruta) los que compra de la zona el Tejara y posteriormente lo venderá en su puesto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella esta casada y tiene dos hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Kory Inti" will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer at the Germán Busch central office.  This group has 6 members who are led by a board of directors headed by Yola.  The members of this communal bank have a variety of businesses such as: macrame, cellular phone sales, blanket sales, fruit sales, and a carpentry workshop.  

Yola states that this is the first year that she has been in a Pro Mujer communal bank; she joined the group at the invitation of a loan officer.   She currently  has a business selling fruit that she has been working in for two years.  She learned this business from her mother.

The loan that she is taking now will be used to increase her capital (to buy more fruit.)  She buys her fruit in the Tejara area, and later sells it from her stall.  This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as best she can.  She is married and has 2 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the savings accounts and the health services.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Renacer se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Ita, gracias a que la Señora Laura, contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 16 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el noveno ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria. 
La señora Laura tiene una despensa, comenta que diariamente se levanta muy temprano para abrir su negocio, pues desde esa hora ya tiene clientes aguardándola. Comenta que la despensa es el medio por medio del cual ella mantiene a su familia y todos aquellos quienes dependen de ella. Dice que tiene mucha clientela, lo cual la anima a seguir con su negocio.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos, panificados y otros para abastecer su negocio y de esa forma cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Renacer is the name of the excellent group of women formed in the city of Ita thanks to Laura, who contacted the advisor of a weekly meeting held in the area to inform herself about the type of work done by the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.  Once advised about the program, she managed to bring together 16 women who now find themselves working together very comfortably and in solidarity in their ninth cycle.

Laura has a grocery store.  She comments that she gets up very early to open her business, since from that time on she already has customers waiting for her.  The grocery store is how she supports her family and everyone who depends on her.  She says she has lots of customers, which encourages her to continue with her business.

She is requesting the loan to buy food, drinks, dairy products, baked goods, and other items to stock her business and so fulfill her obligations to her customers.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, baked goods, drinks, and other food.

loans.name: Makhliyo

texts.ru: Махлиё швея со стажем. Она начала свою предпринимательскую  деятельность  на свои сбережения в 2000 году. Махлиё  швея она занимается шитьем и реставрацией  брюк, халатов, плащей, пальто и других вещей. Махлиё не замужем, она работает  в ателье на рынке. Занимается она  предпринимательством самостоятельно. Махлиё имеет постоянных  клиентов. Махлиё  для развития деятельности  очень хочет приобрести швейную машину. Она просит займ на сумму 1600$ США. Кредит на эту сумму поможет ей в развитии бизнеса. Махлиё надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Makhliyo is a seamstress with experience.  She started her entrepreneurship with her savings in 2000.  Makhliyo is a seamstress and is involved in sewing and restoring pants, robes, raincoats, coats and other things.  She is not married and works at a tailor shop at a market.  She is involved in this business independently.  Makhliyo has many loyal customers.  She really needs to buy a sewing machine in order to develop her business. She is requesting a loan in the sum of $1600 to help her develop her business.  Makhliyo hopes to receive your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
At 57, Antonio patiently manages their corn farming business to earn a living. He is now a widower and has three adult children. Most of their children are already married and manage their own family. He aims to improve his business to earn and save for their future and to support his grandchildren. Sometimes he encounters hardships and problems in life but through his patience and determination, he is able to overcome them.

He aims to expand his corn plantation to increase his production, but due to financial difficulty, he is asking for additional capital of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides for the maintenance of his corn production. He hopes that he will have a plentiful harvest this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Asmin

texts.en:
Asmin is a married woman with 5 children, 3 of whom are enrolled in school and 2 of whom are adults. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of basic family needs. Asmin owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her family.

Asmin has operated a clothes selling business for the past 8 years. Her potential clients are the local area community members. She faces a major challenge of transporting her goods from the point of purchase to her place of business. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase more clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of its fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is 58 years old and has been actively farming in his home area of Nkubu, Central Kenya for over 30 years. His farm produces potatoes, cabbages, tea, and milk for the local market. He sells cereals at the local market for additional income.

Stanley has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to build a zero grazing unit for his dairy cows. He says the construction will protect the feed for his animals and generate more income through improved production. He also expects major changes in his family's living standards.

He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's services and is looking forward to a long term relationship with them.

loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Estelle Rajy

texts.fr:
Cliente âgée de 33ans , célibataire et mère d'un enfant, elle s'est lancée dans la restauration depuis 2009.
elle a deja bénéficié de 3 prêts et elle a remboursé sans défauts de paiements.. 
Dans le soucis d'élargir son restaurant , elle est  prit un autre prêt.
ses revenus par jour sont de 160.000f et elle épargne toujours durant les réunions de remboursements.
avec l'actuel prêt, elle va acheté  en gros  les aliments tels que:  3cartons de cuisses de poulets, 2cartons de viandes, 2cartons de poissons salés, 1 de 50kg panier de poissons fumés, 1 bidon de 25l d'huile , 1 sac de 50kg sac de riz, 1 carton de tomates en boîte, 1 barbecue , les condiments( oignons, cubes, poivres blanc , poivre noir, piment, ail ); et les chaises en plastiques.
Son souci est de faire  des grillades et des menus à emportés , sa clientèle augmente car les services  sont très acceptables.
Elle épargne et veut  ouvrir un restaurant plus moderne pour atteindre son objectif:acheté une parcelle et contribuer à l'éducation de son fils .
texts.en:
This client is 33 years old, single and the mother of one child. She launched a restaurant business back in 2009.
She already had three prior loans and repaid them without delay. Her daily revenues are about 160,000 Francs and she always saves in between loan payments. With the current loan, she will purchase some grocery items wholesale, such as: three boxes of chicken legs, two boxes of meat, two boxes of salted fish, one 50-kg basket of smoked fish, one 25-liter jug of  oil, one 50-kg bag of rice, one box of canned tomatoes, one barbecue [grill], condiments (onions, [sauce] cubes, white pepper, black pepper, pimento, garlic) as well as plastic chairs.

Her aim is to make grilled dishes and take-away foods. Her customer base is growing because her services are affordable. She puts money away as savings and would like to open a more modern restaurant in order to achieve her goal: to buy a   plot of land and  support her son’s education.

loans.use: achats :carton (cuisses, poisson sale, viande de boeuf), 1panier de poisson fumé, 1bidon d'huile, 1sac de riz, , 1carton de tomates en boîte,1barbacue, 20chaises en plastiques et quelque ustensiles de cuisine.

loans.name: Jovelisa

texts.en:
Jovelisa is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Jovelisa has run a shop for 5 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell. Jovelisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos  vive y trabaja en Chincha, Perú. Chincha es nombrado por la  cultura de los Chinchas, célebre por sus avanzados conocimientos de la agricultura y sus proezas marítimas. Hoy en día Chincha es una increíble mezcla de culturas, con una gran población afro-peruana, debido a los restos de un pasado indígena, y las influencias del imperio español. La ciudad, junto a otras ciudades cerca de la costa del Pacífico, fue dañada en el año 2001 y 2007, fechas en las que ocurrieron terremotos de fuerte dimensión, pero ha soportado como siempre lo ha hecho durante gran parte de su historia.			
			
El señor Juan Carlos está casado y  tiene 2 hijos, él es un hombre muy empeñoso que trabaja durante todo el día con la finalidad de brindarle a sus hijos siempre lo mejor, es por esto que desde hace 2 años decidió empezar  un negocio de transporte público, en una moto taxi, lo que actualmente le permite darle a sus pequeños y a su esposa gran parte de lo que necesitan a diario.	

Con el préstamo de S/.1,500 que recibirá gracias a los prestatarios KIVA, Juan Carlos podrá realizar algunas mejoras en su moto taxi, que desde hace ya algún tiempo necesita ser arreglada. Los ingresos que obtenga después de trabajar como lo hace actualmente, durante todo el día y descansar entre horas, le permitirá llegar a su meta la cual consiste en lograr vivir en un lugar mejor y tener más comodidades de acuerdo a los ingresos que obtenga, también quiere dejar como herencia a sus hijos una carrera profesional para que cuando sean independientes no sufran carencias.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos lives and works in Chincha, Peru.  Chincha is named for the Chincha culture, celebrated for its advanced knowledge of agriculture and its maritime prowess.  Today, Chincha is an incredible mix of cultures, with a large Afro-Peruvian culture, the remains of the indigenous past, and the influences of the Spanish empire.  The city, along with other cities close to the Pacific coast, was damaged in 2001 and 2007, years when there were strong earthquakes, but it has endured, as it always has during the better part of its history.

Juan Carlos is married and has two children.  He is a hardworking man who works all day with the goal of always giving his children the best.  This is why, two years ago, he decided to start a public transportation business, with a motorcycle taxi, which currently allows him to give his little ones and his wife most of what they need daily.

With the loan of 1,500 PEN that he will receive thanks to the Kiva lenders, Juan Carlos will be able to make some improvements to his motorcycle taxi that he has needed to make for some time.

The income he gets after working as he does now, all day and resting between meals, will allow him to reach his goal, which is to manage to live in a better place and have more comforts in accordance with the income he gets.  He also wants to give his children the legacy of a professional career so that they will not lack for anything when they are independent.

loans.use: to make improvements to his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: La Esperanza 3 Group

texts.es:
La formación del presente grupo fue gracias a una de las miembros, que invitó a sus amigas y vecinas a formar el grupo, en busca de un bien para todas ellas. Actualmente el grupo está integrado por 17 mujeres, muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, quienes están trabajando en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación Paraguaya.
Una de las miembros es la señora Yanina, quien trabaja todos los días para poder darle a su familia todo lo que ellos necesiten, para que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de privaciones. Ella se dedica a la venta de variadas prendas, su deseo es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma tener un poco más de ingresos para seguir ayudando a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para abastecerse con prendas de verano, ya que se acerca el calor y quiere tener un buen stock de prendas para cuando su cliente se las pida.
texts.en:
The formation of this group was thanks to one of the members who invited her friends and neighbors to form the group, in search of good for them all. Currently this group has 17 women, very hard workers and fighters, who are working in their 2nd cycle of the program for women entrepreneurs of the Paraguayan Foundation.

One of the members is Yanina who works every day to give her family everything that they need so that they do not lack anything. She works selling various kinds of garments. Her desire is to be able to continue growing so that she will have more income in order to continue helping her family.

She is asking for the loan in order to stock the business with summer outfits as it is going to be hot soon and she wants to have a good stock of clothing when her clients make a request.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Wallieth

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Wallieth works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Wallieth is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to  buy ingredient such as, fish, spices, meat, vegetable, etc. for her food vending business.

Wallieth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredient such as, fish, spices, meat, vegetable, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his tomato farming business.

loans.name: Ahliman

texts.en:
Ahliman is a 53 year old man who is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Fizuli region.  He settled in Ahmedbeyli village in the Fizuli region. He is married and has four children.
Having borrowed $600, he bought refrigerators.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to increase the variety of his stock. He has 15 years of experience in this business.

loans.use: to increase his stock of refrigerators

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.en:
Maria Dolores is a very hard-working woman. She is married with three daughters of 16, 21 and 25 years of age. Her husband works with basic chemicals, but does not earn enough to sustain the familiy's needs. Maria therefore decided to start working in sales. At first she sold nutritional products and then added cosmetics and jewellery to her list. Thanks to her love of sales and her personality she had increased her number of clients and improved her profits.

In order to supply the needs of her clients and offer them a better service, Maria is asking for a loan of $375 which she will use to buy products. She will repay the amount over a period of 4-8 months. Today is the time to help those who need it most and Maria and her family sincerely thank you for your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Dolores es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella es casada y tiene tres hijas, de 16, 21 y 25 años de edad. Su esposo labora como obrero en servicios Químico-Básicos, sin embargo, su salario no era suficiente para el sustento de su familia, por lo que Maria decidió iniciar con las ventas, en un principio vendía productos nutricionales, después incorporó la venta de cosméticos y joyería. Gracias a su gusto por las ventas y su carácter ha incrementado su número de clientes y ha mejorado sus utilidades.

Para poder surtir los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes y poder ofrecer un buen servicio, Maria solicita un crédito por $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Hoy es tiempo de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, Maria y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu generosidad.

loans.use: To buy products/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Kin

texts.en: Mrs. Kin C. is 27 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 2 children.  She earns a living renting rooms, a business that earns her $1/day.  Her husband earns $5/day as a policeman, and the couple's combined income is enough to send their children to school.  This loan will be used to purchase a cart to sell sugar cane juice.  Mrs. Kin C. has free time to sell juice, and knows it will be a good way to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase a cart to sell sugar cane juice

loans.name: Ojah

texts.en: Ojah is 29 years and is married. She sells vegetables, and her husband Soleh also sells them at the market. He usually earns $10 per day.  She wants to receive a $50 loan to expand her business and the rest will be used for her husband's business. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Mrs. Eva lives in her own house with her husband and children. They live on Buenos Aires Avenue in the San Martin zone of La Paz city. Eva works manufacturing handmade sweets. She sells the sweets to chifleras, who use them to make perfumes. She also travels and sells sweets in different towns of the Department of La Paz.

Eva is one of the clients who obtain credit through Kiva. The credit that they gave to her before was paid off on time. Now she she is asking for a new loan in order to keep increasing her capital and buy more raw materials in order to produce more sweets. Her candies are very appreciated by her clients.

Based on her past record she is eligible to receive another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Eva vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos, en la Av. Buenos Aires de la zona San Martin de la Ciudad de La Paz; ella se dedica a la elaboración de dulces artesanales los cuales vende a las chifleras que los utilizan para sahumerios; ella también viaja y vende sus dulces en diferentes pueblos del Departamento de La Paz.

Eva es parte de los clientes que consiguieron crédito a través de Kiva. El crédito que se le dio anteriormente fue cancelado de acuerdo al plan de pagos. Ahora solicita uno nuevo para seguir aumentando su capital y comprar más materia prima para producir mas dulces, los cuales tienen mucha aceptación entre sus clientes.

Por su antecedente puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials in order to make candy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her milk business

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina O. trades clothing wrappers. She is 32 years old and married with four children. She is from Uromi in Edo State, Nigeria.

Augustina needs a loan of $1,200 to buy more wrappers for sale. She learnt the trade from her sister and started hers in 1997.

loans.use: To buy more wrappers to sell

loans.name: Georgina Virginia

texts.es:
Mrs. Georgina Virginia belongs to the comunal bank "San Fernando 2", located in the settlement of Martha Chavez Mz. O Lt. #15, in the district of Yarina Cocha in the Ucayali department. She is 57 years old, married (her husband is a saleman), and has 5 children, one of which still lives with her. With the first loan of S./ 300 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos she started her own convenience store. Currently she still has her business. She wakes up very early in the morning to make breakfast and work on her convenience store. With the loan of S./1,800 soles, which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy one bag of sugar, one bag of rice, one box of oil, milk, canned goods, and seasonings that she will sell in her store. Georgina states that she feels very happy working with Manuela Ramos, and that she is very thankful for all the help that she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Georgina Virginia pertenece al Banco Comunal San Fernando 2, ubicado en el AA. HH. Martha Chávez Mz. O Lt. 15, distrito de Yarina Cocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 57 años, es madre de 5 hijos, el cual uno aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo es comerciante. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles, decide invertir en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad continúa con la bodega. Se levanta muy temprano para preparar el desayuno y simultáneamente se dedica a la atención de la bodega. Con el préstamo de S/ 1,800 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de 1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de arroz, 1 caja de aceite, leche, conservas y condimentos. Georgina nos dice que se siente muy bien trabajando con Mamuela Ramos y está muy agradecida por el apoyo que recibe.

loans.use: To buy groceries  (rice, sugar, oil, milk, etc) for her store.

loans.name: Aury Esther

texts.en:
Aury Esther is 28 years old and is the proud mother of a 9-year-old daughter and an 11-year-old son, both of whom attend school. Aury recently finished secondary school and she plans to start her university studies shortly. Aury has been running an open-air, barbecue restaurant for more than three years in the Media Blanca community of Nizao. Each day, many people visit her restaurant to enjoy the great variety of delicious food she offers. Aury explains that with profits from her business, she has purchased furniture for her living room and is able to pay for her children’s education.

The entrepreneur says that she would like to have a bigger restaurant with many employees and even more customers who will come to her restaurant every day to buy her great food. She is seeking a loan to buy a large quantity of raw materials to cook her menu items. Holy Week is a great opportunity for Aury to increase her sales volume because people love to enjoy barbecue food during this holiday.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to improve and expand her open-air, barbecue restaurant.

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en: Zakia lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is educated, married, and the mother of 3 children. She has a small knitting business. She has been involved in this business for more than 8 years. She works with her two daughters and with three more apprentices. They are all very hard workers. People purchase a lot of their knitted goods, so Zakia wants to expand her business. She wants to take an individual loan to be able to expand and to make good income to help her daughters and her family.

loans.use: To expand her small knitting business

loans.name: Zendia 2020-2 Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Mary A..  She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan for business expansion.  Mary is 45 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has 5 children ranging in age from 10 to 25 and her children go to school.  Each week, Mary makes approximately 300 Sudanese pounds in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business. Mary is joined in her small group by Fatina E., Hawa J., Lona P., and Joice M..  Fatina E. has a business selling charcoal and wants to open up a shop.  Hawa J. is currently operating a business selling bread and wants a loan to expand her business.  Lona P. operates a business selling vegetables and wants to expand her business.  Joice M. is currently in the business of selling vegetables and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Sorn S. raises pigs and lives in Romoul Village, Kampong Cham Province. She earns around $3 per day and her husband earns around $1.5 per day farming. They have five children, one of whom is married and three who work for a garment factory in Phnom Penh City. Because of her desire to expand her business and improve her family's income, she requests a loan of $700 to buy pig feed and purchase piglets to raise. They plan to use the remainder of the loan to repair their pigpen. The loan will allow them to expand the business and improve their family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise, buy pig feed, and repair their pigpen.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 44 years old and married with four children. All her children are in school. For three years she has been hawking and selling materials used for sewing school uniforms and other cloth in the community.

Paulina says basic schools will reopen soon and the demand for school uniforms will be very high. She therefore wants to use the loan to buy more materials to increase her stock for good sales and income to enable her to save some money for her children’s education.

Paulina is a member of the group called Amen. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy materials for school uniforms and cloth

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda has sold breakfast outside of her mother's house for four years. Every day she starts selling at 6:30 a.m. until 9:00 a.m. In the afternoons, she sells flavored drinks that she delivers to her neighbors. In the summer, she offers iced beverages.

She has invested the loans she has received in the purchase of utensils that she needs to make the breakfast she sells.

Hilda would like to sell food in the afternoons as well.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Hilda vende desayunos afuera de la casa de su mamá desde hace 4 años. Todos los días empieza a vender desde las 6.30 hasta las 9 de la mañana. Por las tardes vende emolientes que reparte a sus vecinos. En el verano ofrece refrescos helados.

Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha invertido en la compra de los utensilios que necesita para hacer sus desayunos.

A Hilda le gustaría vender comida en las tardes.

loans.use: To purchase the utensils she needs to make the breakfast she sells

loans.name: Lucy Smith

texts.es:
La señora Lucy pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, ubicado en el Jr prolongación Nº:177, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali.
