Lucy tiene 53 años de edad y una pequeña hija que aún depende de ella. Es madre soltera quien lucha constantemente por el bienestar de su hija. El tiempo que tiene en Manuela Ramos es de 6 años. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300, decide  invertir en la venta de productos de belleza.

Lucy cuenta con un puesto en el mercado Nº 2 , lugar donde vende productos de bisutería y pasamanería como ganchos, carmines, cosméticos, joyas, perfumes y otros, y también todo lo que es concerniente a damas, caballeros y niños.  

Con el préstamo de S/. 2.000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, invertirá en compra de 1 docena de vinchas. 3 docenas aretes, 2 docenas de pulseras, joyas, 3 talcos, 4 perfumes, 3 docenas de esmaltes y otros.   

Lucy es una mujer muy emprendedora, quien además está muy contenta de poder contar con el apoyo del banco comunal y que gracias a ello puede surtir más su negocio.
texts.en:
Miss Lucy belongs to the Talented Women Communal Bank, located in Prolongacion #177, district of Calleria, in the department of Ucayali. Lucy is 53 years old, ans she has a small daughter who still depends on her. She is a single mother who constantly fights for the well-being of his daughter.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 6 years. With the first loan $125, she decided to invest it in selling beauty products. Lucy has a stand at the Market Number 2, where she sells products like jewelry and trimmings such as hooks, lipsticks, cosmetics, perfumes and others, and also everything for women, men and children.

With the loan of $675, which she will repay over a period of 4 months, she will use it to buy a dozen of headbands. 3 dozens of earrings, 2 dozens of bracelets, jewelry, 3 boxes of talc, 4 perfumes, 3 dozens of nail enamels and others.

Lucy is a very enterprising woman, who is very happy to be able to have the support of the Communal Bank because with the bank support she has been able to buy supplies for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy headbans, earring, bracelets,  jewerly, nail enamels, etc.

loans.name: Alimdar

texts.en: Alimdar M. is 46 years old, married, and has five children. He earns income selling foodstuffs like tea, soft drinks, bread, chocolate, and a variety of sweets. Alimdar's store is located in a rented place in the center of the village in the Saatli region. He has been running his small business for more than 20 years, while his wife has been taking care of the household and the children. Alimdar's sales business is the main source of income for the family, and it also requires considerable investment. Alimdar works very hard to give his children a good education - in order to cover the higher education expenses of his elder son, Alimdar needs a loan of US$1,200 to be able to increase his working capital and the range of goods sold in his store. Alimdar thanks everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchase of additional goods for sale

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix O. is 32 years old. He is married without a child. Felix sells foam and carpets of various colors out of his store which is open from 7:30 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily. Felix is determined to lift his business and family out of poverty. To this end, he needs a loan amount of 102,000 N to purchase more carpets and foam to sell. He says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foam and carpets to sell

loans.name: Kisenyi J-Tusiime Group

texts.en:
Joseph Mary T., was a cashier a year ago, but now sells second hand clothes in Mbarara market. Her business fetches a profit of 60,000UGX per week from which she pays a weekly market charge of 6,000UGX. She keeps her customers satisfied by ensuring she stocks quality and fashionable outfits. However, her business is affected by the fluctuating transport costs due to the rise in price of fuel. This hinders her from efficiently reaching distant markets. As the festive season draws near, traders are forecasting a rapid rise in sales with attractive profit margins. Therefore, Mary is bracing herself for this season by purchasing the latest designs of female outfits like dresses, skirts, blouses and trousers. 

Mary is happily married with 3 children between the ages of 8 and 0.7. Two of them go to primary school. Her husband sells electrical goods. One of her greatest dreams is to independently import her own stock of clothes from overseas and sell them on a wholesale basis. This will enable her to comfortably support her husband in seeing their children through school.

loans.use: To purchasing the latest designs of female outfits like dresses, skirts, blouses and trousers.

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Yin Theap, 37, lives in Siem Reap Province where she makes a living by growing rice. She has been a farmer since 1979. She has no children and is married to Mr. Kan Mean, 43. He is a fisherman. She works hard everyday with her business to earn money to meet her family’s needs. She needs a loan to purchase rice seed and fertilizer and to pay for plowing her farmland. Yin’s husband is shown in the photo because she was not available for the photograph.

loans.use: To purchase rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth C. is a widow and has 3 children. She has received schooling through junior high. Elizabeth makes and sells variety of cooking oils at Mpoben in Elmina, which she has done since 1996. Elizabeth uses her income to pay for rent, utility bills, and other financial expenses.

Elizabeth will use the loan to increase her capital to buy more ingredients for the making of the cooking oil for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to reinvest back into the business to increase her profit margin so as to meet the financial needs of her family.

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy more ingredients for the making of the cooking oil

loans.name: Nuch

texts.en:
Nuch K. is 29 years old and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. This couple together has two young children, one of whom is in school.

Nuch is a goldsmith and makes about US$5 of profit every day. Her husband is a painter. On average, he makes around US$6 per day. Nuch would like to take out a loan of US$1200 to purchase gold and goldsmithing tools.

loans.use: To purchase gold and goldsmithing tools.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a 25-year old unwed mother of one child. Her child is her sole inspiration to pursue in her variety store business. She hopes that this business will be the source of income to finance the studies of her child.

Her variety store was established with only PHP 500 as initial capital. Her requested loan will be a great help for the business because she will be able to purchase more products. Her neighbors will  conveniently buy their needs from her store instead of going to the town proper.

She dreams that her business will expand after a year so that she will be sustaining to the expenses of her only child. She dreams that her child will finish her studies.

loans.use: To purchase of shampoo, cigarettes, and other mechandise for sale in her store

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida F. is a pig grower. She is 51 years old, married and has two children. She started her business in 1979 . She loves hog raising because she enjoys what she is doing and earns a bigger income from raising pigs. She also owns a small rice farm.

Her husband, Nestor F. is tilling their 1.5 hectare farm to feed and clothe their family. Pigs and rice are their only means of livelihood. She dreamed that someday, one of her children will fulfill her dreams of becoming a teacher. She wanted all of them to graduate from college so that when they are old, they will have better jobs to support their families.

She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy four sacks of feed for the pigs. She will also use some of the loans to increase the size of her pig fence. The loan will surely help Nida grow her piggery business.

CEVI helps her get a loan to run and sustain her business. Nida will receive credit, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchase feed for her pigs and expand fence.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto O. E. es un señor de 41 años de edad, quien vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos: Alexia y Cristian,  en una pequeña comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Las Delicias de Upala, localizada en la Provincia de Alajuela. Ahí se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, ganadería de doble propósito (carne y leche), siembra de granos básicos: arroz, frijoles, maíz entre otros.

Desde hace ocho años don Luis se dedica a la ganadería de doble propósito. Logra vender sus  productos a los vecinos de su comunidad quienes se muestran muy satisfechos con la calidad de los productos que ofrece. En su caso en particular, la demanda es mayor de lo que puede ofrecer actualmente. 

Don Luis considera que gracias al progreso de este proyecto, él y su familia han mejorado poco a poco sus condiciones de vida y ha logrado ser actores en el desarrollo de la comunidad, la cual se ve frecuentemente azotada por las inclemencias del tiempo y el desempleo.

Actualmente don Luis desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢570,000 (quinientos setenta mil colones), a un plazo de 24 meses para comprar tres vacas más  y así  poder incrementar la producción. El sabe que contar con mayor número de vacas más es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo. Sin embargo, el deseo de ser un microempresario exitoso y sacar adelante a su familia mejorando las condiciones de vida, lo motiva a esforzarse con gran esmero. 

Don Luis es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Datraban, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su séptimo préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto O. E. is 41 years old and lives with his wife and two children, Alexia and Cristian. They live in a small rural community in Costa Rica called “Las Delicias de Upala,” located in the province of Alajuela. This is where they develop their economic activities like commerce, raising cattle (for both meat and milk), and farming basic crops like rice, beans and corn. For the past 8 years Luis has worked raising cattle for meat and for milk. He sells his products to his neighbors, who are very satisfied with the quality of his products. In his particular case, the demand for his products is greater than what he can currently offer. Luis believes that, thanks to the progress of this project, he and his family have improved their living conditions. They have also become active in developing their community, which is frecuently affected by unemployment and bad weather conditions. Today Luis is hoping to receive a loan for ¢570,000 colones, which he will repay over 24 months. He will use the loan to buy 3 more cows in order to increase his production. He knows that having more animals means more sacrifice and more work, but his desire to be a successful small-business owner and help his family move forward motivates him to keep working with great strength. Luis is a member of the Community Credit Bank “Datraban,” one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his seventh loan and he hopes to continue growing on economic and personal levels. He also hopes to continue actively participating in the credit organization in his community.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase 3 cows

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es: Doña Celestina González tiene 45 años de edad, reside en Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, su esposo es albañil y tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, su negocio es la venta de cd y dvd, desde hace dos años que inicio con fondos de prestamos, sus planes es poder terminar de hacer su casa y hacer divisiones para poder tener privacidad con su familia. Este préstamo lo quiere para hacer un muro, para eso va  a comprar materiales de construcción y hacer divisiones de cuarto. Sus metas a futuro es poder adquirir un local donde pueda ofrecer su venta de bonitas y buenas películas, este negocio es rentable ya que se vende mucho y espera aumentar su capital.
texts.en:
Ms. Celestina González is a 45-year-old woman who lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. Her husband is a bricklayer, and they have three grown-up children. She started selling CD’s and DVD’s for a living two years ago with the help of loans. Her plan is to be able to finish building her house and make room partitions to give her family more privacy. She needs this loan so that she can build a wall, and for this, she will purchase building materials for the partitions. Her future goal is to be able to obtain an office space so that she can sell her high-quality movies. This business is profitable because she sells a lot of merchandise, so she hopes to increase her capital.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials to make room partitions

loans.name: María Teodora

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua la señora María Teodora T. desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de plátanos siendo comercializados todos los días por ella misma con el propósito de mantener su núcleo familiar.

El motive por el cual solicita un crédito es para la compra de los perecederos como lo son los plátanos por lo que espera muy confiadamente en que Ceprodel le brindará dicho crédito y así adquirirá su producto para mejorar su condición.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Teodora Torres has been personally selling bananas for several years at the Mayoreo Market in the city of Managua with the purpose of supporting her family. The reason she requests a loan is for the purchase of perishables like bananas, of which she strongly hopes that Ceprodel will grant her so that she may acquire her product and improve her situation.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bananas

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Deysi tiene su salón de belleza en el sector de La Ceja en la ciudad de El Alto y tiene una empleada que  trabaja con ella y los fines de semanas por la cantidad de demanda que tiene emplea a otra peinadora más. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de su pequeña hija de 7 años de edad. Deysi es madre soltera, vive en la casa de su madre ubicada en la Zona Llojeta de la Ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito lo destinará para la construcción de un cuarto en la casa de sus padres y de esa forma podrá tener mejor comodidad en su vivienda.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para la aprobación del   préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Deysi owns a beauty salon in the La Ceja area of the city of El Alto. She has one employee. Because the salon is very busy at weekends, she employs a second stylist at that time. This work is Deysi’s main source of income, and with it she supports her 7-year old daughter. She is a single mother, and lives in her mother’s house in the Llojeta neighbourhood of El Alto. The loan will be used to add a room to her parents’ house so that she will be able to live more comfortably in their home. This is Deysi’s first loan with Kiva partner, Impro. She has been evaluated and approved for the amount of money she requested.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to add a room to her parents’ house

loans.name: Alisia

texts.en:
Alisia M. is currently in the business of selling varous items at the shop and is requesting a loan to stock more items to sell. Twenty-nine years old and married to a nurse, she has five children, all attending school. With the extra profits from her loan, Alisia hopes to be able to buy land and build it for settlement.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more goods to sell

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
N. Jane is the leader of Tusooka Kwavula group in Lugazi. She is 48 years old, a hard-working and determined married lady with 4 children aged 20 – 10 years, all still in school, as she cares for 2 dependents.

Jane has a restaurant business that she has owned for 10 years and although business is good, she has always been faced with challenges of high costs for purchasing raw foods and the bad debtors who do not want to pay on time hence affecting Jane’s cash flow.

Jane sells mainly cooked food and refreshments from Kitega Jinja Highway and the quality meals and drinks she serves keep her customers coming back. She dreams of expanding her restaurant and having it occupy its own premises with a hope that this will bring in more income. She needs a loan to help her build a service counter for her restaurant since most of her previous loans have helped her in premises improvement.

loans.use: building a service counter for the restaurant for improved service

loans.name: Shamshad Muhammad Ramzan Group

texts.en:
Shamshad Baji is a 29-year-old married lady, and has been a citizen of Borewala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Her husband, M. R., is an electrician who also sells electrical supplies to his customers. He has been involved in this business for the past 6 years. Shamshad Baji is uneducated, but she admitted her four sons into school because she doesn’t want to deprive her kids of the blessing of education. Shamshad Baji is a very hard working lady. She gets up daily at 5 o’clock and goes to the market to buy timbers for cooking food for her family. She is applying for a loan to buy electrical supplies (switches, electric wires and switchboards) for her husband.

This loan is consists of four additional people:

Azizan Baji wants a loan to buy wheat to sell. Rafiqan Baji, Mumtaz Baji and Nasreen Baji all want loans to buy a donkey cart for loading.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: “Shamshad Baji is seated first from the right in this photo.”

loans.use: To buy electric supplies to sell

loans.name: Aida Soledad

texts.es:
Aida es una madre de familia de 54 años de edad que vive con su esposo y con sus tres hijos en el distrito de Eten, zona caracterizada por confeccionar artesanalmente sombreros de junco y que está ubicado a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella lleva mas de tres años comercializando ropa, trabaja en base a pedidos y compra su mercancía en la ciudad de Lima o en la frontera con Ecuador, sus clientes son tanto personas naturales como negocios y establecimientos de su ciudad.

Aída trabaja arduamente y trata de salir adelante con su negocio porque desea crear una tienda en donde pueda vender sus productos sin tener que distribuirlos, por este motivo está solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Su mas grande anhelo es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales y asegurarles un mejor futuro; es la segunda vez que trabaja con nosotros y ha demostrado ser una cliente responsable.
texts.en:
Aida is a 54-year-old mother who lives with her husband and their three children in the district of Eten, an area where the handmade production of reed hats is typical, located 5 minutes from the town of Chiclayo.

She has been selling clothes for more than three years, based on orders. She buys her merchandise in the city of Lima or at the border with Ecuador. Her customers are individuals as well as businesses and establishments of her town.´

Aida works hard and tries to get ahead with her business as she wishes to create a store where she can sell her products instead of distributing them and therefore she is requesting a loan of 2000 nuevos soles with our institution.

It is her greatest wish to see her children become professionals and assure them a better future. It is the second time she works with us and she has proven to be a responsible client.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothes for ladies, gentlemen, and children.

loans.name: Kwadwo

texts.en: Kwadwo M. sells jewellery in a transparent box at Abrodzirum near Shama-Kedzi.   Kwadwo has received a junior high school education.  He is married and has three children. His wife is a farmer.  Kwadwo has been selling jewellery in a transparent box since 1999.  He is responsible for paying fees and other bills. His loan will be used to buy more jewellery for sale. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to save towards building a new house.

loans.use: To buy more jewellery for sale.

loans.name: Melde

texts.en:
Melde G. is from the village of Sinara Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Melde owns and operates a business venture in the services sector, selling charcoal in the local community. Melde has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $112 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Melde joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melde has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide her service. Melde is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided. This will be her fifth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand her services

loans.name: 15 De Agosto Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal denominado  15 DE AGOSTO  está conformado por trece personas de edades variadas que oscilan desde los 20 a los 60 años. La presidenta de la banca es una persona de carácter fuerte y proactiva que tiene 3 hijos de los cuales solo una está en colegio, La Sra. Catalina es secretaria de la banca en una persona tranquila pero proactiva que en conjunto con sus vecinas forman parte de la banca, la Sra. Dolores es una persona con carácter muy alegre y colaboradora si bien no cuenta con una instrucción básica eso no le impide continuar con sus actividades, las otras personas que conforman la banca son de personalidades similares. La presidenta administra una pequeña distribuidora de material de construcción (ladrillos)  como gran parte de las socias de dedican a la venta de carne, los mismos establecidos en su domicilio,  otra parte de las  socias se dedican a venta de comida, otras a la confección y comercio de mantas de vicuña. Si bien dentro de los lugares donde se desarrollan sus actividades existen otros similares, la afluencia de  consumidores a los mercados, y el constante crecimiento urbano  hace que las actividades que se  desarrollaban en el lugar no se vean afectadas por lo contrario muchas de las socias están esperanzadas en hacer crecer sus negocios ampliándolos por lo cual solicitan el crédito. Las socias solicitan  el crédito para realizar la adquisición de otra máquina de coser para contratar a un ayudante en la confección de mantas, otras para la compra de materiales de construcción  para el ampliado de sus pequeños locales y dar mejor atención a sus clientes. Este grupo se encuentra en su primer ciclo, pero  la mayoría de ellas ya se conocen entre sí y cuentan con experiencia de trabajo en esta modalidad de crédito.

loans.use: COMPRAS DE MERCADERIA  Y MATERIA PRIMA

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth es una mujer dinámica y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, región D. Ucayali, tiene 49 años, es madre D. cinco hijos, todos mayores D. edad, Ruth se dedica a la venta D. zapatos, prendas D. vestir y perfumes, ella tiene este negocio en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo que se dedica a la venta D. pasamanería. Forma parte del Banco Comunal”Mujeres  Virtuosas” desD. hace cuatro años,  el primer préstamo que recibió fue D. 300 soles, dinero que le permitió invertir en zapatos.
Actualmente ella necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles que será utilizado para comprar correas, billeteras, carteras y zapatos D. cuero, ya que ella trae D. la ciudad D. Trujillo esta mercadería. La meta D. Ruth es  tener una tienda bien implementada D. artículos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Ruth is a dynamic and hardworking woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 49 years old and is the mother of five children, all of which are older. Ruth is involved in the sale of shoes, clothing, and perfumes. She has this business in her house, and has the support of her husband who is involved in the sale of passementerie. Ruth has been part of the “Mujeres Virtuosas” communal bank for the past four years. The first loan that she received was for 300 PEN, which allowed her to invest in shoes.

Ruth currently needs a loan of 3000 PEN which she will use to purchase belts, wallets, purses, and leather shoes, since she brings this merchandise from the city of Trujillo. Ruth’s goal is to have a well set up store with household items.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase belts, wallets, purses, and leather shoes

loans.name: Loeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Loeng T., 54, has been married with a new husband since 2006. Her husband is a construction worker. She has six children: three sons and three daughters. The eldest daughter works in a garment factory and another four are in school. They live in a small village along National Road Number 5 about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.
 
Loeng has been selling Ansorm (a kind of Cambodian cake made of rice paste wrapped in banana leaves) since 1979. Besides this business, she is a farmer and grows rice. She is asking for her first loan of $600 to use for growing rice.

loans.use: To use for growing rice

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is divorced with a grown son. She lives in Stryi and sells grocery items in one of the local food markets. Lubov has much experience working as a market vendor which helps her in her business endeavors as well. Her business is characterized by stability and consistency. She has been working in this trade for nine years. Currently, she has about 6,000 Grivnyas invested in merchandise. 

Lubov is seeking a loan of 9,750 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise and offer a wider variety of it for sale in her kiosk. She would like to increase the efficiency of her business and believes that additional financial assistance will help her with this plan.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Heydi

texts.es:
La señora Heydi, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Amistad del Dorado”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 25 años y es madre de 01 hijo,  que aun depende de ella.

Heydi, decidió vender sus comidas preparadas, ubicada en el Mercado de su Distrito y lleva 14 años en el negocio, cuenta con un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. A diario tiene muy buenas entradas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, sus principales clientes son moradores de la cuidad, transeúntes y clientes fijos, que ya la conocen. Nos cuenta que tiene muy buena acogida.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, vende en las mañanas de 6:00 am a 2:30 pm. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos de papas, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propio Restaurante, muy bien acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Heydi belongs to the La Amistad del Dorado Communal Bank in the Moyabamba district, Moyabamba province, San Martín department. She is 25, in a common law marriage, and has one child who is dependent upon her. Heydi decided to sell prepared meals at the market in her district. She has been in this business for 14 years. Her place is well equipped to wait on customers. She has lots of customers everyday due to her delicious seasoning. Her main customers are inhabitants of the city, people passing by, and regular customers. Her place is very popular. She currently continues with the same business. She is very happy with the work she does day to day. She sells in the mornings from 6:00 a.m. until 2:30 p.m. She personally waits on her customers with her characteristic charisma. She will use this loan for 2,000 PEN to buy supplies for the daily preparation of her food. She will buy things like kilos of rice and sugar, gallons of oil, sacks of potatoes, crates of chicken, and vegetables. She will also buy some utensils to better equip her business and give her customers better attention. She has the desire to get ahead. She has lots of dreams and goals in her life. She would like to establish her own very well equipped restaurant. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her fulfill her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to prepare her meals

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Z. Julienne est née en 1968 et vit depuis 41 ans à Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à SINDETHE Saturnin, Julienne est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Julienne vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Fiégnon. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Julienne n’a pas été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Julienne vend des savons liquides et aussi du poisson au Port de Pêche et à son domicile. Julienne s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Julienne exerce cette activité depuis environs 10 ans, et est à son troisième crédit à ALIDé. Julienne a bien remboursé les deux crédits qu’elle avait obtenus de ALIDé. Julienne sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de satisfaire la demande des clients.
texts.en:
Julienne Z. was born in 1968 and has lived for 41 years in Fiégnon in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Saturnin Sindethe, Julienne is the mother of four children, all who attend school. Julienne lives with all her children and her husband in Fiégnon. The couple shares the cost of the family expenses. Julienne did not attend school. To meet the needs of her family, Julienne sells liquid soaps and fish at the fishing port and from her home. Julienne gets her supplies from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Julienne has run this business for approximately ten years and this is her third loan from ALIDé. Julienne successfully repaid her two previous loans and has requested this third loan in order to increase her stock of products and to meet the demand of her clientele.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of liquid soap

loans.name: Thank You Jesus Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Thank You Jesus' Group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in the northern city of Makeni. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to add more goods to their businesses. In this way, they will be able to make more sales and better profit. Consequently, they can better support their children in terms of feeding, clothing, and in their academic pursuits. 

Samuel M. in the middle of the photo is the leader of this group. Samuel is 24 years of age. He was born in Makeni City, in northern Sierra Leone. Still a bachelor, Samuel has earned 3 years of experience in business. He sells vegetables, rice, and palm oil (the most popular cooking oil). With his share of this loan, he will buy about 100 gallons of palm oil and bags of vegetables to add to his business inventory.

loans.use: Buy about 100 gallons of palm oil and bags of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley supports the basic needs of her family through rice farming. She has five children in Norala, South Cotabato. Her eldest is 22 years old. She manages a rice field that is the main source of income for the family.

She’s asking for a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner, to finance her business. This loan will be used to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.use: Farm supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela M. G., reside en el Municipio de Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Su grupo familiar junto al cual vive esta conformado por su esposo quien es jubilado, su hija y una nieta. Adela es una señora muy esforzada y trabajadora, quien se dedica a confeccionar ropa para mujeres y hombre, la cual sale a vender de manera ambulante por las colonias y cantones del Municipio de Ilopango. Este trabajo lo desempeña por las mañanas, y luego en las tardes se dedica a pelar frutas y colocarlas en pequeñas bolsas, las cuales comercializa a las afueras de su casa, lugar muy estratégico para este tipo de ventas ya que su vivienda esta ubicada en calle principal, lo cual le permite tener mayor visibilidad por parte de sus clientes. Adela solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar tela de diferentes colores y estampados para poder cocer mayor variedad de prendas de vestir. Así mismo desea poder comprar más fruta y aderezos para estas tales como: chile, sal y limón. Todo esto lo hace con la esperanza de poder mejorar sus ingresos diarios, ya que la pensión que su esposo obtienes es muy poca, razón por la cual ella debe trabajar muy duro para solventar los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Adela M. G. lives in the town of Ilopango, located in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her retired husband, their daughter and a granddaughter. Adela is a very hard-working lady who makes women's and men's clothing, which she sells as a street vendor in the neighborhoods of Ilopango. She does this job in the morning, and in the afternoon she peels fruit and puts it in little bags which she sells outside her house. This is a very good place for this type of business since her house is on a main street, which allows her to be more visible to her customers. Adela is asking for this loan so she can buy fabric in different colors and patterns to sew different types of clothing. She also wants to be able to buy more fruit and fruit seasonings like chili, salt and lemon. She does all this in the hope of improving her daily income. Her husband's pension is very low, which is why she has to work very hard to cover household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and fruit

loans.name: Luis Narciso

texts.es: Luis es padre separado tiene hijos ya mayores de edad no tiene carga familiar, tiene casa propia se dedica a su propio taller de electricidad hace 11 años, tiene buenas referencias personales y experiencia creditica, solicita dicho credito para capital de trabajo  se propone por contar con capacidad y sobre todo voluntad de pago.
texts.en:
Luis is a father separated from his wife. He has grown children and no family responsibilities. He has his own house. He has worked in his own electrician business for 11 years. He has good personal references and credit experience. He is asking for this loan for working capital. He says one can count on his ability and mO. than anything his willingness to make payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 50-year-old married man and the father of three children, two of whom are still of school-age.

In 2004, Ali started working in agriculture as a new business. He cultivates all type of vegetables according to the season and he distributes the harvest to specified agricultural markets we work with. He’s thankful for his new business; it allows making extra money for the family.

Today, Ali is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy new farming supplies such as fertilizer and seeds because he's planning to expand his business and is very confident that he will be able to achieve substantial growth in the coming season.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
Mussarat is from a city named Borewala, famous for its shrines in Pakistan. She is 45 years old and married with three grown children, who are married. 

Her husband, M. is a mason. Mussarat requests a loan to buy masonry tools for her husband.  This she says will allow them to live comfortably.

loans.use: Buy masonry tools.

loans.name: Gladis Milagro

texts.es: Gladis Milagro L. de 51 años de edad, reside en Puerto el Triunfo, en el departamento de Usulután. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como agricultor y junto a sus dos hijos de 14 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar educación básica. Gladis posee una venta de tortillas, la cual está ubicada en su propia casa de habitación, ella se encarga de elaborarlas y venderlas cada mediodía y cada noche. Este negocio es muy importante para ella ya que representa gran parte de los ingresos fijos de su familia, los cuales le permite contar con todo lo necesario. Gladis solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de maíz lo cual le permita atender mayor cantidad de clientes y de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias, las cuales le permitan colaborar junto a su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Gladis Milagro L. is 51 years old and resides in Puerto El Triunfo, which is located in the Department of Usulután. She lives with her husband, who is a farmer, and their two children. They are both 14 years old and are studying for their basic education.

Gladis has a business in her home selling tortillas. She is in charge of making and selling tortillas every afternoon and every night. This business is very important to her because it represents a large part of the stable income for her family and allows them to have everything they need. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy a large quantity of corn. This will enable her to serve more customers and obtain better earnings so that she and her husband can cover all the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn

location.town: Puerto el Triunfo, departamento de Usulután

loans.name: Pony

texts.es:
Pony, de 35 años, es un hombre soltero, vive en la casa de su madre, de 71 años, a quien cuida porque es una persona que ya no puede valerse por sí sola.

En los terrenos de su madre, él planta café desde muy niño, actividad que realiza sólo, sin la ayuda de ningún familiar, pero para la plantación, limpieza y cosecha contrata operarios.
Lo que más le gusta de su labor es tener limpios sus terrenos, mientras por otro lado, le desagrada que a pesar de los esfuerzos que realizó la cosecha se retrase, como en la campaña anterior donde no pudo recolectar a tiempo el café porque no estaban desarrollados.
Su actividad le es muy rentable porque le permite vivir cómodamente, sin pasar necesidades, además está ahorrando para comprar una casa propia en la ciudad, así como instalar un vivero para que renueve constantemente sus plantas.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y asegura que le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque está integrado por personas muy compresivas y exigentes en los pagos, que le enseñan a ser responsable. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita comprará 6 sacos de fertilizantes y dos mil plantas de café para renovar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Pony, 35, is a single man. He lives in his 71-year-old mother's house and takes care of her because she is a person who can no longer fend for herself. Since he was very young he has planted coffee on his mother's land. He does this alone, without the help of any relatives, but for planting, clearing the land and harvesting he uses hired hands. What Pony likes best is to have the land cleared, while on the other hand, it bothers him that despite all his effort the harvest can be delayed, like last season when he couldn't harvest the coffee on time because the beans weren't ripe. His work is very profitable for him because it allows him to live comfortably, without lacking necessities. Besides this, he is saving to buy his own house in the city and install a nursery so he can constantly renew his plants. This is the second loan he has had with MFP, and he states that he likes to work with his communal bank because it is formed by very kind people who are strict about payments, and they teach him to be responsible. With the 2,000 new soles he is asking for, Pony will buy six sacks of fertilizer and 2,000 coffee plants to renew his crop.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and coffee plants

loans.name: Madina

texts.fr:
Madame Madina Dougouné  est âgée de 65 ans, veuve elle vit avec sa coépouse et  ses 8 enfants dans le quartier Darsalam de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elle fréquenta la medersa  et l’abandonna en classe de 6ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien) pour se marier par la volonté de ses parents. 
Elle mena plusieurs activités commerciales telles que la vente d’habits et de fruits et légumes  bien avant de venir à la vente de calebasses qu’elle fait depuis 21 ans et jouit d’une grande notoriété et clientèle à Ségou et à Bamako. 
Ses calebasses une fois achetées sur le marché sont soigneusement lavées et emballés donnant une bonne vu et envie de les acheter. 
Pour pérenniser son activité elle fait recours à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elle est en relation depuis  bientôt deux ans. Tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés.
 Elle compte utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour acheter, 3 rouleaux de  calebasses. Elle s’approvisionne sur place au grand marché de Ségou auprès des grossistes et producteurs. 
 Madame Madina Dougouné vend au comptant, en détail et à crédit  à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. 
Elle reçoit beaucoup  de commandes venant  de Bamako et envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000FCFA qui lui permettra de consolider son fonds de commerce et d’aider son premier garçon dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales. 
Son ambition est d’acheter un terrain à usage d’habitation propre.
texts.en:
Madame Madina Dougouné is a 65-year old widow who lives with her 8 children and a co-wife of her late husband in the Darsalam de Ségou region of Mali. She attended a Madrasa, but her parents required her to quit during her 6th year of school for an arranged marriage. In the past, Mme. Dougouné has had a variety of commercial enterprises, including selling fruits and vegetables. For the last 21 years, she has specialized in selling gourds, for which she is well-known and has a good clientele in Ségou and Bamako. After purchasing the gourds at the market, she carefully washes and wraps them, making them very attractive to buyers. Mme. Dougouné sells her gourds retail for cash and credit. Her clients are mostly women. To finance her business, Mme. Dougouné has borrowed from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for two years. All of her previous loans were repaid. She plans to use the new loan to purchase 3 rolls of gourds from wholesalers and producers in the market at Ségou. She receives many orders from Bamako, and expects to realize a monthly benefit of 100,000 CFA which will permit her to build her operating capital and help her oldest son with the family expenses. Her goal is to purchase a parcel of land for her own residence.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase gourds for resale

loans.name: Jose Ruben

texts.es:
José de 34 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, tiene dos hijos de 9 y 8 años, para poder mantener a su familia el tuvo que readecuar su casa e invertir sus ahorros en víveres para tener una tienda.   

Comenzó vendiendo enlatados y arroz poco a poco fue incrementando su tienda con la ayuda de su esposa, comprar semanalmente los víveres y trabaja desde las 06:00am hasta las 20:00pm todos los días. Pero como ya comenzaron clases sus hijos el necesita comprarle los útiles escolares por eso con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos y libros.

En el futuro quiere agrandar su tienda con mas víveres.
texts.en:
Jose, 34, lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil. He has two children, 9 and 8 years old. To support his family, he had to adapt his house and invest his savings in supplies for a grocery. Jose began selling canned goods and rice and, with his wife's help, gradually built up the store. He buys stock for the store once a week and works there from 6:00am to 8:00pm every day. He now needs to buy the school supplies that his children needs and he wants to use this loan to buy books and other school supplies. In the future, he wants to expand his stores with a wider range of products.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new kids' clothing to sell for the summer season

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn R., 22 years old and married, is from the village of Plaridel, Claveria, Misamis Oriental, where she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over a year, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP for the same purpose. Marlyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Joenila

texts.en: Joenila F.'s main source of income comes from operating motorcycle transport services like habal-habal in her community. She is 33 years old, single and has one school-aged child. They are from the village of Pob. 2, Oroquieta City. Joenila has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Joenila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Joenila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Joenila is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle using in the business. This will be her seventh loan from GDMPC. She plans to save the additional revenue as a reserve for future emergencies. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle

loans.name: Marbelle

texts.es: Marbelle C. V., tiene la edad de 28 años, está casado, y  tiene un hijo de  10 años de edad, que es su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Marbelle también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.
texts.en:
Marbelle C. V. is 28 years old. She is married and has a 10 year old son, who is her highest priority. She requests the loan to support her farm, for growing coffee in particular. Her plan is to buy manure and fertilizer. She wants to give her coffee crops the required maintenance to achieve a better quality and the highest income possible at harvest time. This is the first time she requests a loan through FUDECOSUR and is very happy with the support received. Marbelle has been working in agriculture for years. In future she hopes to be able to provide her family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability, and to continue to grow both as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Support for coffee growing.

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Kosar is 42 years old and lives in Kasur, which is a small city located near Lahore Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its leather industry. She moved into a three room brick house here after her marriage with S. A.. She is the mother of three sons and a daughter. Only her eldest son is able to attend school and is studying in 2nd standard. 

Her husband and she have both been operating a milk selling business for the last 10 years. S.’s father shifted his business to him after he grew old. Now he is operating this business very well.  He has a vast space available for keeping buffalos at his house.  He wants to improve his milk selling business by buying another buffalo.  

Kosar has applied for a loan from Asasah which will be used by her husband in purchasing another buffalo. Kosar hopes that her husband will be able to increase his income by selling a larger quantity of milk. Kosar remains concerned about the fact that she is not able to send her younger children to school but she is hopeful that with increased income she will soon be in a position to provide education to her remaining children also. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and is in her 3rd loan cycle.

loans.use: Purchase another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Koffi Benjamin

texts.fr: ce monsieur a ouvert en 2008, sa boutique de vente d'articles de quincaillerie, ce commerce est rentable au togo car la population ne cesse de croître et il y par conséquent des besoins d'habitation. il s'approvisionne au ghana voisin et à lomé. la demande de sa clientèle est de plus en plus élevé, il sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour s'approvisionner en articles de quincaillerie.Il est marié et père d'un enfant.
texts.en:
This gentleman opened his hardware store in 2008. This is a profitable business in Togo as the population is still growing, and with it, the need for housing. He gets his stocks in neighboring Ghana, and also in Lomé. With customer demand increasing steadily, he is seeking a loan from WAGES to stock up on hardware items. He is married and the father of one child.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hardware store supplies

loans.name: Virginie

texts.en:
Viriginie was born in 1964 and is married with six children; the first one is 22 and the last one is 12 years old. Virginie is a business woman and her husband is a teacher; these parents work hard so that they provide all that is necessary for their children because they have a big family. 

Viriginie rents out the decoration materials; this business is profitable and that is the reason why ti was chosen by her. The business is well-known in her residence place. Viriginie is serious: her business starts at 5 in the morning and is open to 6 in the evening every day.

Virginie is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more equipment to be used in her business. This expansion will make her more effective and efficient and successful.

loans.use: Purchasing more equipment to rent out

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
El señor Efraín cliente antiguo de la institución, de edad de 35 años vive en la localidad de el  Torno barrio las palmas hace 8 años, oriundo de Cochabamba.
Estado civil: concubino con la Sra. Nieves de edad 36 años cuenta con la actividad de servicio de limpieza hace 1 año en una institución de la localidad, el sr. Se dedica al  trasporte hace 15 años en Santa Cruz en un radio móvil muy conocido de la ciudad, Con el dinero del crédito realizara el mantenimiento a su movilidad ya que esta presentando algunas fallas, y no le permite brindar un servicio bueno a sus clientes.  El cliente esta agradecido por que nuevamente confiamos en ellos y agilizamos su préstamo para poder invertir en lo que ellos necesitan.
texts.en:
Efraín is a longstanding client of the institution.  He is 35 years old and has lived in Torno’s Las Palmas neighborhood for the last 8 years.  He is from Cochabamba. 

He is in a common law marriage with Nieves, 36, who has worked as a cleaning lady in a local institution for the past year.   He has worked in transportation for a very well known radio taxi service for 15 years in Santa Cruz .

With the loan funds they will provide the vehicle with needed service and repairs because it’s starting to have some mechanical problems and he isn’t able to provide his customers with the best service.

He is grateful that once again we trust him and have facilitated his loan to invest in the things they need.

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine N. is a 54-year-old widowed mother of six who operates a drug pharmacy in Bukoloto-Kayunga. She has been selling drugs for the last 10 years. The fact that she is a trained nurse has been an advantage in that the prescription of drugs has not posed any kind of hitch to her. Her business accrues 200,000 shillings monthly. 

Christine describes herself as fully focused and steadfast, especially with the plans to elevate the status of her business and family. With this loan, she says she is going to purchase more drugs for resale at her pharmacy.

loans.use: The purchase of more drugs for resale

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo C. is from the village of Segatic Daku Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 43 years old. Rodrigo is married and has nine school-age children. 

Rodrigo owns a business in which he raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Rodrigo has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rodrigo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodrigo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rodrigo is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilda; tiene 46 años de edad, y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta y producción  de artesanía, ella vende en forma independiente y otras artesanías como collares y aretes los realiza y luego lo distribuye a las demás tiendas de artesanía, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio de venta de artesanía. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía como chompas, mantas y chalinas.

 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “LOS DIAMANTES” (“The Diamonds”) cooperative bank; the bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the department and province of Cusco.

The member is Ms. Hilda; she is 46 years old, married, and has 4 children.  She alternates her daily activities between making and selling handicrafts.  She sells independently, including other handicrafts such as necklaces and earrings.  She makes her products and then distributes them among crafts stores.

She would like to expand and improve her business.  She requests the loan in order to buy handmade items such as sweaters, blankets and scarves.

The member is thankful for the loan, and commits to making her installment payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase handicrafts such as sweaters, blankets and scarves.

loans.name: Evella

texts.en:
Evella R. is from the village of Rogongon, Iligan City. She is 50 years old. Evella is married and has 11 adult children. To make a living, Evella owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling bananas such as "lakatan & tundan" in the local community. Evella has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional bananas to sell. Evella is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Evella from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas

location.town: Rogongon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa e hijo en el sector La Esperanza del distrito de Reque, una zona rural de pobladores humildes que se dedican principalmente a la agricultura. Se encuentra situada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas, específicamente a la siembra de verduras. El ha arrendado un terreno en donde ha instalado el cultivo de tomate, Manuel cuenta con bastante conocimiento acerca del cultivo de verduras y se esta valiendo de ellos para sacar adelante a su familia y progresar en la vida.

 Adicionalmente se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros dentro de su localidad y en las zonas aledañas. Para lo cual se vale de una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar labores de transporte).

Manuel desea brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo para asegurarse una buena cosecha, por ello desea adquirir algunas medicinas que prevengan la aparición de planas en su plantación de tomates. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Manuel, 32, is a father living with his wife and son in the La Esperanza sector of Reque district, a rural area populated by humble people who are mostly farmers.  It is located over twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He is a farmer, specifically of vegetables.  He has rented a field where he is growing tomatoes.  Manuel has quite a bit of knowledge about vegetable farming and he’s using it for his family’s wellbeing and to progress in life.

In addition, he provides passenger and cargo transportation services within his locality and in neighboring zones for which he uses a mototaxi (motorized vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with an attached cabin used for transport).

Manuel wants to provide maintenance to his plants to insure a good harvest so wants to buy some medicines that will prevent plagues in his tomato plants.  To do this, therefore, he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan.

loans.use: For tomato crop care.

loans.name: Siguidolo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Siguidolo, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 37 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Konobougou, préfecture de Barouéli ; Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de calebasses, d’habillements, de poissons et la restauration.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Siguidolo sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des tissus, des poissons, des calebasses et des condiments pour la restauration.                                                                          
KADIATOU C. s’approvisionne en riz et condiments au marché de Konobougou destinés à la restauration. Elle vend ses aliments au bord du goudron de Konobougou, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de restauration.
texts.en:
The women of the group Siguidolo are all married and average 37 years of age and four children living in traditional extended families in Konobougou City, in Barouéli prefecture, Region of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members know one another through ties of kinship. They do commerce in calabashes, clothing, and fish, and they work in food service. The group members are now on their sixth solidarity loan, which will be used for buying cloth, fish, calabashes, and condiments, and for food catering.  

Ms. Kadiatou C. gets her supplies of rice and condiments at the Konobougou market for use in cooking dishes. Accepting cash or credit from a customer base composed of women and men, she sells her dishes along the edges of the asphalt in Konobougou.

Kadiatou envisions making an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA that will be used for making the loan payments and for assisting with societal ceremonies. The rest will be reinvested in her restaurant business.

loans.use: Buying ingredients for food catering

loans.name: María Amelia

texts.es:
María tiene 41 años de edad, es conviviente y reside junto a su familia en Tambogrande, que pertenece a la región Piura, a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque.

Ella tiene una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio, donde atiende de manera muy amable a sus clientes, los que a la fecha ya están fidelizados. Asimismo, María en su afán de salir adelante, vende productos cosméticos, los que obtiene de un proveedor.  También con la ayuda de su esposo cría ganado porcino y ovino, los que engorda y una vez ya desarrollados los vende a sus vecinos y comerciantes que llegan a la zona donde vive. 

María desea adquirir más alimento para engordar a su ganado, luego venderlos y obtener mayores ingresos para ayudar a su familia. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1700 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Maria is 41 years old and she lives together with her husband and family in Tambogrande, in the region of Piura. It is located 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the department of Lambayeque. 

She has a small store installed in her home. She is able to tend to her customers in a very kind manner, all of whom have remained steady clients. Maria's goal is to come out ahead. She sells cosmetics which she acquires from a distributor. And with the help of her husband she also raises pigs and sheep. She fattens them and once they have developed she sells them to her neighbors and to the merchants who visit the region where they live. 

Maria wishes to acquire more feed to fatten her livestock, to sell and to obtain improve earnings for her family. She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1700 nuevos soles in order to meet her objective.

loans.use: To purchase balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Burma's Group

texts.en:
Burma N., 36, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Nookat, a small village near Osh (south of Kyrgyzstan). She has two sons and a daughter. The daughter is in school and the other children are not yet. In order to earn money, her husband works in construction. He has a lot of experience in this activity; he built a house for the family by himself. The family needs money for purchasing building materials.  In the near future, Burma wants to build a fence near her house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Maribel Valentina

texts.es: La señora Maribel es cliente antigua de la institución,  se dedica al tejido de chompas para niños la cual la realiza a maquina. Ella anteriormente viajaba al interior llevando sus productos en la actualidad ella vende las chompas que teje en un puesto en alquiler en la feria 16 de julio en la avenida panorámica esto debido a que su pequeña hija esta creciendo y no puede ya viajar con ella, es por esto que solicita el préstamo para poder dar un anticipo a la dueña del puesto y mas adelante poder comprar el mismo, la cliente es una mujer responsable y trabajadora.  Ella se siente muy feliz de recibir el préstamo el cual le ayudara a superarse.
texts.en:
Maribel is a long-standing client of our institution.  Her business is knitting children's sweaters with a machine.  Maribel used to travel to the provinces with her products but she currently sells the sweaters that she knits from a rented stall in the '16 de julio market' on Avenida Panorámica.  She made this change because her young daughter is growing and she can no longer travel with her.

Maribel is requesting a loan so that she can make a down payment to the owner of her stall and, in the future, be able to buy the stall.  Our client is a responsible and hard-working woman.  She feels very happy to be receiving the loan which will help her to improve herself.

loans.use: To make a down payment on buying a stall

loans.name: Hiek

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiek who was born in 1964 is married to Mr. Vai. They have three children, who are studying in local public school and helping out in their parents’ businesses. Mrs. Hiek is a pig breeder who can earn some income to support her family while her husband is a farmer who owns a 5-hectare plot of land where he grows rice.He sells part of the harvest and keeps the rest to feed his family.  He also owns a harvest machine and a threshing machine. 

Presently, Mrs. Hiek faces an obstacle because her harvest machine is broken. So Mrs. Hiek is applying for a loan to fix her harvest machine. With any remainder of the loan she is going to buy more gasoline to fill the harvest machine and the threshing machine for renting out to other farmers. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To fix her harvest machine

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en: Cristy is a 33-year-old married woman who supports her family by fishing and buying and selling frozen foods.  She lives in Aborlan, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing and frozen foods businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. Cristy is borrowing PHP 16,000 to purchase fishing supplies. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Cristy aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase fishing supplies

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
For Wilma B., the more blessings one receives, the more that person is enabled to give. Wilma, 47, focuses on making her shop grow but more than that, she sees to it that she does help other people. Wilma is a life partner to Nicomedes, an overseas Filipino worker (OFW), and mother to two children. One studies in high school, while the other is in elementary.  They presently live in Malaria, Caloocan City.

Wilma’s business is two-pronged. First, she is into direct sales. She sells items like clothes and shoes which go along with the taste of the customers. Also, she has a computer shop which she manages. It is located in the extension of their house and profits remarkably. Every month, Wilma earns an estimated net income of around Php 13,000.

To help her continue operation of her businesses, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She intends to use this money to purchase two sets of computers, so that the shop can accommodate more clients.  Also, with part of this loan, she will purchase some cosmetics ordered in advance by her customers.

The rainy season hampers Wilma’s business. Nevertheless, she refuses to be hindered by business challenges from helping others, especially youth. Even as she meets the daily needs of her family, she desires to help others to meet their needs, too. For her, this is the way to become a successful business woman.  As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional two computer units and cosmetics ordered in advance by customers.

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.ar: موسى عمره 39 سنة متزوج وله ولدان يعمل في مطعم لبيع الوجبات السريعة له في العمل سنتين  يحب عمله ويتميز به حيث انه يملك وجبات مميزة يسعى الى تطوير عمله والى تحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي له ولعائلته يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى زياة البضاعة في المحل من دجاج ولحوم والى صيانة المطعم حتى يستطيع مواصلة المنافسة مع غيره له زبائن من جيرانه واصدقائه كان للقرض السابق الأثر الجيد على عمله وكان يلقى الدعم الكامل من العائلة
texts.en: Mousa is 39 years old and married with two children. He works in a fast food restaurant, and has two years of experience in his position. He likes his work and stands out in his field because the food he makes stands out among other fast food options in the area. He is trying to develop his business and improve his and his family's material situation and social status. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to increase the chicken and meat supplies of his restaurant, as well as have maintenance completed on various items in his restaurant. These improvements will help him to continue to compete with the other businesses in his line of work. He has customers from among his neighbors and his friends. His last loan had a positive effect on his business, and during it, he received the full support of his family.

loans.use: to purchase chicken and meat for his restaurant, and to replace old equipment in his restaurant with new equipment.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a married woman with three children who go to school. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a greengrocer business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. Naomi faces the major challenges of competition and seasonality. During the rainy season the availability of vegetables to sell is low. She dreams of opening a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase two crates of potatoes, onions, 2 sacks of cabbages and 3 crates of bananas. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase two crates of potatoes, onions, 2 sacks of cabbages and 3 crates of bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fresh fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma operates a sewing business making clothes  for her neighboring clients to financially support her family. Besides her work, she also carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well.

Her husband is a salesman. He sells candies and other eatable items like chips and biscuits at different shops on order. 

All of Asma’a children are illiterate because she didn’t have enough financial resources to educate them. Her eldest son operates a clothes selling shop while the other two children work at sewing school bags. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s business sewing bags. With the loan, he will buy material such as leather, thread, needles and zips, etc. for sewing bags which will help him fill orders on time and earn more profits. 

He has good experience in his business and Asma hopes that an investment will help him make his business more profitable.

loans.use: To buy materials for her son for sewing leather school bags.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a 21-year-old mother of two daughters and one son. Her husband appears in the picture here instead of her as she is a conservative woman from GAZA. He is a taxi driver. Her husband wants to pay maintenance expenses therefore she took out a loan from FATEN to cover those expenses.

Nida's husband is saving money to purchase a new taxi soon.

loans.use: to pay taxi maintenance expenses.

loans.name: Ganillatou

texts.fr: Née 2 août 1977 au Bénin, Ganillatou est une veuve qui à trois enfants dont un reste encore à sa charge. Ganillatou n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de son enfant Ganillatou mène comme activité la vente des produits divers et des ustensiles de cuisine en plastiques. Grâce au revenu que lui génèrent ses activités Ganillatou assure les différentes dépenses de sa famille. Ganillatou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et vend ses produits à son domicile. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour améliorer son niveau de vie, Ganillatou sollicite pour une troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: Ganillatou was born in Benin on August 2, 1977. She is widowed and the mother of three children, with one still in her care. Ganillatou never attended school. To provide for her needs and those of her child, she sells various articles and plastic kitchen utensils. Thanks to her income from this activity, Ganillatou pays for the various household expenses. She buys her supplies at a market in Benin and sells her goods out of her home. Eager to satisfy her customers and raise her standard of living, Ganillatou came to the microfinance institution Alidé and applied for her third loan.

loans.use: to buy various products and plastic kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Ma. Dina

texts.en:
Ma. Dina is 43 years old and married with 6 children.
