Ma. Dina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell nipa in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. A nipa is a native house that has traditionally been constructed with bamboo tied together and covered with a thatched roof using nipa/anahaw leaves.

Ma. Dina has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell nipa for 7 years and also earns an income from fish and shrimp vending.

Ma. Dina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: Rodolfo con su credikiva anterior, compró dos lavadoras, con ellas ampliò su cobertura de clientes y ganò dinero. Ahora se prepara para comprar mercancias para la venta como abanicos, licuadoras, planchas, televisores, y por eso aplica hoy a su segundo credikiva, pues está seguro que con ese dinero, aprovecharà los bajos intereses para ganar mas y los buenos descuentos en estos articulos, que ahora mismo tiene el mercado . Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente:" Que sigan apoyando a las personas con pequeños negocios pero con grandes historias, para seguir fortaleciendo el ingreso familiar y aumentar el bienestar del hogar." Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Rodolfo ingrese al siguiente enlace: http://kiva.org/lend/269392
texts.en:
Rodolfo used his previous Kiva loan to buy two washing machines.  This enabled him to expand his customer base and earn money.  Now he is preparing to buy merchandise to sell such as fans, blenders, irons and television sets.  For this reason, he is today applying for his second Kiva loan.  He is certain that, with this money, he will be able to make the most of the low interest rates in order to earn more and take advantage of the good discounts that he is able to get on these items on the market right now.  His message to Kiva lenders is the following "Please continue supporting people with small businesses but big stories, so that they can continue strengthening their family income and increase the well-being of their households".

If you would like to know more about Rodolfo's story, please click on the following link: http://kiva.org/lend/269392

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances to sell

loans.name: El Polvorin Group

texts.es:
La señora Reyna tiene 30 años de edad la localidad donde vive es muy prolifero el cultivo de aguacate, ella es casada y su esposo es jornalero y tienen una hija la cual estudia la primaria. Doña Reyna pertenece a un grupo de crédito llamado “El Polvorín”  comenta que le pusieron es nombre por que así le dicen a la colonia donde vive. Ella es una mujer trabajadora y muy activa ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 6 años dice que emprendió ese negocio para estar mas al pendiente de sus hijos. Ella esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para comprar productos para tener surtida su tienda de abarrotes como azúcar, jabón, leche, café, huevo, arroz y artículos de primera necesidad etc. ella se va a surtir a una población cercana a la de ella en supermercados donde le dan bajos precios para que después ella pueda ganarles algo. La meta que tiene la señora Reyna es mas adelante poner un local de cemento ya que donde tiene sus productos es un cuartito de madera ella quisiera ponerse ahorrar para hacer su local y tener muy bien surtido su negocio ya que es la fuente de empleo muy importante para ella.
Los otros nueve integrantes se llaman Catalina, María Guadalupe, Diana Martina, Rosa María, María Isabel, Adela, Ana Luisa, Ygnacia y Gabriel ellos invertirán su crédito que les están otorgando en diferentes negocios como en puesto de frutas y legumbres, en ropa para dama por catalogo, puesto de dulces, en una florería.
texts.en:
Reyna is 30 years old.  In the locality where she lives avocadoes grow profusely.  She’s married and her husband’s a day laborer.  They have a daughter who is in elementary school.  

Reyna belongs to a credit group called “El Polvorín” (Powder Keg).  She comments that they chose that name because that’s what their neighborhood is called.  She is a very hardworking, very active woman.  She’s had a grocery store for the last six years.  She says she started this business in order to be able to be more watchful of her children.  

She is asking the financial agency for a loan to buy stock merchandise for her store like: sugar, soap, milk, coffee, eggs, rice and basic need items.  She goes to a nearby town to stock up on goods at a supermarket there where prices are lower and she can then earn a bit of profit.  

Reyna’s goal is to build a space later on out of cement because she currently keeps her products in a little wooden room.  She’d like to start to save up and have her business very well stocked because this is a very important source of employment for her.

The other nine group members are: Catalina, María Guadalupe, Diana Martina, Rosa María, María Isabel, Adela, Ana Luisa, Ygnacia and Gabriel.  They will use the loan they are getting in various businesses like: fruit and vegetable stand, women’s catalogue clothing sales, candy stand and a flower shop.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Fidel Angel

texts.es:
Fidel, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad, es empleado pero además trabaja en el cultivo de maíz y frijol, su trabajo es como promotor de proyectos sociales de la Alcaldía Municipal, pero además es agricultor en sus momentos libres atiende las tareas de la agricultura.
El quiere invertir un préstamo en abono para sus cultivos, ya que con este insumo fortalecerá la plantación, garantizándole un buen desarrollo y producción.
Su propósito es que sus hijos sientan su apoyo, que aprovechen sus estudios y se superen en el futuro.
texts.en:
Fidel lives with his wife and two children, ages 10 and 8. He is employed but also grows corn and beans. He works as a promoter of social projects for his municipality but he is also a farmer in his free time and does agricultural tasks. 
He wants to use his loan to buy fertilizer thereby strengthening his fields and guaranteeing good development and production.
His goal is for his children to feel they have his support so they will do well in their studies and excel in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Mercedez De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes   vive en  un barrio muy pequeño   que se encuentra a media hora del pueblo, ella es  madre soltera con dos hijos a su responsabilidad.

   Ella solicito el préstamo  para invertirlo en la compra de ropas para damas, cabellaros y niños, así poder tener un ingreso del cual ella pueda disponer  y  mejorar su calidad de vida.

     Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó por una  compañera quien la invito  a vender junto con ella y así  es como se asocio y  hace poco decidió poner su propio negocio, así tener un mejor ingreso para sostenerse con su familia.

     Lo que más desea  es que con  esta actividad pueda  tener un poco más de ahorros para solventar sus gastos, así  también  agrandar más su actividad.
texts.en:
Mercedes lives in a small neighborhood, located half an hour from town.  She is a single mother with 2 children that she is responsible for. She applied for the loan to buy women's, men's and children's clothing.  In this way, she can earn some disposable income and improve her quality of life.  

She was inspired to start her business by a friend who invited her to sell with her, and eventually they became partners. A short time ago she decided to set up her own business, in order to have income to support herself and her family.  

What she most wants is to save some money from this work, in order to meet her expenses, and also to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy clothing for later sale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 45 years old and lives in Jacob Town. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They both have five children ages 16 to 30, and all of them are currently in school. For ten years she has been selling charcoal. She makes a lot of profit and has many customers.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She plans to build her house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Ibraheem

texts.en: Ibraheem is a 54 year old man. He is married and has four sons and three daughters. Two of his sons are workers with decent salaries. Ibraheem wants to share with his son in his wedding expenses. In order to pay part of these expenses, the amount of money he has isn't enough, so he needs to take a loan amount of $2,000 from FATEN. When Ibraheem gets the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to take part in his son's wedding expenses and share, with his son, in paying for the wedding. Ibraheem will be able to help his son to prepare well for his wedding and to provide better life conditions for the family. Ibraheem is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to pay for his son wedding expenses.

loans.name: Tsogtbayar

texts.en:
Tsogtbayar is 52 years old and lives with his wife and child in his wife's sister's fenced yard in Ulaanbaatar city of Mongolia. His wife stays at home and his son works at a restaurant as an assistant chef. 

Tsogtbayar studied medical practice and worked in Turkey during 2008-2010. He is a folk healer. He started his own business in 2010 when he arrived in Mongolia. He is well experienced and known for his excellent service. Due to the cold weather he needs to repair his car. He is a hardworking and diligent person who says. "With the bank loan, I want to repair my car for transportation purposes due to lack of public transportation infrastructure within my home area." He is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to repair his car.

loans.use: To repair his car to use in his folk healer's business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 31-year-old married man, father of four children and owner of an international calls shop and a café since 2010. His customers say that he serves the best hooka*.  He also owns an espresso machine and serves his customers coffee.
Ahmad is a hardworking man. He used to fix and refurbish used furniture, but he decided to start this cafe to more easily meet his big family’s requests.
Ahmad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to expand his shop and buy a new espresso machine to better meet his customers' needs.
Ahmad is working with Al Majmoua for the first time; he hopes it will help him for future investments.
He hopes to buy a house and own another shop in the future.

* A hookah (Hindustani: हुक़्क़ा (Devanagari), (Nastaleeq) huqqah). A hooka, also known as sheesha or waterpipe shisha, is a single or multi-stemmed (often glass-based) instrument for smoking in which the smoke is cooled and filtered by passing through water. ...source Wikipedia 18-10-2011

loans.use: To buy a new espresso machine.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with 4 children who are enrolled in school.  Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the family's basic needs.  She lives in a rental home with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Fatuma has operated as a food vendor for the past 7 years; her clients are her neighbors.  She faces a major challenge of fluctuating prices of commodities in the market.  She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan Fatuma wants to purchase wheat flour and beans for her business.  She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to get capital to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and beans for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a farmer in Nkubu.  Her farm produces beans, maize and milk, which all go to the local market.  She has been in farming for 20 years.  She is 38 years old, married, and has three children who are all in school.  She also sells cereals at the local market.  The cereals are sourced from her farm and from other farmers in the area.

Mary has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a bull cart. This is her second loan request through Juhudi, after repaying the first loan of 20,000 KES promptly.  She says the loan will help boost her farming income, since she will be able to transport her produce from the farm to her stores before taking the supplies to the market.  She adds that much of her income is lost when transporters are engaged during harvest to bring the produce to the market.

Mary states that lack of animal feed has made dairy farming difficult.

loans.use: buy a bull cart

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a 30-year-old housewife who has three children with her husband Anwar, who works in a factory. Laila and her husband have built a small storage room where they manufacture types of tobacco to be used for Arabian Shisha. After making the tobacco, her husband delivers it to shops and cafés in their area.
Now Laila want to buy some specialist equipment and machines for making these types of tobacco. In the future, she wants to expand and have her own factory. 
because Laila is a conservative person, her husband Anwar has agreed to take the photo instead.

loans.use: to buy some specialist equipment and machines for making tobacco.

loans.name: Pitadora

texts.en:
Pitadora is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.
 
Pitadora has a shop that sells vegetables, spices, and food seasonings. She has had this business for 20 years. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy vegetables, spices, and food seasonings.

Pitadora has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Pitadora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, spices, and food seasonings.

loans.name: Precious

texts.en: Precious is 41 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married to a business man. They have five children between the ages of 20 and 25, who attend school and live at home. For the past several years she has been selling rubber slippers and used shoes in the market, and is requesting a loan to purchase more of these items for her business. She hopes to have her own house and to attend vocational school in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers and used shoes for her business.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El Sr. Edgar es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, tiene 36 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Aida de 31 años de edad, ellos tienen 3 hijos que estan cursando sus estudios primarios.
Don Edgar es carpintero, desde hace 2 años, el comenzó como empleado por mucho tiempo, tiempo que le sirvió para aprender el oficio,  para que luego vaya juntando su capital y poder hacerse de un negocio propio, así lo hizo, en la actualidad Él fabrica muebles de todo tipo, para el señor donde trabajaba anteriormente.
Comenta que su sueño es poder seguir creciendo, para tener un poco más de ingresos y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia, y darle a sus hijos una buena educación.
Solicita este préstamo para comprar mas madera, para asi tener buen stock de productos terminados y poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en: Mr. Edgar, 36, is from the city of Caaguazú city, and is married to Mrs. Aida, 31 years old.  They have 3 children who are enrolled in primary school. Don Edgar is a carpenter for 2 years now, he started as an employee for a long time, which helped him learn the craft, then go along with to take his capital and start his own business.  He did it and manufactures furniture of any kind, for the man where he previously worked. He says his dream is to continue to grow, to have a little more income and thus help his family, and give his children a good education. He is requesting this loan to buy more wood, so that he has good stock of finished goods and to meet customer orders.

loans.use: to purchase carpentry materials.

loans.name: Faraja - Ilela Group

texts.en:
Amos is 33 years old and a father of two children. He has been growing coffee, maize, cassava and beans for over 25 years. He is facing farming problems, such as lack of fertilizers and crop diseases.

Amos needs funds to pay for fertilizers and insecticides. Also, he has a vision for five years to come to expand the scale of production from 5 to 12 acres in expectation to earn more income so that he can buy food, clothes, and cover medical expenses.

In the attached photo two members of the group namely Venant and Leonada (a husband and his wife) are not pictured since they are at the hospital taking care of their babe who is sick.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers, insecticides, and gum boots

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, aged 33, is a resident of Kitale and has 5 years of experience in active farming. He is married with two children both under four years old. His farm produce of maize and milk are sold at the local market.

Paul has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says the cow will provide his family with milk for consumption and for sale to meet other family basic needs. He hopes to have at least four dairy cows in five years.

Paul says their main challenge is in dealing with animal diseases.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Rose, 43 years of age, and a very hard-working, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Kapsang, a remote village in Eldoret. She is happily married and is blessed with adorable children. 

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 20 years and has gained much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. 

The Eldoret area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the best part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” 

Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 40,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and that she will be able to buy more poultry. 

With the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry supply to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying the loan and changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Valeurie

texts.en:
Valeurie aged 34 years. She is married with 3 children aged between 4 and 9 years. 2 of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 8 years. While her husband is a business man. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers of maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a medical insurance and improve her family welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers of maize.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a rural smallholder crop farmer in the Nkubu area of Kenya. He is married and has two children. Besides crop farming, Daniel also does Dairy farming for extra food and income. The key lesson he has taken away from many years of being in crop farming is predicting weather patterns and planing in advance.

Daniel is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer to enhance his farm’s productivity.

With your loan, having quality agricultural inputs will increase Daniel’s chances for a successful harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Daler

texts.en: Daler is capable boy. He is a single. He is a student. He wants to become financial expert in a future. He is studying at the University he is the first year student. His family lives in salary. His parent couldn’t pay his University tuition. He decided to get a loan and to pay the University tuition. He is studying very well he participate in a lot of circles and he is a bright boy. He wants to pay for the University tuition.  He needs money. He is asking for a loan of 3780 with this aim. He awaits you mercy and help with your help he can continue his studying.

loans.use: He wants to pay for the University tuition.

loans.name: Taryel

texts.en:
This young man has his own grocery store. He is 29, married, has a child, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Kalbajar region Djomerd village. He temporary lives with his family in Khirdalan settlement.
He applied for a loan amount of $800 to expand his business.
Taryel needs a loan of $1000  to be engaged in pub business and to open his own billiard-hall and to open his own billiard-hall.

loans.use: To be busy with pub business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Ceci is 48 years old and a mother of 2 children. She completed basic education but without any vocation. She has been supporting her family over the years with the selling of used clothes in her community and the outlying villages.

Since the constant trekking is having an effect on her health, she wants to use the KIVA loan to acquire a small stall where she can sit and display her goods.

loans.use: Acquisition of a stall

loans.name: Rolande

texts.en:
Rolande N. is 27 years old and lives with her 4-year-old daughter and her partner in Port Bouet, in the south of Abidjan district. Rolande N. is a ladies' fashion wear seller. She is dynamic and business-oriented. She started her activities in 2000 when she left school. Instead of looking for a typist job, she decided to start her own microbusiness.

Rolande N. heard about AE&I in February, 2004 from her brother who was a trainee in the program. Rolande N. got different loans from AE&I to expand her microbusiness. She wants to sustain her activities through a new loan that will help her to purchase various ladies' fashion clothes for the summer season. She has always reimbursed her loans in a very good manner.

loans.use: Rolande Ndiamoi will use the loan to purchase a stock of ladies' fashion wear

loans.name: So

texts.en: Mr. So R., his wife, and their four children live in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. The couple sells brooms for a living, and can earn about $8 per day. This income is just enough to put their four children through school. This loan will be used for Mr. So R. to purchase more brooms for selling. He would like to continue stocking brooms so their business can grow in the future.

loans.use: So would like to purchase brooms to sell.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: I am Ruksana B. and was born in Vehari, a small town located 300km from Lahore in the heart of Punjab. I have eight children, six of which attend school. My husband sells herbal medicines to various stores in Vehari. In order to supplement our income, last year my husband took out a loan and bought a snooker table, which we kept at home. Boys from the neighborhood come to our house to play. Since Vehari is a small town, entertainment is scarce and renting out the snooker table proved to be successful, yielding $2 to $3 per day.  Now, we want to expand our snooker venture and purchase another table as demand for playing snooker is increasing among young boys. To purchase a new table I need a loan of $250. I think this loan would be very helpful, not only for the family, but also for my childrens' education.

loans.use: To buy a second snooker table

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Georgina is the mother of three. Throughout her life she has shown herself to be very hard-working. She has a true talent for making ceramic and plaster figurines in various patterns and colors. At this time she has a large backlog of unfilled orders but she needs capital to buy raw materials. She is asking for a loan of $1025 to buy the plaster, clay, firewood and paint she needs to meet demand. Georgina dreams of increasing her production in order to give her children a good home and education. She promises to repay the loan in eight months. Please help her fulfill her dreams.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Doña Georgina es una admirable madre de 3 hijos, durante el transcurso de su vida se mostró siempre como una mujer muy trabajadora y dedicada al hermoso arte de la cerámica basado en yeso y arcilla, trabajo que desempeña eficientemente, realizando múltiples diseños y pintados y que gracias a su talento innato le está progresando.Actualmente cuenta con gran cantidad de solicitudes, pero tiene un problema, no posee suficiente capital para comprar materia prima (arcilla, yeso, leña, etc.) para la producción de su mercadería, es por esa razón que recurre a tu apoyo y solicita un préstamo de 1025 dólares, dinero que le permitirá cumplir con sus pedidos y al mismo tiempo obtener mayor beneficio económico para brindarle estudios superiores a sus queridos hijos. Georgina promete ser puntual en el reembolso del préstamo en un lapso de ocho meses. Contamos con vuestra gentil contribución para hacer realidad en un corto tiempo los sueños de Georgina

loans.use: To buy clay, plaster, firewood and paint.

loans.name: Naziran

texts.en: My name is Naziran B.. I am married and a mother of six: four boys and two girls. I need a loan of $300 for my husband’s blanket business. He has been in this business since his teens. He sells these items door to door on his bicycle. I could not send my children to school earlier, but now I feel it is never too late so I have decided to enroll them in school again. With your loan my husband will buy blankets and rugs in bulk

loans.use: Buy rugs, runners, and blankets in bulk

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria O. has a catering business. She is an LAPO member. She is 43 years old and married with four children.

Maria needs a loan of $600 to buy more materials and flour for her business. She studied the business for 6 months and started hers in 1999.

loans.use: To buy more materials and bags of flour for the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy repair parts and tools

loans.name: Budumbuli West A (I) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Juliet N.. She is currently in the business of selling firewood and is requesting a loan to increase her stock of firewood. Juliet is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a builder for work. She has 2 children aged 4 and 6, and her children go to school. Each week, Juliet makes approximately UGX 450000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater for her household necessities. Juliet has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Juliet is joined in her small group by Rose N., Betty N. and Sumayiya M.. Rose N. has a business running a bar and wants to purchase more brew and beer. Betty N. is currently operating a business selling fish and charcoal and wants a loan to buy more charcoal. Sumayiya M. operates a retail shop business and wants to add more commodities.

loans.use: To purchase more trucks of firewood

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Bunthoeun P. and his wife got married in 2005. They have one daughter and live on an Island on Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Currently, Bunthoeun is in the process of building his own house.
He has been a weaver for three years, which is a skill he learned from his parents. Bunthoeun's wife, too, has been working as a silk weaver for the past eleven years. The couple sells their finished silk products to middle-men in the village who then sell it in Phnom Penh. Besides weaving, Buntoeun also earns income raising pigs. 

Now, he is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to help finance the construction of his house.

loans.use: Construction of a house

loans.name: Sutarjo

texts.id:
Sutarjo's business is collecting junks, or buying and selling second-hand goods. He goes out 2 times a day. In the morning, he departs at 6 am and in the evening he goes out at 3 pm. He covers the area from Monang-Maning until Kerobokan using a cart or a bicycle cart. Even though the weather sometimes changes, it doesn't discourage him to do this job. His daily income is enough to cover his daily expenses. Currently, Sutarji wants to expand the business but he doesn't have enough capital. Therefore, he hopes that DINARI can help him with a loan.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha yang ditekuni oleh Sutarjo adalah sebagai pemulung atau jual beli barang bekas. Setiap hari dia keluar 2 kali sehari. Pagi hari dia berangkat jam 06.00 dan sore dia berangkat jam 15.00. Wilayah yang dikelilingi mulai dari Monang-Maning sampai Kerobokan dengan membawa gerobak atau menggunakan sepeda dayung. Walaupun cuaca acapkali berubah namun tak mengurangi niat untuk melakukan pekerjaan ini. Dari keuntungan setiap hari bisa untuk memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari. Saat ini Sutarji ingin mengembangkan bisnisnya, tetapi terkendala modal usaha. Oleh karena itu dia sangat berharap DINARI bisa membantu memberikan pinjaman.

loans.use: To add business capital

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sophorn C., 43 years old, lives in Monorom Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a mother of six children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory, while three others are currently in school. Mrs. Sophorn works in a plantation business while her husband, Mr. Loy Him makes beds, chairs and tables for sale. Mr. Loy Him’s business is improving, however he does not have enough money to buy more lumber to make his products.  Mrs. Sophorn C. would like to ask for a loan to buy more lumber her husband's business.  Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more lumber to make more beds, tables and chairs

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru:
Gulbahor Q. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is 44 years old. She is a widow with two children. In order to provide for her family and give her children a complete education, Gulbahor works in sales. She sells fabrics and various national wedding outfits in the market. She has done this for five years. To further develop her business, she needs additional funds. That is possible only if she gets a loan. She plans to pay off her debt in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva Volunteer

Курбонова Гулбахор проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 44 года. Вдова с двумя детьми. Для того , чтобы обеспечить семью и дать полноценное образование детям Гулбахор занимается торговлей. Торгует на рынке города тканями и различными национальными свадебными нарядами. Работает так уже пять лет. Для того , чтобы развивать свой бизнес ей необходимо вливать дополнительные средства. Это возможно только после получения кредита. Погасить кредит она планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Ahadi

texts.en:
Ahadi is 20 years old. She is single. She has been rearing chicken since 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Ahadi now hopes for a loan to buy more chickens for her business.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for her business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La señora Norma pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Orquídeas, ubicado en Jr. Comandante Barrera Nº 605, distrito D. San Fernando, departamento D. Ucayali. Norma tiene 51 años, 2 hijos y su esposo es Mecánico. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal D. Manuela Ramos y con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300, decidió invertir en la venta D. golosinas.

Norma se dedica a la venta D. golosinas y pasamanería. Día a día sale a vender sus productos para no perder a sus clientes y D. esa manera satisfacer las necesidades D. los mismos.

Con el préstamo D. S/.2,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra D. golosinas como 2 cajas D. galletas, 1caja D. chicle, 3 tiras D. papita lays, 1 caja D. pasta dental y 2 docenas D. jaboncillos.
 
Norma es una señora que no desmaya en su negocio y es así que a pesar D. ciertos tropiezos que tuvo en la vida sigue sobresaliendo, además está muy agradecida del banco comunal por el préstamo que le brinda.
texts.en:
Miss Norma belongs to The Orchids Communal Bank located in Comandante Barrera Nº 605, district of San Fernando, in the department of Ucayali. Norma is 51 years old, she has 2 children and her husband is a Mechanic. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Communal Bank for the past 2 years and with the first loan of $120, she decided to invest it in selling candies.

Norma sells candies and trimmings. Every day she goes out to sell her products in order to keep her clients happy and to meet their needs.

With the loan of $675, which she will repay over a period of 4 months, she will use it to buy candies such as, 2 boxes of cookies, 1 box of chewing gum, 3 strips of Lays chips, 1 box of toothpaste and 2 dozens of small soaps.

Norma is a lady who works tirelessly in her business, so even after certain stumbles that she has had in life she keeps on working hard. Also she is very grateful of the support given by the Communal Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and candies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase slippers, shoes and sneakers for a small business.

loans.name: Shams Ilahi M.akram Sajid Group

texts.en:
Shams Ilahi baji is the wife of M. S. and lives in the city of Shah Rukn, Pakistan. Shah Rukn city is famed among travelers for its holy places and tombs. She has been living in this city for the past 25 years. She is the mother of two sons. Her eldest son is a daily wage laborer, and her youngest son is a property dealer. Shams baji’s husband is retired. Shams baji herself has a clothing business. She buys clothing from different markets and nearby cities and then sells them in Shah Rukn. She has been in this business for the past 5 years. She has successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a third loan to buy more clothing to sell and expand her business.

This is a group loan, and she is joined in her request by three other members. Safia baji also wants a loan to buy more clothing to sell. Bashir baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell, and Kosar baji wants a loan to buy rice, lentils, cooking oil, and spices for her Punjabi food (Dal Chawal) selling business. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Adesuwa

texts.en: Adesuwa I. sells provisions and drinks. Her husband makes furniture such as chairs and tables. She is 43 years old and married with 5 children. She needs a loan of N40,000 ($350) to purchase more food items and drinks to sell. She says a big thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Yao Atsou

texts.fr: Yao Atsou M. est âgé de 35 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Il réside à Lavie, un village situé à environ 135 kilomètres de Lomé la capitale togolaise. Il fait depuis 6 ans des pépinières de palmiers, de cocotiers, des tecks et des orangers. Il souhaite avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son activité en achetant des entrants. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour accroître son activité afin de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yao Atsou M. is 35 years old, married, and the father of 3 children. He lives in Lavie, a village located approximately 135 kilometers from the capital of Togo. For six years, he's been running a tree nursery (palm tress, coconut trees, teak, and orange trees). With this credit, he wishes to increase the productivity of his business by purchasing fertilizers. He counts on this opportunity to bolster his business in order to better provide for his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for his tree nursery

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 34 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en edad escolar y con su pareja quien la apoya en todo. La vivienda que habitan es propia. Se dedica a la venta de zapatos y ropa desde hace 4 años, su esposo es trabajador independiente (chofer) y la apoya mucho en su negocio movilizándola de un lugar a otro para llevar a vender sus prendas. Isabel se levanta muy temprano para preparar toda su mercadería y llevarla por los diferentes lugares de su zona. Generalmente vende todo lo que tiene, y sus clientes espera su llegada para comprarle lo que necesitan y hacerle más pedidos. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, con la cantidad que solicita comprará más zapatos y ropa, posteriormente le gustaría mandar a construir un local para su negocio.
texts.en:
Isabel is 34 and lives with her 2 school-aged children and her husband, who supports her in everything. They own their own home. She has sold shoes and clothing for 4 years. Her husband works independently as a driver and supports her a lot with her business by driving her from place to place to take her to sell her products. Isabel gets up very early to prepare all of her merchandise and to take it to different places in her area. Usually she sells everything she has, and her customers wait for her arrival to buy what they need from her and to place more orders. This is her fourth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With it, she will purchase more shoes and clothing. Later she would like to have a location constructed for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Tafuteni Group

texts.en:
Rose has owned a small electronics equipment shop in the Tengeru neighborhood of Arusha for 5 years. Every day she works at her business from 6:30 a.m. to 9:30 p.m. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $225. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more electronics items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Rose is 28 years old and married with two children. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Eliwandesha and Afrasion, who each has her own small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more electonics items for her business.

loans.name: Shahnozakhon

texts.en:
Shahnozakhon has six years of experience as a seamstress. She worked with her mother first, which is how she learned her trade. Four years ago she started her own business, and with the help of some money her husband saved, she was able to buy the sewing machine she needed to open her business. Shahnozakhon specializes in women's national dresses. Her workshop is in her home and she works Monday through Sunday from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm. She would like to take out a loan of $600 USD for the term of 10 months to be able to purchase new, modern fabrics for her business. Shahnozakhon is counting on your help and thanks all of you. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve agricultural production and manufacturing, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients present a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase fabric for sewing women's national dresses.

loans.name: Maqsoodan Group

texts.en:
Maqsoodan baji is a widow. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the last 10 years. Maqsoodan baji is a very hardworking lady. She did work as a seamstress for five years for her sons. Her elder son works as a deliveryman and delivers different items (furniture, construction supplies) from one place to another. The next son works in a factory on monthly wage. Maqsoodan baji is still working as a seamstress because she puts her profit in a committee savings plan. Her elder son is becoming of marriageable age and Maqsoodan baji plans to marry him off using the amount in her committee savings. Maqsoodan baji is applying for a loan to buy a donkey cart for her elder son because his old cart became rough and has broken in certain areas. 

Maqsoodan baji is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Sabra baji wants a loan to buy paint to sell. Qaisra baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes. Fatima baji wants a loan to buy utensils to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a donkey cart

loans.name: Reinaldo

texts.es:
Don  Reinaldo L. A. es un señor de 53 años de edad, casado con Ana María Araya y padre de dos hijos. Vive en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones es una comunidad ubicada a 150 kilómetros al sur de la Provincia de San José, la capital de Costa Rica. Se encuentra a 850 metros  sobre el nivel del mar. Ahí se cultivan hortalizas, café y además se desarrollan otras actividades como la crianza de ganado de engorde y de cerdos. Existen también algunos proyectos de agricultura orgánica y hortalizas en hidroponía. Además de la agricultura en la comunidad hay talleres mecánicos, un supermercado, pequeños restaurantes (sodas) y una mueblería.

Don Reinaldo se dedica a las actividades agrícolas, en especial a la caficultora en la que ya cuenta con aproximadamente 25 años de experiencia. Afirma que durante ese tiempo ha tenido épocas en las que le va bien y otras en la que tiene que lidiar con problemas como malos precios de venta del grano o fenómenos naturales que dañan sus cultivos. No obstante, considera que el mercado del café de una u otra forma siempre es bueno, y de ahí la necesidad de este crédito para renovar un área destinada al cultivo del café, para que los rendimientos sean óptimos y el café de una excelente calidad. Esto va a ser el factor influyente  en el éxito del proyecto.  

Actualmente don Reinaldo requiere de un microcrédito por un monto de ¢500,000 (quinientos mil colones)  para comprar fertilizantes y almácigo para poder renovar una hectárea  de café, tal y como se mencionó. Con esto espera mejorar la condición económica de su familia y poder brindar mayores oportunidades a sus hijos, en especial al que actualmente está estudiando en la secundaria. 

Don Reinaldo es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Bancruce, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo como microempresario.
texts.en:
Don Reinaldo L. A. is 53 years of age, married to Ana María Araya and the father of two children. He lives in a rural community in Costa Rica called Mollejones de Platanares, in the Canton of Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones is a community located 150 kilometers (94 miles) south of San José Province, the capital of Costa Rica. It is 850 meters (2,800 feet) above sea level. They grow vegetables and coffee here and are also developing other activities such as raising and fattening pigs. There are also projects involving organic farming and hydroponics. In addition to agriculture, the community has mechanical workshops, a supermarket, some small restaurants (coffee bars) and a furniture-making shop. Don Reinaldo works at farming, particularly growing coffee with which he has 25 years experience. He says that during that time he has had some periods when he has done well, and others when he has had to cope with problems such as low crop prices or natural occurrences that damaged his crops. Nevertheless, he feels that the coffee market, one way or another, is always good and so the necessity of this loan which he will use to renovate an area which will be used for growing coffee and thus ensure that the yield will be optimal and the coffee of excellent quality. This will be the factor which determines the success of the project. Presently Don Reinaldo is requesting a microcredit loan of 500,000 Colons to purchase fertilizer and build seed beds in order to plant a hectare (2.5 acres) of coffee as described above. With this he hopes to improve his family's finances and to provide better opportunities for his children, especially the son who is currently in secondary school. Don Reinaldo is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Communal Bank, one of a hundred member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his second loan and he hopes to continue growing as a small businessman.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restoration and planting a hectare of coffee

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam es socia del Banco Comunal Magnolia.
Miriam es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 1 hijo, Miriam esta esperando su segundo hijo, Miriam junto a su esposo tienen dos mototaxis con el cual trabaja su esposo y el otro lo alquila.
Miriam necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en el mantenimiento de las motos.
Los sueños de Miriam son comprar un terreno para construir su casa, comprar un carro y su hija salga adelante.
texts.en:
Miriam is a partner of "Banco Comunal Magnolia".

She lives with her partner, is 28 years old and has 1 child. Miriam is expecting her second child. Together with her husband she owns two motorcycle taxies, one driven by her husband and the other rented out.

Miriam needs a loan of 1200 soles to be invested in maintenance of the motorcycles. It is Miriam's dream to purchase land to build her house, buy a car and that her daughter get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of motorcycles.

loans.name: Candy

texts.es: Candy es una joven muy activa y trabajadora, tiene 27 años, es soltera y vive en una habitación  alquilada junto a su único hijo Alberth de 3 años, ella tiene muchas ganas de mejorar su vida y salir adelante. Su negocio es la venta de ropa para niños, vende buzos, pantalones, casacas, etc, en el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), ofrece a un buen precio y accesible para todos, y como le gusta vender, acaba toda su mercadería. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es trasladar la ropa hasta su puesto de venta, ya que le es muy cansado y el transporte le sale muy caro. Candy tiene 7 años en este negocio y espera incrementar la cantidad de ropa que tiene en stock, porque es conciente que solo así podrá incrementar su economía y darle una mejor educación a su hijo. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, y está dispuesta a pagarlo por completo y puntualmente, para acceder a uno nuevo, por ello confía plenamente en que sus compañeras de su banco comunal harán lo mismo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ropa para incrementar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Candy is a young woman, very active and hard working. She is 27 years old, she is single and she lives in a rented room, together with her only son, Alberth, who is 3 years old. She wants so much to improve her life and to be a success. Her business is selling children's clothing including jumpsuits, pants, jackets etc. in the San Jose market (the market is a large market in the city of Juliaca). She offers good deals that are accessible to everyone, and since she likes sales, she always sells out her merchandise. The hardest part of her work is to bring the clothing for sale to her stand - it is very physically taxing and other transportation is very expensive. Candy has been running this business for the past 7 years and she hopes to increase her stocks of clothing. She knows this is the only way she will be able to improve her finances and therefore provide her son with an education. This is her third loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner), and she is ready and able to pay it off completely and on time, to be elligible for a new loan. She trusts her community bank colleagues completely because they will do the same for her. With the two thousand neuvos soles requested, she will purchase more clothing to increase her sales and improve her income.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 34 años, está felizmente casada, tiene 4 hijos y vive en su casa propia. Es una esposa y madre muy amorosa, que también trata con mucho cariño a sus cultivos, puesto que sabe que con dedicación y atención le resultarán muy favorables. Diariamente madruga para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, quien regresa a desayunar, después de trabajar muy temprano en sus chacras. Pero a eso de las 9.00am ambos regresan a continuar con las labores agrícolas, Maria nos comentar que cada día le da gracias a Dios por sus chacras y sabe que con su bendición sus tierras son muy fértiles. Ella se siente muy orgullosa de ser agricultora, por lo que emplea todas las técnicas que ha ido aprendiendo con el paso de los años. Sus productos (café y plátanos) los comercializa en los mercados de la ciudad de Lima, donde según la variedad, vende a 6 soles cada kilo, acumulando mayores ganancias, lo que le permite avizorar un mejor futuro a base de sus cultivos. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, durante los ciclos pasados ha pagado responsablemente sus cuotas, y del mismo modo hace compromisos de hacerlo esta vez. Los dos mil doscientos soles que viene solicitando los va invertir en la compra de plantitas de café y de plátanos morados para incrementar su producción.
texts.en:
Maria is 34 and happily married. She has 4 children and has her own home. She is a very loving wife and mother and also treats her crops with a lot of care. She knows that with dedication and attention, they will give her favorable results. She gets up very early every day to make breakfast for her children and husband, who comes home to eat breakfast after working very early in the fields. Around 9 a.m., they both go out to the fields. Maria tells us that every day she thanks God for her fields because with his blessing, the land will be very fertile. She feels very proud of being a farmer because she employs all of the techniques that she has learned over the years. She sells her products (coffee and bananas) at the markets in Lima, where according to the variation in prices, she can sell them for 6 PEN per kilo. She is earning better profits, which let her visualize a better future. This is her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. During her previous loans, she has been very responsible with her payments. In the same way, she promises to be responsible this time. She will invest the 2,000 PEN that she is requesting in the purchase of young coffee plants to increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of coffee and banana plants

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce A. is thirty-five years old. She is divorced and has given birth to three children – all girls. She lives with her daughters in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region.

Joyce is a professional hairdresser. She has three apprentices who are currently under training. Her shop is located by the roadside. She buys her working materials such as artificial hair, shampoo, pomade, cream, lotion, etc. from Kumasi. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy materials in bulk to be able to render quality services to her cherished clients. She aspires to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy artificial hair and other items for her salon

loans.name: Nacar

texts.en:
Nacar B. a resident of Tabon, Jose Dalman. Her husband is a construction worker and they have six children. Two of her children are students at Jose Rizal Memorial State College at Dapitan City and four of her are married.

Mrs. B. is a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She applied for her third loan of Php14,000.00 to purchase a baby cow to raise. She is a good member of Paglaum. She enjoys the benefits and services of Paglaum.

loans.use: To purchase a baby cow to raise

loans.name: Nor Aqa Group

texts.en:
Nor Aqa is the leader of the three-member Nor Aqa group. Each member would like to receive money for his own business in order to expand and improve it.

Nor Aqa and Mohammad monir want to take loans for their oil-selling businesses in order to improve and increase their trade.

Mohammad Sabar wants to take a loan for his taxi business in order to attract more customers.

The group send their thanks to Kiva partner AFS in Afghanistan, and to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle S. is from the village of Naasag, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 33 years old. Annabelle is separated from her spouse and has 3 school aged children. To make a living, Annabelle owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Annabelle has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Annabelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annabelle is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Annabelle from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is already 41 years old. She is married to Jimmy M. who serves as a Barangay (district) electrician in their village at Barangay Malalinta, San Manuel, Isabela. Her husband is already 43 years old and working as a farmer. They are gifted with two children: the eldest is taking her college level of education, and the youngest is still in high school. Erlinda is willing to continue financing her children until they finish their college education so long as she can afford to do so. 

Erlinda is trying to do her best and patiently maintains her hog-raising business in order to provide her family with their basic necessities and to fulfill their needs, especially the children’s education.

She wants her livestock business to become productive someday and thus she wanted to ask for financial assistance from Kiva lenders with the loan of PHP 8,000. Through the amount she wants to borrow, she will purchase enough supply of fattening feeds for her pigs. She hopes that someday, her hog-raising will become a success.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan C. is 71 years old and widowed. She lives with her two children. She makes a living by selling rice and raising animals for a daily income of $3. The family is also assisted by one her children who is tourist guide, earning approximately an income of US $12 per day. Also, another son is engaged in a business of providing transportation services to people in the town, earning the same amount of income to his mother. She plans to take a KIVA loan of $1200 to build a place to store rice that she will buy it from the local farmers in her village. With the remainder, she wants to expand her business by purchasing more rice. She hopes that, with the success of her business plan, she will be able to decorate her house.

loans.use: build a place to store rice

loans.name: Magally

texts.es:
Magally es socia del Banco Comunal Las Margaritas.
Magally es casada, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Magally tiene un puesto en el mercado Magdalena en donde vende comida, actividad que realiza de lunes a viernes.
Magally necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Magally son tener una casa propia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Magally is a member of the communal bank "Las Margaritas." She is married, 38 years old and has 3 children. Magally has a stall in the Magdalena market where she sells food, an activity that she carries out from Monday to Friday. Magally needs a loan of 1500 soles to purchase rice and sugar. She dreams of having her own house and having her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Here is Issa G., a farmer and businessman. Issa is seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 from Kiva lenders through SMT for the first time to invest in his farm and business. He will use the loan to pay labor and buy seeds.

Issa is thirty-two years old; he is married to a businesswoman and they have four children who are attending junior secondary and primary schools respectively. Issa was born in the village of Massampa in northern Sierra Leone.

loans.use: Invest in his farm by buying seeds and paying for labour

loans.name: Mustafa Farid

texts.en:
This is Mustafa Farid, son of P. M.. He is 35 years old. He lives in Kabul Afghanistan. He lives in a family of 8 members. His brother is engaged and now he wants him to get married. But with the money they have, it is not possible for them to pay for all the expenses of the wedding. That is why he has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani to solve his problem and to have an organized and good wedding.

He would like to thank the Kiva lenders a lot because of their great support in Afghanistan.

loans.use: For wedding expenses

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es: Angela es casada, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar, trabaja para el MINED como profesora de primariaen El Centro Escolar Pablo Hurtado de Juigalpa, todos los dias Angela se levanta muy temprano a alistar a sus niños para luego trasladarse a su trabajo como docente; el marido labora como electricista residencial el que la apoya con sus compromisos y el sostenimiento familiar, esta solicitando su 2do credito para construir una habitacion para sus hijos, pues carecen de ella, y si el credito lo permite repellar la casa para reforzar las paredes, su mayor sueño es alcanzar mejorar su vivenda de forma digna para asi tener mejres condiciones de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Angela is married and has two school-age children. She works for the Ministry of Education (MINED) as an elementary school teacher at the Pablo Hurtado Scholastic Center in Juigalpa. Every day Angela wakes up early so that she can take her children to school and proceed to her teaching job. Her husband works as a residential electrician in order to support the family commitments.

Angela is requesting her second loan in order to build a room for her children. She will also have her house plastered in order to reinforce the walls. Her dream is to complete these improvements so that she can have a dignified home that provides her family with better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room & plaster the walls of the house

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro, de 41 años, es un hombre muy sincero y trabajador, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Ana de 39 años y lo que más desea es tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para cumplir con su labor, él es uno de los pocos panaderos de su localidad, es por eso que su negocio es muy concurrido. Los panes que él prepara son muy sabrosos y nutritivos, ya que pone mucho empeño en elaborarlos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es hornear los panes, ya que se esmera mucho en que salgan bien, lleva 11 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse en la madrugada para preparar la masa. 
Para el futuro, espera hacer crecer su negocio y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

Este es el primer préstamo de Pedro con MFP y se siente muy feliz por haberlo obtenido, ya que sabe que le será de mucha ayuda para hacer progresar su negocio. Con los dos mil soles solicitados comprará más ingredientes para elaborar una mayor cantidad de panes.
texts.en:
Pedro, who is 41 years old, is a sincere and hard-working man. He lives in his own house along with his wife, Ana, who is 39. What he wishes for most is to have a better quality of life. Every day, he wakes up early in order to accomplish all his work. He is one of a few bakers in his area. As a result, his business is busy. The breads that he prepares are very delicious and nutritious since he puts a lot of effort into making them. What he likes most about his job is baking the breads since it takes a lot of work for them to come out well. He has 11 years experience with this activity and he considers getting up at dawn to prepare the dough the most difficult part. In the future, he hopes to grow his business and improve his income. This is Pedro's first loan with MFP and he feels happy to obtain it knowing it will help advance his business. With the two thousand soles that he's requested, he will purchase more ingredients to make a greater quantity of bread.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is forty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to four children who are all in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Theresa works hard to help her husband provide for the family. She trades in utensils. She buys from Accra and hawks to sell in her community. She travels to sell as well. Theresa has been in business for over ten years and wants to increase her stock. It is her desire to give all her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy more utensils to sell.

loans.name: Trifon Andres

texts.es:
El Sr. Trifon, tiene un tranporte que lo trabaja en el sindicato de trufis ATL, que hacen la ruta del centro de la ciudad a los diversos lugares de la zona sur, su esposa la Sra. Simona, trabaja de empleada del Hogar en la zona Los Pinos, tienen cinco hijos, de los cuales los dos mayores ya trabajan independientemente y los otros tres en edad escolar.

El trabajo con Emprender desde el año 2003 en el grupo solidario Aguilas, a la fecha tambien trabaja cuando le requieren en el manejo de volqueta para la construcción de los puentes trillizos, él con su familia viven en la casa de un pariente a manera de cuidadores, donde se encuentran ya más de seis años.						
						
Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Trifon works in public transportation; he owns a trufi (minibus) and he is a member of the ATL organization (in Bolivia, public transport vehicles are privately-owned and organized into routes by various union organizations.) He drives a route from the center of the city to diverse locations in the southern part of the city. His wife, Simona, is a housekeeper in the Los Pinos neighborhood. They have 5 children; 2 of them are adults and work independently and the others are school-aged. He began working with Emprender in the year 2003 in the Aguilas group. Since that date he has also worked as needed as a dump truck driver for the construction of the "Bridge of Triplets" (a major public construction project in La Paz.) He has lived with his family in a house owned by a relative for 6 years, where they serve as caretakers. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence provided in granting him this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tires and to maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Waheeda Farid Group

texts.en:
This is the Waheeda Farid Group. This group is made up of four members: M. Ajmal, Ahmad Jawed, Farida ,and Waheeda. 

Ajmal, who is in the middle in the photograph, is the leader of the Waheeda Farid Group. He is a 30-year-old married man with two children. He wants a loan for his wife's tailoring business. With this loan, his wife wants to buy cloth and other things for her business. 

The second member of this group is Ahmad Jawed. He wants a loan for his brother who has a retail shop. With this loan, he wants to buy more food for his shop. 

Farida wants a loan for her brother who has a stationary shop. With this loan, he wants to buy notebooks, pens, and writing paper. 

The last member, Waheeda, wants a loan for her husband who has a flower shop. With this loan, he wants to buy more flowers and other things for his shop. 

They have requested a group of loan 40000 Afghani. They would like to say "lots of thanks" to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy cloth for his wife's tailoring business

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
El señor Celso N. Solís es casado con hijos mayores, domiciliado en la compañía Almada de Caacupe. 
 El señor Celso es un hombre muy trabajador y tiene tres actividades es agricultor y ahora tiene plantación de poroto y maní y también tiene una olería(lugar donde se fabrica ladrillo). 
Solicita el crédito para  la compra y almacenamiento de  arcilla para la olería
  Agradece a la fundación paraguaya por el apoyo obtenido por que gracias al crédito puede producir mas ladrillos y aprovechar que ahora tiene buen precio en el mercado y también incrementara sus ingresos  a su unidad familiar
texts.en:
Mr. Celso N. Solís is married, has grown children and lives in the Almada de Caacupe village. Celso is a hardworking man: he is a farmer, he plants beans and peanuts, and he runs an "olería," a place where bricks are made from clay. He is asking for a loan to buy and store more clay for the olería. He thanks Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya for the support it has given him; thanks to this loan he will be able to produce more bricks and -- since the market is good for construction right now -- he will increase his family's income.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clay to make bricks

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata S. est une yoffoise de 46 ans. Elle habite plus précisément  dans le quartier de Layenne. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de l’u-Imcec  à Yoff depuis décembre  2002. Elle est mariée et mère  de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 15 et 19 ans. C’est une commerçante  vendeuse d’aliment de bétail  céréales  et d’autres produits divers utilises par les tradipraticiens. Elle évolue dans ce secteur depuis  2005. A cause du fait qu’elle n’ait pas réussi dans ses études, elle a choisi cette activité par passion et pour ne pas rester inactive. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs destine a l’achat de mil, mais, blé, d’aliment de moutons et de cheval pour renforcer son activité. Ses bénéfices  réalisés lui permettent de satisfaire ses besoins personnels et d’améliorer le cadre de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Aminata S. is a 46-year-old woman from Yoff.  She lives in the Layenne district to be more precise.  She has a been a member of the lending group U-IMCEC in Yoff since December 2002.  She is married and the mother of two children, who range from 15 to 19 years of age.  Aminata is a merchant who sells grain, livestock feed, and various other items used by traditional practitioners.  She has been advancing in this sector since 2005.  Due to the fact she was unsuccessful in school, she chose this business out of passion and to be active. Aminata is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs destined for buying millet, corn, wheat, and feed for sheep and horses in order to bolster her business.  Her profits enable her to satisfy her personnel needs and to improve her family's living conditions. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her funds

loans.name: Wassim

texts.en:
Wassim has owned a car repair shop for the past fifteen years and specializes in repairing bodywork in addition to painting. He started working in this occupation when he was quite young and, due to his long experience, he was able to make a good number of customers over the years.

Wassim has already taken a loan from Kiva and he's pleased with his decision to take a loan via Ameen. He has repaid on-time and he has even repaid the full loan amount earlier than his scheduled end date.

Today, Wassim is requesting a new loan of $2,000 to buy new tools needed for his business in order to increase his business productivity.

loans.use: To buy new tools for his business

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah is a single mother. She owns a two-room house where she lives with seven people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water. She takes care of additional family members. The family gets three meals per day. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Hadjah owns a stall in Ndeeba market selling bananas. She works seven days per week. She would like to purchase more bunches of bananas with the Ush. 800,000 loan from MCDT. She rents the space for her business at 15000/= per month. She has been running the business for many years.  She has at least 20 customers a day and sells to all categories of people both at retail and at wholesale.  Her greatest challenges are the rainy season and seasonality, because she works from an open place. Hadjah has worked with MCDT for a long time and chose the organization because it was easy to join. Hadjah aspires to go directly to farmers to buy bananas.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Shally

texts.en:
Shally D. is from the village of Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Shally is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Shally owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling candles in the local community. Shally has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Shally joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Shally has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Shally is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Shally from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, particularly candles

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea pertenece al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO” de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene 59 años.  Actualmente, vive en la ciudad de Calca. 

Su principal actividad económica es vender comida en el mercado modelo de Calca. Ya son 10 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Ella requiere el préstamo para la educación de sus hijos.

Andrea se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.   (En la fotografía la socia esta acompañada de su hija Marivel).
texts.en:
Andrea belongs to the commercial bank "Valle Sagrado" (Sacred Valley), which is part of the Asociación Arariwa. She is 59 years old, and currently lives in the city of Calca. Her main economic activity is selling food in the Mercado Modelo in Calca. She has had this business now for 10 years, and it is going very well. She needs a loan to pay for the education of her children. Andrea is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means, and she pledges to make her payments according to the established schedule. (In the photograph she is accompanied by her daughter, Marivel.)

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for the education of her children

loans.name: Nurjamal's Group

texts.en:
All four of this loan group are determined to work hard to succeed in life, because they believe that success must be earned.

Z. Nurjamal leads the group. She is 35 years old and has three children. Her husband provides for the family by doing odd jobs. Nurjamal helps her husband by raising cattle and selling milk. She sees herself as his right hand and assistant in providing for their children. She also believes that her business has a big future, but needs time and financial support, and has applied for a loan to buy some goats. 

Nurjamal’s partners in this loan group are:

K. Akylai, 40, who is married and has five children. Her husband is a shepherd, and together they raise livestock and farm. They will use their portion of this loan to work their field. 

A. Erkayim, 37, is divorced and has a four-year-old son. She makes a living raising livestock which she inherited from her parents. She has a stable income of $140 a month and hopes to use this loan to buy some sheep. 

T. Mubarahan, 47, is married and has five children. Her husband works as a guard in a local school while she raises livestock, sells milk and farms a piece of land. She needs a loan to buy fuel to use to work in her field.  

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and watch a video about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team, which is called Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to help four people expand their small businesses

loans.name: Qoriccoyllor Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORICCOYLLOR”; Nuestros socios viven en el distrito de Huanchac provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es el Sr Americo,  él socio  es secretario del grupo comunal y él se dedica a las construcciones civiles siendo el maestro de obras, Nuestro socio tiene a su cargo personal de trabajo otros obreros que él los contrA. para trabajar en diferentes construcciones y una vez que le pagan a él este les paga a sus operarios obreros, el socio solicita el préstamo para iniciar algunos trabajos y contratar personal. Nuestros otros socios se dedican al servicio de taxis, comerciantes minoristas, trabajadores en construcción.
  
Los socios agradecen y valoran el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “Qoriccoyllor” Communal Bank. They live in the district of Huanchac, province and department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sr. Americo, who serves as the Communal Bank secretary. He works in civil construction as a master builder. Americo is in charge of a staff of workers hired for different construction projects and is responsible for paying them.
