Lyudmila would like to get the above mentioned amount to expand the assortment of goods for the winter season. She wants to purchase warm clothing of different sizes to meet her customer demands. Rich experience in retail, good location of her business at the busy Central Market and variety of clothes for men, women and children will guarantee stable income for Lyudmila. The loan will not only help Lyudmila get good profit and promote growth of her business, but also give her an opportunity to save some money and pay her younger son’s college fees after he enters university this summer.

Людмила Петрівна – одружена. В неї два сини й онук. Старший син – одружений, молодший – закінчує школу цього року. У Людмили Петрівни є кіоск, вона продає одяг на Центральному міському ринку. Людмила Петрівна – оптиміст. Вона вдячна Богу за те, що Він дарував її бізнесу стабільність та успіх. Щирість та унікальна здатність відчувати побажання покупців допомогли їй зберегти постійних клієнтів. Людмила Петрівна співпрацює з „Надією України” вже майже рік. Вона завжди вчасно сплачує позики без жодних прострочень. Людмила Петрівна хотіла б отримати вищевказану суму для того, щоб розширити асортимент одягу під час зимового періоду. Вона хотіла б придбати теплий одяг різних розмірів для того, щоб задовольнити зростаючий попит клієнтів. Багатий досвід в торгівлі, гарне розташування її кіоску на великому Центральному ринку та розмаїття одягу для чоловіків, жінок та дітей гарантують Людмилі Петрівні стабільний прибуток. Позика не тільки допоможе Людмилі Петрівні отримати додатковий прибуток та сприятиме розвитку її бізнесу, але й надасть їй можливість заощадити кошти для того, щоб сплатити за навчання її молодшого сина в університеті.

loans.use: To increase stock for winter season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lizzie Muthoni Mwirikia intends to buy hair drier and some chemicals

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Mrs. Cheng D., 41-year-old mother of 3 children, lives with her husband (pictured here because D. is unavailable) in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She runs a grocery store and typically makes an average of about $5/day in revenue. Her husband, meanwhile, is a motor-taxi driver who usually contributes his daily income to the household. To maximize the size of the business and satisfy her clients' needs, D. is requesting a $1000 loan to purchase more grocery products to increase her inventory and to buy a tuk-tuk (a passenger cart attached to a motorcycle) for her husband to run a business, which makes more money than a motor-taxi business. In the future, D. would like to save sufficient money to own a grocery store with a great variety of products in order to fulfill her clients' needs.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products for her inventory.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary A. is 40 years old and is happily married with eight children. She lives in Ezenchi in Asaba, Delta state, Nigeria. She sells soft drinks, dried fish, and provisions. Mary is requesting a loan of $400 for the purchase of provisions and other foodstuffs for sale in her little grocery store. She started this business last year.

loans.use: To buy provisions & food items for sale

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Mrs. Ros Y., age 48, is a widow who sells porridge to earn $4 per day. She has seven children. One is a student, one works at a factory, one works at a casino, and one is an electrician, and three are married and have left home. In order to maximize the growth of her son’s electrician business, she would like to borrow $1000 to purchase electrical tools, including wires and an electric generator, to meet customer demands.

loans.use: Mrs. Ros Ya would like to purchase electrical tools to expand her son’s electrician business.

loans.name: Ludwin Osay

texts.es:
Ludwin Osay B. J. is 47 years old. He is originally from this town, from Bluefield. He is married and has 5 children, all of whom are either in high school or college. Mister B. is from the creole ethnic group. He's been working in a collective transportation business for four years. This micro-businessman from the coast has monthly contracts to transport 60 students from Monday to Friday of every week from their home to school and back.

However, Ludwin's bus needs a series of replacements and engine maintenance so that he can continue to give this service for a few more years. He wants his bus to be more presentable and comfortable. He needs to purchase two pairs of tires at US $128 each pair, two pairs of retainers at US $12 each pair, two break pads for US $15 each, a set of rear frictions for US $48, and air filter for US $14, a fan clutett for US $80, a water band for $60 and engine maintenance for US $75.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Ludwin Osay B. J. tiene 47 años de edad, es originario de esta ciudad de Bluefields, es casado, tiene 5 hijos, los cuales estudian en secundaria y la universidad. El señor B. es de la etnia creole y se dedica desde hace cuatro años al transporte colectivo (bus) brindando el servicio a estudiantes de dos colegios de secundaria de esta ciudad. Este microempresario costeño tiene contratos mensual de trasladar a 60 estudiantes de Lunes a Viernes de cada semana de su casa al colegio y viceversa. Sin embargo su unidad de servicio (bus) necesita cambiarle una serie de repuestos que el señor Ludwin no tiene en su poder asi como el mantenimiento del motor para que pueda brindar este servicio por unos años mas y poder tener su bus mas presentable y confortable. Necesita comprar 2 pares de llantas a US$ 128 cada par, 2 pares de retenedores a US$ 12 dolares cada par, 2 bombillos de frenos a US$ 15 cada uno, un juego de fricciones traseras a US$ 48 el juego, un filtro de aire a US$ 14 dolares el filtro, un fan clutett en abanico a US$ 80 el fan, una banda de agua a US$ 60 la banda y el mantenimiento al motor con un costo de US 75.

loans.use: To purchase auto parts for his Owerhoul school bus.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Mrs. Irene purchases pig skin and toasts it to sell as dried chicharrón (a dish similar to pork rinds) by the pound. She works alone, and her husband is the cook. She lives in Irpavi Bajo, La Paz; she does not have her own shop, but instead sells door to door and by walking through markets. This is the fourth time she has requested a credit from Impro and the second time they have needed Kiva’s support. Her last payment was paid in full in December, and she is now requesting a new loan. Her history in our institution qualifies her as a first-rate client, with good completion in the payment of her debts. The sum requested will be used for the purchase of ingredients (pig skins). Her work experience and prior credits with Impro allow her access to this credit, and the business’ income is sufficient to covers the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: La señora Irene compra cuero de cerdo y lo hace secar para luego tostarlo y venderlo como chicharrón seco, por libras, trabaja sola, su esposo es cocinero. Vive Irpavi Bajo, en la ciudad de La Paz, no tiene puesto ya que ambula casa por casa, también vende en los mercados ambulando. Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en impro y la segunda vez que requieren el apoyo de Kiva, su última cuota ha sido cancelada en diciembre por lo cual solicita un nuevo crédito. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de insumos (cuero de cerdo). Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of pig skin to prepare chicharrones

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German is a 35 year old experienced mechanic. He makes a living by repairing engines. For the past three years he has been living with his wife Viviana and now have a newborn baby. They own their home which is located near Barrio Universitario Norte UV-78 MZ-3 zona septimo anillo.

German has over 5 years of experience as a mechanic and is well known in this area. He provides maintenance services for diesel and gasoline engines as well as tractors.

German's auto repair shop is located near Avenida San Silvestre, barrio Ferbo, zona Avenida Banzer al Norte KM 4.

The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase more tools for his shop. Specifically a set of wrenches for cars and tractors.

German has obtained numerous loans in order to update his equipment and tools, which he likes to do often. He is a very responsible person and has an excellent credit history with this institution.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

German es un maestro mecánico de 35 años de edad que se dedica al arreglo de motores, actualmente vive a su conyugue la Sra. Viviana desde hace tres años, tienen un hijo que recién nació, viven en su domicilio propio que se encuentra ubicado por el Barrio Universitario Norte UV-78 MZ-3 zona séptimo anillo.

German tiene una experiencia de más de 5 años como mecánico y ya es bastante conocido en su zona, en su taller efectúa trabajos de mantenimiento de motores a gasolina y diesel.

El taller de German se encuentra ubicado por la Avenida San Silvestre barrio Ferbo zona Avenida Banzer al Norte Km 4, en este lugar hace el mantenimiento a vehículos como también a tractores.

El destino de la presente solicitud es para aumentar su stock de herramientas, quiere comprar un juego de llaves para vehículos y tractores.

German siempre está renovando su material de trabajo por lo que saca contínuamente créditos para este efecto, es una persona muy responsable y tiene excelentes antecedentes crediticios en la Institución.

loans.use: To purchase tools

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores, like every woman, has goals and projects she wishes to fulfill, and hers is to be able to amplify her fuel sales business, by offering car washing service. However, this project might not be possible due to the lack of capital she faces and your support could be a determining factor for her being that she requires a sum of money to invest in the purchase of machinery needed for her car washing service. At the same time, this would allow her to make money to invest in her 2 children’s education and the expansion of her small business.

Translated from Spanish by Wendy, Kiva Volunteer

Dolores tiene como toda mujer anhelos y proyectos y el suyo es poder ampliar su negocio de venta de combustibles y brindar otros servicios como el lavado de autos, actividad muy rentable en la zona donde radica.Pero este proyecto podría no ser realizable por el escaso capital con el que cuenta y su apoyo podría ser determinante para Dolores, puesto que requiere de una suma de dinero para invertirlos en la compra de máquinas necesarias para el lavado de autos y empezar a aumentar sus ingresos e invertirlos en la educación de sus 2 hijos y en la consolidación de su pequeño negocio.

loans.use: Compra de máquinas necesarias para empezar a ofrecer un nuevo servicio. <b>Purchase of machines needed to begin to offer a new service.<b>

loans.name: Afoume

texts.en:
Mrs. Afoume S. is 32 years old, is married, and has 3 children. She uses the profits from her sales to help pay for the expenses of her children. Mrs. S. has been selling shoes for about 4 years and hopes to use this loan to buy 10 cartons of shoes to respond to her customers' demands. She hopes to use the profits from her sales to participate further in covering the expenses of her children. Mrs. S.’s boutique is located in a small village about 120 kilometers from Lomé, called Aventonou.

Madame Afoume S. est âgée de 32 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle participe aux dépenses du foyer par les profits qu’elle réalise sur ses ventes. Elle est revendeuses de chaussures depuis plus de 4 ans. Madame S. désire par ce crédit acheter 10 cartons de chaussures pour répondre aux exigences de ses clients et de satisfaire et de participer plus à la prise en charge des charges familiales. La boutique de Madame S. est située dans un petit village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise, appelé Avetonou.

loans.use: To buy 10 cartons of shoes

loans.name: Takia

texts.en:
Takia is 28 years old and is married with 2 children. Takia is a clothes seller. She started her business in 2006. Everyday, she works from 8am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Imuentiyan

texts.en:
Imuentiyan O. trades in bread, groundnuts and butter. She has been in this business since 2001, after learning the trade for three months. She is thirty-five years old, married with three children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

Imuentiyan has been a LAPO client for the past five years. She needs a loan of $525 to buy more bread for sale.

loans.use: To buy more bread for sale.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa M. sells soda. She is married, but her husband's income from fishing is not sufficient for Theresa and their three children. Since demand for her goods is high, Theresa is requesting a loan of $400 to expand the business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Régine

texts.fr:
Régine E. is 34 years old. She is married and has one child. For three years, she has sold sacks of coal, both wholesale and retail, in Assahoun, a village about 50 kilometers from the Togolese capital of Lomé. With this loan, she hopes to buy new sacks of coal in order to increase the scope of her business and to meet the needs of her clients. The profits she earns by her occupation will allow her to help meet the needs of her household. In the photo, Régine is the person on the left. Her younger sister helps her.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning, Kiva Volunteer.

Régine E. est âgée de 34 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle achète et revend depuis 3 ans en gros et en détail des sacs de charbon à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle souhaite par ce crédit acheter de nouveaux sacs de charbon, afin d’augmenter la capacité de son commerce et faire face aux besoins de sa clientèle. Les profits tirés de son activité lui permettront de prendre en charge une partie des besoins de son foyer. dans la photo,Régine est la personne située à gauche. Elle est aidée par sa petite soeur.

loans.use: Purchase of new sacks of coal

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Đào Thị D. is 30 years old. She participated in TYM since 2004. She invests all her loans into her bridal beauty salon. Before joining TYM she did not have capital to invest into her beauty salon so she was having a lot of difficulties because she did not have all the make up products to satisfy her clients's needs. After joining TYM, she has bough all the necessary make up products. Her clientele slowly builds up. She also takes make up classes to perfect her skills. Her salon attracts a lot of new customers since she has all the make up products abd the skills. On top of doing bridal make up, she also rents áo dài for special occasion. Her family income is stable. This round she is requesting a loan of 9.000.000 VND. Her monthly income is around 5.000.000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Đào Thị D. 30 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2004 vay vốn gia đình chị đều đầu tư vào cửa hiệu trang điểm cô dâu. Những năm trưa tham gia vào Quỹ do còn thiếu vốn nên công việc kinh doanh hiệu trang điểm cô dâu của gia đình chị còn gặp nhiều khó khăn, một số các đồ phục vụ cho việc trang điểm chưa đáp ứng được nhu cầu thực tế của xã hội, khi tham gia Quỹ chị đã vay vốn đầu tư mua sắm những đồ cần thiết phục vụ cho trang điểm cô dâu, từ đó cửa hiệu của chị dần dần đáp ứng được nhu cầu số đông khách hàng bản thân chị cũng thường xuyên đi học thêm các lớp đào tạo về trang điểm. Quy mô cửa hàng được nâng cấp tay nghề được nâng cao nên cửa hiệu của chị ngày càng đông khách. Ngoài phục vụ vào các mùa cưới hỏi gia đình chị còn cho thuê áo dài phục vụ các lễ hội. Hiện tai kinh tế gia đình chị tương đối ổn định. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư vào cửa hiệu trang điểm. Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Clothing Sales Group

texts.en:
Fatma  is a widow with 3 children aged 20, 8 and 5 years old. She is  a clothes and snacks seller. Every day, she works  at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

In the past, Fatma has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Fatma is now looking for a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have  businesses dealing with tailoring, snacks sales, juice sales, clothes and shoes sales.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng M. L. is a villager in Kor Village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She owns a small farm where she cultivates rice to earn a living. She now faces a small problem, because her field is infertile. To solve this problem, Mrs. Seng M. L. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support her field and to produce a better crop. 

Her husband, Mr. Phuong Phan, also helps his wife in the business. Mrs. Seng M. L. is 61 years old and the mother of two children who attend the local school. Mrs. Seng M. L. hopes to make her crop more productive.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam es socia del Banco Comunal Totorilla.
Miriam es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos, Miriam vende pescado los días sábados y domingos en el terminal pesquero de la ciudad de Ayacucho, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima a donde viaja cada fin de semana. Además Miriam junto a su esposo tienen una cebichería en la casa de sus suegros, la atención es todos los días.
Miriam necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pescados y para la mejora de su local.
Los sueños de Miriam son tener un local propio, construir su casa y tener una cadena de cebicherías.
texts.en:
Miriam is a member of the communal bank Totorilla. She is 32 years old and lives with her partner and three children. Miriam sells fish on Saturdays and Sundays at the fish market in the city of Ayacucho. She acquires her products in Lima where she travels to every weekend. Miriam also has a "cebicheria" with her husband which is located in her in-laws' home and which requires her daily attention. Miriam needs a loan in the amount of $425 which she will invest in the purchase of fish and in improving her stall. Miriam's dreams are to have her own stall, to build her home and to have a chain of cebicherias.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fish and improve her stall.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the Magnolia Village Bank. Elsa is 35 years old and married with two children. She lives in a rental home in the Conchopata neighborhood. She sells clothing for adults and children as well as shoes; the items she sells varies depending on the requests she receives. She sells to her friends and family members in cash and on credit. Elsa is a teacher, though she is not currently working as a teacher. She plans to use her loan of 3000 PEN to buy toys and clothing for the Christmas season. 
Elsa dreams of having her own store in a fixed location, owning her own home, and providing her children with a good education. 

 Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal  Magnolia. 
Elsa es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Elsa vive en una casa alquilada en el barrio de Conchopata. Elsa vende ropa de niños, adultos, zapatos, dependiendo de los pedidos que tenga, sus ventas los realiza a sus amigos, familiares y al crédito. Además Elsa es docente y por esta temporada no esta trabajando. Elsa tiene proyectado comprar juguetes y ropa de niños y aprovechar la campaña navideña. 
Elsa necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de juguetes y ropa. 
Elsa sueña con tener un negocio propio en un local estable, tener casa propia y sus hijos tengan una buena educación.

loans.use: Buy toys and clothing for the Christmas season

loans.name: Rout Afzal Masih Group

texts.en:
Rout baji is a 43 year old married lady who resides in an area named Kot Radha Kishan in the city of Kasur, Pakistan. Kot Radha Kishan is 24km away from Kasur. She completed her education up to 8th standard but couldn’t study further due to the limited financial resources of her family. Her husband's name is A. M., who is a mason with 20 years of experience. Rout baji has a business of sewing clothes. As we all know, inflation is increasing rapidly in Pakistan and it has become very difficult for a person to support a family. She does this business to help her husband with the finances, so that he is able to meet the financial needs of the family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy another sewing machine to sew more clothes. 

She is a group leader of some more women. Naseem baji and Nasreen baji each want a loan to buy buffalos for their milk selling businesses. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine to sew clothes

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
La señora Noemí Rodríguez  y su esposa el señor Santos Guadalupe son padres de familia tiene cuatro hijos a los cuales quieren darles lo mejor.
 Con dos créditos anteriores con FVP a hecho mejorar a su casa, pero le están haciendo falta las protecciones en ventanas y puertas, ya que fue victima de un robo y quiere la seguridad para sus hijos. 
Solicita este préstamo y planea pagarlo con los ingresos de su trabajo como vendedora de viviendas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Noemí Rodríguez and her husband Mr. Santos Guadalupe are parents of four children to whom they wish to give the very best. With previous loans from FVP they have made home improvements, but they are missing security protection on their windows and doors, and as they were robbed they want security for their children. They are seeking this loan and plan to repay it with their income from her work as a realtor.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add security bars on the windows and doors.

loans.name: Mẫn Thị Hòa Group

texts.vi:
Chị Mẫn Thị H. năm nay 44 tuổi chị đăng ký vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để mua gỗ đóng giường, tủ, bàn ghế. Hiện tại chị giúp con trong việc làm bóng, đánh giấy giáp, cho những bộ bàn ghế mà gia đình chị làm để bán. Hàng ngày chồng chị đi làm thợ xây và một con chị đi làm công nhân nên mức thu nhập của gia đình chị cũng ngày càng ổn định hơn, đồng thời có thêm thu nhập để hoàn trả vốn. Chị rất thích tham gia hình thức vay trả này, vì nhờ có hình thức vay trả và tiết kiệm mà gia đình chị có kế hoạch trong việc chi tiêu. Chị cùng nhóm đã tham gia qua một chu kỳ và hoàn trả rất tốt, nên chu kỳ này chị và nhóm sẽ đăng ký và vay tiếp sang chu kỳ II.
 Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên như sau:
  Anh Nguyễn V. T. năm nay 46 tuổi, anh đăng ký vay mức 5.152.000VNđ để đi chợ mua thóc về xát gạo bán.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị M. năm nay 50 tuổi chị đăng ký vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, vịt.
 Chị Mẫn Thị Luyến năm nay 29 tuổi chị vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để đầu tư vào việc bán hàng ăn sáng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Man Thi Hoa, aged 44, would like to borrow 4.704.000 VND to buy wood to make beds, desks, and chairs. She is currently helping her son in polishing the furniture. Her husband is a construction worker and her other child is a blue-collar worker. The family’s income, as a result, has become much more stable. Mrs. Hoa is very interested in borrowing loan and paying it back in a certain period of time because it has helped her better manage the family’s finances. She and other members in her group have fully paid back the loans in the first round. In the next round of loan, other members in her group include: Mr. Nguyen Van Tai, aged 46, would like to borrow 5.152.000 VND to make and sell rice. Mrs. Nguyen Thi M., aged 50, would like to borrow 4.704.000 VND to raise poultry. Mrs. Man Thi Luyen, aged 29, would like to borrow 4.704.000 VND to make and serve breakfasts for customers.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: vay vốn kinh doanh

loans.name: William,

texts.es:
William es un padre de familia muy trabajador, con tres hijos de nueve y siete años y el último de tan solo tres meses. Hace tres años que cuenta con los préstamos de EDAPROSPO; sin embargo, en su trabajo como mecánico, cerrajero y de planchado de carros, es decir pintado de autos, ya lleva en total diez años, siendo independiente. Anteriormente estuvo trabajando como soldador para una compañía, fue ahí donde tomo la mayoría de sus conocimientos que le sirvieron mas adelante para tener su pequeño taller en su propia casa.

Su esposa es principalmente ama de casa, pero de vez en cuando lo ayuda en el pintado de los autos y ómnibus. En el futuro, ambos, quisieran reunir el capital suficiente para implementar en su pequeño local un taller de factoría.
texts.en:
William is a hard-working father of a family of three children ages 9, 7, and 3 months. 3 years ago he began working with EDAPROSPO; nevertheless in his work as a mechanic, locksmith and auto body repair, in other words, painting cars, he has 10 years of experience as an independent businessman. Previously he worked as a welder for a company and it is there that he learned the majority of his knowledge that has enabled him to subsequently have his small shop in his own home. His wife is primarily a housewife, but every now and then she helps him painting cars and minibuses. In the future both would like to have enough capital in order to open a small factory shop.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Auto shop paint

loans.name: Amani Group

texts.en:
Anaganilye has been a seller of local alcohol in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 4 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 250. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more local alcohol for re-sale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Anaganilye is 33 years old, married, and has two children: ages 14 and 12. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Upendo, who has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more local alcohol for re-sale

loans.name: Siuila

texts.en: Siuuila F., 54, is married with six children.  She has five years of experience in the Plantation business. She sells to the village people and the general public three days per week. She has had three previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala. SPBD loans are Siuuila’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used on the business and also to pay for children school fees.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals and help pay for children's school fees.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchando Por El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Luchando por el Progreso se encuentra en su noveno ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprededoras de la Fundacion Paraguaya.  Están en la zonas de Paiñu y Ñemby. Todas ellas son vecinas que colaboran con el fortalecimiento de su comité y su comunidad. Ellas ya tienen mas de 2 años trabajando con la Fundación Paraguaya y son un grupo fortalecido. Ellas están sacando entre Gs. 1.000.000 las mas antiguas, y 300.000 las nuevas, tienen un ahorro de Gs.2.500.000. La mayoria de ellas son madres solteras y son el sosten de sus familias, madres trabajadoras, que sobresalen con su esfuerzo, son esforsadas en su comité.

Las integrantes son: 

Marta Irene Y..	Venta de ropa.
Juana R..	Venta de frutas y verduras.
Claudia B..	Costurera.
Maria de B..	Venta de merceria
Ilse R.	Venta de ccomidas. .
Analia Y..	Ventas de comestible.
Marcia L..	Venta de lenceria, ropas.
Josefa G..	Venta de verduras y frutas.
Elva P..	Venta de Comidas
Josefina C..	Venta de remedios naturales.
Aurora C..	Venta de ropas.
Miguela C..	Venta de comidas.
Karina G..	Venta de bazar.
Aurora E..	Ventas de calzaqdos nuevos y usados.
Ilsa A..	Venta de dulces.
Celestina B..	Venta de comestibles.
Juana A..	Venta de bebidas.
Maria C..	Venta de articulos de primera necesidad. (despensa)
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Luchando por el Progreso (Women Fighting for Progress) is in its ninth loan cycle in the Entrepreneurial Women program of Fundación Paraguaya. They are located in the areas of Paiñu and Ñemby. They are all neighbors who collaborate with the strength of their group and their community. They have now been working with Fundación Paraguaya for over two years and are a very strong group. The older members are withdrawing 1,000,000 guaranis, and the newer ones 300,000 guaranis. They have a savings of 2,500,000 guaranis. The majority of them are single mothers and are the sole support for their families. These working mothers, who excel through their efforts, are strengthened by their group. The constituents are: Marta Irene Y. - Clothing sales Juana R. - Fruit and vegetable sales Claudia B. - Tailoring Maria de B. - Haberdashery Ilse R. - Food sales Analia Y. - Food sales Marcia L. - Clothing and linen sales Josefa G. - Fruit and vegetable sales Elva P. - Food sales Josefina C. - Natural remedy sales Aurora C. - Clothing sales Miguela C. - Food sales Karina G. - Bazaar Aurora E. - New and used shoe sales Ilsa A. - Candy sales Celestina B. - Food sales Juana A. - Beverage sales Maria C. - Basic goods sales

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Daler

texts.ru: Муазамов Далер Орифович 1984 год рождения .Женат имеет 1 ребёнка ,жена Абдухамитова Манзура .Место жительства г. Истаравшан пос. Курушкада .Клиент работает на СП «Оби Зулол» работником  техники  безопасности уже около 4 лет . Клиент берёт заем 3000 сом. на 11 мес. Он хочет купить автомобиль .Другой доход-клиент сам мастер по ремонту автомобилей .
texts.en:
M. Daler Orifovich was born in 1984. He is married and has 1 child; his wife is Abduhamitova Manzura. His place of residence is the city of Istaravshan, the village Kurushkada. The client has been working at company “Obi Zulol” as a safety worker for around 4 years now. The client is taking out a loan of 3000 somoni. He would like to buy a car. His other income – the client repairs cars.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a car

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca Estela R. V. D. D. D. 48 años, resiD. en San Martín, debido a que su esposo murió hace algunos años y sus hijos son mayores D. edad, ella vive sola. Blanca Estela tiene más D. 24 años D. poseer un bazar en la zona comercial D. San Martín, un lugar muy concurrido, lo cual le ha permitido gozar D. ventas muy estables durante todo estos años. Ella solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder comprar accesorios para confección D. ropa, esto lo hace con el fin D. surtir más su negocio y mejorar sus ganancias, ya que esta es la manera en que ella logra sustentar sus gastos personales.
texts.en:
Blanca Estela Rodriguez is 48 years old and is a widow. As her husband died many years ago and her children are grown, she lives alone. For the past 24 years Blanca Estela has run a stand in the very busy commercial zone of San Martin which has seen a steady sales volume over the years. She is requesting a loan to purchase the supplies she needs for making clothing which she sells in her stand. The loan will allow her to increase her income, which is how she earns her living.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for making clothing

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère de 05 enfants, elle réside dans le quartier d’adidogomé avec sa famille. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes. Elle exerce son commerce dans son quartier et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Actuellement elle veut attirer de nouveaux clients afin d’augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire de tous les jours, elle sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 15 pagnes HITARGET de haute qualité et 15 pagnes VLISCO.
texts.en:
This woman is married and the mother of 5 children. She lives in the Adidogomé neighborhood with her family. She earns a living selling "pagnes" (lengths of brightly patterned African cloth). She sells in her neighborhood and buys her inventory in the big open-air market of Lomé. Presently, she wants to attract new customers so as to earn more money daily, so she is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 15 high-quality Hitarget brand "pagnes" and 15 Vlisco brand "pagnes".

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes" for resale

loans.name: Raim

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Раиму - 50 лет. Женат и отец 4-х детей. Раим работает в хлебном заводе рабочим. Он зарабатывает нормально. Его жена тоже работает в хлебном заводе. Жена печет хлеб. Зарплату жены они тратят на жизнь, а на зарплату Раима планируют провести ремонт. Но им нужна крупная сумма. Поэтому они просят кредит, чтобы сделать ремонт дома, а потом погашать кредит с зарплаты Раима. Второму сыну Раима исполнилось 22 лет, и его собираются женить. До свадьбы Раим и его жена планируют закончить ремонт.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Raim is 40 years old. He is married and is a father of four children. Raim works in a bakery and makes good money. His wife also works there at the baker, she makes bread. The spend his wife salary on their livelihood and plan to use Raim's salary to make a repair. But they need a large amount of money and this is why they are asking for a loan to make repairs at home and then make payment from Raim's salary. Raim's second son has turned 22 and they are preparing to get him married. Raim and his wife plan to finish repairs before the wedding.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make repairs at home

loans.name: Mamur

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Юсупов Мамур мужчина средних лет.У него семья  из 3х детей, жена  дома помогает мужу по откорму скота. У этой семьи  большой опыт по откармливанию и крупного и мелкого скота. Они каждый год закупают  скот в начале весны и целое лето пасут их на пастбище, после чего к осени когда они будут готовы продают их за хорошие деньги. На часть вырученных денег  он готовится на зиму, а на часть он закупает еще и скот.Недавно от своих соседей они узнали про нашу организацию и решили взять кредит.Мамур на полученный займ хочет купить дойную корову.
texts.en:
Mamur U. is a middle-aged man. He has a family of 3 children and wife, who helps him feed livestock at home. His family has an extensive experience in raising cattle and small livestock. Every year, they buy livestock at the beginning of spring and graze it all summer long, and once livestock is ready in the autumn, they sell it for a good price. Mamur uses some of the profits to prepare for the winter and some to purchase more livestock. Mamur and his wife recently learned about our organization from their neighbors and decided to obtain a loan. Mamur wants to purchase a dairy cow with this loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Mr. San Kam Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan, which consists of nineteen people, is located in Preak Ta Kaev village in Kandal province. Mr. San K. is the village bank president and has been selected by the members. He is a fisherman. Since his fisH. is doing well, he wants to expand it by purchasing more fishnets. His wife, Mrs. Chi Hun, is a farmer who owns a small lake to cultivate lotus. Mr. San K. is 53 years old and the father of four children, two of whom are fishermen while the other is attending the local school. Mr. Arn A. does not come to take a loan but his wife does, so she is shown in the picture. 

Seven members in this group loan have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: By purchasing more fishnets.

loans.name: Yakhya

texts.fr: yakhya S. est un societaire de la caisse de baye laye depuis 2006.il est menuisier ebeniste de profession.mais parallelement il exerce une seconde activite axee sur l'aviculture.il sollicite un credit de cent cinquante mille(150 000)frs pour renforcer la quantite d'aliment de betail a stocker et aussi le nombre de sujets a elever.son objectif est d'ameliorer ses benefices pour mieux faire face a ses charges familliales.

loans.use: aviculture

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia G., 52 years old is a rice farmer in Veruela Agusan Del Sur. She has nine children, 15 years old the eldest that are studying. In most cases, she worried a lot how would she budget their limited income and pay everything like the school tution, clothes and their other needs. The farm is really helpful since they no longer buy rice for their food consumption. 

She would like to apply for a loan of Php 8,000 ffrom Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm by buying the farming necessities. receiving this loan is helpful because she doesn't have money to support her business now.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 49 años, es padre soltero y vive con su único hijo de 12 años, quien está estudiando. La casa que habitan es propia. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la ganadería, tiene 50 cabezas de ganado vacuno y 20 becerros, además en la parte posterior de su terreno cuenta con 10 hectáreas de palma aceitera. Lo que le gusta a Jesús de su trabajo es que gracias a su esfuerzo está consiguiendo sus objetivos, sobre todo labora muy arduamente para darle todo lo necesario a su hijo, a quien quiere ver, más adelante, convertido en un profesional. Por otro lado, su negocio le es muy rentable porque sus animales, que en su mayoría son vacas productoras de leche, producen lo suficiente para vender su producto (de 20 a 40 cajas de leche) cada dos días a una empresa lechera. Y la palma también le produce cada 15 días, vendiéndola a una empresa aceitera. 
Con MFP ya tiene 11 préstamos y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que entre todos los integrantes se entienden, son personas tranquilas y muy responsables. Con MFP ya tiene 11 préstamos y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que entre todos los integrantes se entienden, son personas tranquilas y muy responsables.
texts.en:
Jesús, aged 49, is a single father who lives with his only son, aged 12, who attends school. He owns the house in which they live. He has been raising cattle for 20 years. He has 50 cows and 20 calves. In the back of his field he has planted 10 hectares of trees for palm oil production. Jesús likes his work because thanks to his effort and continuous hard work he can meet his goal to provide for everything that his son needs, whom he wants to become a professional worker. On the other hand, his business is highly profitable, because his animals, mainly milk cows, produce enough milk to allow him to sell every second day 20 to 40 boxes of milk to a dairy. And he sells also every fortnight his palm oil to an oil company.

He has had 11 loans with Microfinanzas Prisma. In his communal bank he likes that all the members get along fine and are quiet and very responsible persons.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is fifty one years old. She is divorced and has four children. Currently, all her children are in school. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, and assorted cooking oils. She wants to use the loan to buy an increased stock of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, and other items to expand her business. She believes that with increased income, she will be more capacitated to finance her children’s education and to provide them with life opportunities that are better than what she has had.

loans.use: To purchase assorted groceries in bulk

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is 52 years old and married with 7 children. She sells diesel at retail prices in Benin City, Edo State. She works long hours to make sure that there is enough food on her table to feed her immediate family members. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan amount of 80,000 NGN, which she will use to purchase more diesel to sell. She thanks all of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing more diesel to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Doña Rosa tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil casada, es madre de 08 hijos (04 menores de edad), ella solo ha estudiado hasta el 2do grado de primaria, vive en el  Distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno.

Integra el Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazaret”, desde hace 8 meses, con su primer crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles, compró 02 ovinos mejorados, actualmente se dedica a la compra y venta de ovinos.

Con este crédito de 600.00 nuevos soles, comprará 02 ovinos mejorados, los cuales llevará a vender en las ferias.

Su visión es que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Rosa, 48, is married and has 8 children, 4 of whom are still minors. She only finished second grade and lives in the Llave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She has been a member of the “Jesús de Nazaret” (Jesus of Nazareth) communal bank for 8 months. She used her initial, 500 new sol, loan to buy 2 improved sheep. She is a sheep merchant. With this 600 new sol loan she will buy 2 more improved sheep which she will then sell at the local stock fairs. Her vision is that her children study and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying fertilizer

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
EL señor Fernando Martínez, llego a la ciudad de Barranquilla  a la edad de 21 años, procedente de su pueblo natal, Polonuevo-Regencia, un corregimiento en el Dpto. de Bolívar, para  buscar un mejor porvenir, una vez terminó su bachillerato con el esfuerzo de sus padres. A ellos y sus 5 hermanos agradece todo el apoyo material y afectivo que le brindaron desde que cumplió 4 años de edad cuando sufrió poliomielitis dejándolo con dificultades para movilizarse rápidamente. Hoy teine un hogar conformado por su esposa y sus tres hijos.

Fernando, es un hombre entusiasta y   optimista,   se inició como vendedor de dulces y cigarrillos con un capital que le presto su hermana, y que fue multiplicándolo  poco a poco. Cuando aumentó el volumen de clientes, hizo créditos a prestamistas de la calle, para diversificar el negocio ofreciendo  refrescos, fritos y mekatos, esta financiación le resultaba onerosa y  muchas personas en su barrio, le hablaron de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, fue entonces que inició su relación con esta entidad, y con su primer crédito reemplazó los pasivos costosos. Actualmente se encuentra tramitando un segundo crédito, el cual va a usar para surtir con refrescos dulces y productos derivados de la harina de trigo sus estantes y va a mejorar la infraestructura su negocio con una cubierta, porque en invierno se moja y no tiene tiempo de recoger sus  muebles y enseres.  Sus principales clientes son los operarios de los talleres industriales que funcionan en este sector comercial que es altamente concurrido.

Fernando todos los días agradece a Dios  por el amor de la familia y el apoyo de  instituciones y de todas las personas que han creído en él. Para el futuro espera continuar siendo el eje de su hogar brindándoles  con su esposa, ejemplo y educación a sus 3 hijos.
texts.en:
Fernando Martínez came to the city of Barranquilla at the age of 21 to seek a better future. He is originally from Polonuevo-Regencia, a community in the department of Bolivar. He finished high school with support from his parents. He is grateful to his parents and 5 siblings for the material and emotional support they provided him after he suffered polio when he was 4 years old. He was left with difficulties that prevent him from moving very quickly. He now has his own family with his wife and three children. Fernando is an enthusiastic and optimistic man. He started a business selling sweets and cigarettes with money lent to him by his sister and it has grown, little by little. When he increased his number of customers, he took loans from street lenders to diversify his business of selling soft drinks, fried foods, and sweet breads. This type of financing turned out to be onerous and many people from his neighborhood told him about Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and that was when he began his association with this institution. With his first loan he repaid his previous, expensive loans. He is now requesting a second loan to purchase soft drinks, sweets, bread products, shelving, and he will improve the infrastructure of his business by putting a covering over it, because during the rainy season things get wet and he doesn’t have time to put away his furniture and other belongings. Most of his customers are workers in the industrial workshops that fill this busy commercial area of town. Fernando thanks God every day for the love of his family and the support of the institutions and all of the people who have believed in him. For the future, he hopes to continue being the pillar of strength for his household and, along with his wife, to provide a good example for his 3 children and to give them an education.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, sweets, bread products, shelving, and a tarp to cover his business location.

loans.name: Ida María

texts.es:
Ida Maria  es socia del  Banco Comunal Mujeres Solidarias se reúnen cada quince días en casa de una de las socias en las afueras de la ciudad de Portoviejo. 

Ida Maria se dedicada a la venta de ropa desde hace tres años, toma los pedidos de sus clientes  recorriendo su sector de residencia, una vez que termina de entregar los pedidos  reúne parte del dinero y  viaja a la ciudad de Guayaquil donde adquiere la mercadería a los distribuidores directos.

Nuestra socia cuenta con la ayuda de su hija soltera en  la toma de pedidos mientras que sus otros hijos ya son casados e independientes, ella se separo hace algún tiempo de su esposo  y a pesar de todos los desafíos que le ha tocado enfrentarse no ha dejado de seguir adelante, uno de sus sueños es ponerse una panadería ya que en el sector no hay  y sería una gran oportunidad de trabajo.

Con este nuevo préstamo ella comprará pantalones, camisas, blusas, interiores para damas, caballeros y niños  pues ya cuenta con varios pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ida Maria is a member of the community bank Mujeres Solidarias ("Supportive Women"). They meet every 15 days in the home of one of the members on the outskirts of the city of Portoviejo.

Ida Maria has been selling clothing for three years. She takes orders from her customers by traveling through her neighborhood, and when she finishes delivering the orders, she collects some of the money and travels to the city of Guayaquil where she buys the merchandise from the distributors directly.

Our member counts on the help of her single daughter, who takes the orders, since her other children are already married and living independently. She separated from her husband some time ago, and in spite of all of the challenges she has faced, she hasn't given up on getting ahead. One of her dreams is to start a bakery since there isn't one in her region, and it would be a great working opportunity.

With this new loan, she will buy pants, shirts, blouses, underwear for women, men, and children, which are the different requests from her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, blouses, and underwear for women, men, and children

loans.name: Khwaja Muainudin

texts.en:
K. Muainudin is the son of K. A.. An educated and married man, he is hardworking and busy in his retail food shop. He has been involved in this business for more then five years. He wants to expend and enlarge his business. And he wants to help build a better future for his children.

Therefore, he has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghanis to start buying more food and some necessary things for his retail food shop. He would like to thank all lenders, Kiva and AFS in Afghanistan.

loans.use: He wants to buy more food for his shop

loans.name: María Benita

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, la señora María Benita T. se ha dedicado a su actividad de venta de lácteos tales como leche, cuajada y crema ofrecida a diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana donde son colocadas en un balde para exhibición a las personas.
Ella atraviesa una necesidad y es la que no posee los lácteos por lo que debe de adquirirlos lo más pronto posible para comercializarlos y así llevar a cabo el mantenimiento de su hogar. Es este el motivo por el cual solicita un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar el queso, la cuajada y crema.
texts.en:
In the department of Chinandega, Mrs. María Benita T. has been selling dairy products such as milk, milk curds, and cream. Every morning very early, she places her products in buckets for people to see. She does not have raw materials at the moment, so she needs to purchase them as soon as possible to continue selling her products and in that way support her family. This is why she is requesting a loan - to buy the raw materials (milk) in order to make cheese, cream, and milk curds.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying milk to make dairy products

loans.name: Mayela

texts.es:
Mayela A. F., tiene la edad de 33 años, está casada, vive con su esposo y con su hijo de 9 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para hacer mejoras en su finca, ella desea realizar unos trabajos en la finca, comprar algunos materiales y aumentar su área de cultivos, para lograr que los mismos produzcan más. La idea es mejorar y aumentar la capacidad de producción y aumentar el área del cultivo.  Doña Mayela cuenta con área de diversos cultivos en producción tal es el caso del cultivo del café, además cuenta con algunos animales (ganado). Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento y lograr una mejor calidad y  obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de su cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Ella espera en un futuro mejorar su calidad de vida y tener una mayor estabilidad económica, y así poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Mayela A. Fernandez is 33 years old, married, and lives with her husband and their 9-year-old son. She would like this loan in order to make improvements to her farm. She wants to carry out a few projects on her farm, purchase some materials, and expand her cultivation area. The idea is to improve and increase the production capacity of this area. Mayela has a diverse range of crops, such as coffee, and she also has some livestock. She wishes to give them adequate maintenance and achieve a better quality, to obtain the greatest possible income when it is time for the harvest. This is the first time that she has requested a loan through FUDECOSUR and is very content because it has made things easier for her. In the future, she hopes to improve her quality of life and have greater economic stability, and in this way continue growing as a person and a producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make improvements to her farm

loans.name: Densmaa

texts.en: Densmaa is 51 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Govi-Altay province in western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. They have been living in their current home since 2007. Densmaa's husband, Shaariibuu, is retired and her daughter helps Densmaa operate the family's small cafe, which she has been running since 2000. She has steadily built up her business over the years and has gained much experience as a businesswoman. Densmaa previously received a 300,000 tugrug (~211 USD) loan from XacBank's partner bank in order to increase her working capital. As a result, she was able to purchase a new ger for her other children who live on their own. Densmaa is focused on the future and says, “I would like to purchase a car for my daughter next year.” Densmaa is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~ 705 USD) loan to purchase a large amount of meat for her cafe.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of meat

loans.name: Justus

texts.en: Justus is a 29 year old single man. He runs a general merchandise shop where he sells sugar, soaps, cooking fat and maize flour to earn a living. He has been in this business for four years and has one employee. He also practices farming and plumbing to improve his living conditions. He hopes to expand his business and improve his living standards in the future.  He has requested for a loan of kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to stock more maize flour, sugar, salt and cooking fat.

loans.use: To add stock of sugar, maize flour and salt

loans.name: Ma. Priscilla

texts.en:
Ma. Priscilla A. is from the town of Concepcion, Tarlac. She is 40 years old, married and has 2 infants. Ma. Priscilla owns and operates a business making and selling cooked food for daily meals. Ma. Priscilla has been involved in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Ma. Priscilla joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Priscilla is requesting her first loan, of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Mujeres En Victoria 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Devora is the coordinator of her group Mujeres en Victoria 1,2 (Women of Victoria), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the Samana peninsuL., a lush, rugged isthmus with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and her child.

Devora is excited to be taking her tenth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a small cafeteria, by purchasing the necessary sugar, coffee, salt, and rice, as well as investing in a freezer. She will use the profits to purchase plates for her home as well as invest in the education of her child by purchasing school supplies and a computer. Additionally, she would like to take her family out to eat ice cream more often. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy sugar, coffee, rice, salt, and a freezer.

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en:
Carolyn is a 35-year-old lady. She is the single mother of one 8-year-old child who goes to school. She operates a tailoring and dressmaking business in Nairobi, a business that she has been running since 2002. She hopes to create more job opportunities for many other Kenyans by employing them in her expanded business in the future; currently, she employs three people. 

She has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to add stock of fabric for dressmaking. She also desires to build a residential house of her own and provide a good-quality education for her son. She is the treasurer of her group and describes herself as hardworking, visionary and committed.

loans.use: To add stock of fabric

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Mr. Seng U., 45 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sida Kao (both shown in the photo), 38 years old, have been married since 1988. They have five children: three sons and two daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, one is a garment factory worker, two attend school and another one is still young. They are living along national road number one, about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Seng and his wife are farmers. They grow rice and vegetables on their farmland in the village. But, the couple does not have enough capital to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to maintain their rice and vegetable farm and to pay for plowing fees.  

Hence Seng is asking for his first of $1,200 to help his capital.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice and vegetable farm and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Adama BA est une femme de 31 ans, elle mariée et mère de 02 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BAKIDIOTO depuis le 12 décembre 2006 et a 9 fois de suite reçu de crédits. Avec l'implantation de CAURIE-MF dans son village, elle a commencé commencé à initier une activité par la vente du thé, sucre, cigarette, allumettes etc. Au bout de quatre ans, elle a construit un local où elle vend divers produits et denrées de consommation. Les profits qu'elle génère lui permettent d'aider son mari sur les charges familiales nourriture et éducation des enfants elle souhaite également renforcer le capital de sa boutique qu'elle gère depuis qu'elle est membre du Banc Villageois. Elle souhaiterait faire plus de revenus afin de pouvoir prendre en charge l'éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Adama BA is a 31-year old woman, married and the mother of two dependent children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Bakdioto since December 12, 2006, and obtained loans nine times since joining. After the Caurie Microfinance institution started operating in her village, she launched an enterprise selling tea, sugar, cigarettes, matches etc. After four years, she was able to have a store built, where she sells different products and foodstuffs. The income generated through the store allows her to help her husband take care of the family expenses, such as food and education of their children. She would also like to bolster the business capital of the store she has been running since joining Banc Villageois. She would like to increase her income in order to be able to provide for her children’s education.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolster her investment capital in order to expand her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more new movies for her mini-cinema

loans.name: Genivie

texts.en:
Genivie A. is from the village of Basag, San Carlos, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 33 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Genivie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Genivie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Genivie joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Genivie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Futuro y lo que mas le agrada es la facilidad del préstamo y el ahorro.
Rosa es viuda y tiene 6 hijos, Rosa tiene un puesto en el mercado Magdalena en donde vende carne, actividad que realiza todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta la tarde.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de carne de res y cerdo.
Rosa sueña con mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the “Futuro” (Future) communal bank. What she likes best is the ease of payments and the savings. Rosa is a widow and has 6 children. She has a stand in Magdalena Market where she sells meat every day from 7am until late afternoon. Rosa needs a 2000 sol loan to buy beef and pork. She dreams with improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beef and pork.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia lives in the small city of Kasur in Punjab province, Pakistan. Kasur is near to Lahore and famous for its leather industry. Safia is 58 years old and the mother of two sons. Both sons have left their education and started work. Both do different kinds of job to support the family financially. Safia's husband does manual labor, but at the old age of 60 it is very difficult for him to do such a tough job. However, in order to put three meals on the table he has no other option but to work.
Safia has an embroidery business. She is very good at her work and has more than 30 years' experience. Her work is very popular among her customers and she receives regular orders to make embroidered dresses.
Safia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her son who wants to buy kites for his kite-selling business. He supplies kites to customers in his local city as well as other cities, particularly Lahore. He has run this business for the last eight years and it brings a good profit. Flying kites is a popular sport in Pakistan, particularly at Basant festival. During this festival, people from all over the world come to Lahore to enjoy flying kites.
Safia is hopeful that by investing in her son’s business he will be able to make extra income each month as a result of improvements in his business. Safia is a regular loan user of Asasah and is on her fourth loan.

loans.use: To purchase kites for resale

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PADRE URRACA”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Margarita; tiene 45 años de edad y es madre soltera, ella tiene 3 hijos  trabaja en el Centro Médico Sr. De Huanca en el barrio de Santiago, La socia tiene su consultorio de medicina y ella desea implementar sus instrumentales solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de instrumental médico.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the "Padre Urraca" communal bank, situated in the Huanchac district of Cusco province. Margarita is 45 years old, and is a single mother of 3 children. She works in the Sr. De Huanca Medical Centre in the Santiago neighbourhood. She has her own medical practice and wishes to replace her surgical instruments. She is seeking the loan to invest in the purchase of these instruments. She is grateful for the loan offered by this organisation and vows to complete her repayments as scheduled.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy surgical instruments

loans.name: Sarly

texts.en:
Sarly is a 44-year-old single mother of two who lives with her children in San Rafael Abajo, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. Sarly runs a hair salon where she offers services such as styling, dying, cutting, curling, etc. She also sells hair products including items for the treatment of unhealthy hair. She hopes to use this loan to finance the purchase of various hair products, both for sale and to use while carrying out salon services. 

Sarly wakes up early and walks one hour to work from home. When she arrives, she attends to her clients with appointments first. In a good month, she serves between three and five clients.

Sarly´s long term goal is to remodel her salon. By increasing the physical size of her business, she hopes to attract more clients and to hire some help. Her main obstacle is the high level of competition which exists in the area for the services Sarly offers. Additionally, robberies are not uncommon.

loans.use: For the purchase of hair products

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
la señora Maria del Carmen O. G. tiene 58 años de edad, vive en la Colonia San Francisco de la ciudad e San Lorenzo, tiene 5 años de residir en este domicilio y se dedica a la compra y venta de lacteos como ser queso seco, semi seco, ahumado, fresco, quesillo y mantequilla, dichos porductos los vende a sus clientes mayoristas y al detalle.
el credito lo utilizara para invertirlos en su negocio para la compra de mas productos lacteos y asi poder mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
las ventas han mejorado y sus clientes le hacen pedidos grandes y no puede cubrir con las necesidades de todos sus clientes es por esa razon que necesita comprar mas lacteos.
texts.en:
Maria Del Carmen O. G. is 58 years old and she lives in the community of San Francisco in the city of San Lorenzo. She has lived for the past 5 years in the same location and her business is buying and selling milk products such as dried cheeses, fresh cheese, smoked cheese, cottage cheese, and butter. She sells her products to wholesalers but she also sells retail. The loan will be used to invest in the business, to purchase more milk products and to improve her income and their quality of life. 

Sales have been improving and her clients are placing large orders and she is unable to meet the demand of all of her clients. She needs to purchase more goods.

loans.use: To purchase cheeses and butter.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase additional materials

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel P. is from the village of Panay, Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 25 years old. Miguel is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Miguel owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from these services. Miguel has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Miguel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Miguel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Miguel is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the tenth loan taken out by Miguel from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Cristhian

texts.es:
El Sr. Cristhian es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, tiene 21 años, es soltero, hijo único y vive con su madre.

              Se dedica  a la venta de frazadas y colchas por la ciudad de La Colmena y sus compañías hace 3 años, su madre se dedica al mismo rubro.
 Cuenta con más de 60 clientes y comenta que tiene un buen ingreso ya que el mismo administra su negocio.
                Solicita el préstamo para la compra de colchas, frazadas.
texts.en:
Cristhian is from the town of Carapeguá.  He is 21 years old and single.  He is an only child and lives with his mother.

Cristhian has been selling blankets and bedspreads in the town of La Colmena and to his friends for three years.  His mother is in the same business.

He has more than 60 customers and he comments that he makes a good income since he runs his own business.

He is requesting his loan to buy bedspreads and blankets.

loans.use: To buy bedspreads, blankets, hammocks, quilts and other handicrafts

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth M. is a 41-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures. She sells eggs and food, and she also drives a pedicab. She lives in Brgy. Cogon, Cordova, Cebu City. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 9,000 PHP. Elizabeth is now borrowing 11,000 PHP so that she can purchase additional inventory to sell. This will be her fourth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 9,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Elizabeth aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Idayatkan's Group

texts.en:
Idayatkan B. has a traditionally large family of 5 children. Today all of those children are married, have their own families and daily chores, and live separately from parents.

Eleven years ago, the family decided to increase their budget using profits from breeding cattle. This business is now rather stable and provides a regular income from selling sheep and cows. These earnings have provided the opportunity to arrange their children’s weddings and prepare dowries for their daughters.

In order to improve the family's well-being, Idayatkan would like to increase their total number of farm animals and develop the business. This plan requires a certain amount of money, and for this reason the family hopes to receive a loan. In the future they would like to build a new shed in order to improve conditions in which they keep their cattle.

	--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Karamathon's Group

texts.en:
Karamathon S. is the leader of this group. She is 65 and married. Her husband is retired and receives a monthly pension of 2,500 soms. Together they raised three sons and a daughter. The sons are working in construction and the daughter is in Russia. Karamathon and her husband are engaged in livestock breeding.  By reselling the livestock animals after fattening, they earn 5,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, the family wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future, Karamathon wants to purchase a piece of land and start building a house for her older son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Haldardjan

texts.en:
Haldardjan I., 60, lives with his family in Tashkiya village. He has three sons and one daughter, who was adopted from an orphanage by his family and became the light of their life. Haldardjan is known as a hard-working and energetic person.

Haldardjan was born into a low-income farm worker’s family and from early childhood helped his parents in farming. Gaining a wide experience in stockmanship, he started his cattle breeding business ten years ago and it became the main source of income for his family.
